SCENE.--Messina.


ACT I. Scene I.
An orchard Leonato's house.

Enter Leonato (Governor Messina), Hero (his Daughter),
and Beatrice (his Niece), Messenger.

  Leon. learn letter Pedro Arragon this
    night Messina.
  Mess. this. leagues I
    left him.
  Leon. gentlemen lost action?
  Mess. sort, name.
  Leon. victory achiever brings home full
    numbers. find Pedro hath bestowed honour on
    young Florentine called Claudio.
  Mess. deserv'd part, equally rememb'red Don
    Pedro. hath borne promise age, doing
    figure lamb feats lion. hath indeed
    bett'red expectation expect tell
    how.
  Leon. hath uncle Messina glad it.
  Mess. delivered letters, appears  
    joy him; joy show modest
    badge bitterness.
  Leon. break tears?
  Mess. great measure.
  Leon. kind overflow kindness. faces truer than
    wash'd. weep joy
    joy weeping!
  Beat. pray you, Signior Mountanto return'd wars no?
  Mess. name, lady. the
    army sort.
  Leon. for, niece?
  Hero. cousin means Signior Benedick Padua.
  Mess. O, return'd, pleasant was.
  Beat. set bills Messina challeng'd Cupid at
    flight, uncle's fool, reading challenge,
    subscrib'd Cupid challeng'd burbolt. pray
    you, hath kill'd eaten wars? how
    hath kill'd? promised eat his
    killing.
  Leon. Faith, niece, tax Signior Benedick much;  
    meet you, doubt not.
  Mess. hath good service, lady, wars.
  Beat. musty victual, hath holp eat it. a
    valiant trencherman; hath excellent stomach.
  Mess. good soldier too, lady.
  Beat. good soldier lady; lord?
  Mess. lord lord, man man; stuff'd honourable
    virtues.
  Beat. indeed. stuff'd man; for
    stuffing--well, mortal.
  Leon. not, sir, mistake niece. kind merry
    war betwixt Signior Benedick her. meet there's
    skirmish wit them.
  Beat. Alas, that! conflict of
    wits halting off, man govern'd
    one; wit warm, let
    bear difference horse; for
    wealth hath left reasonable
    creature. companion now? hath month new
    sworn brother.  
  Mess. Is't possible?
  Beat. easily possible. wears faith fashion
    hat; block.
  Mess. see, lady, gentleman books.
  Beat. No. were, burn study. pray you, is
    companion? young squarer make a
    voyage devil?
  Mess. company noble Claudio.
  Beat. O Lord, hang disease! sooner
    caught pestilence, taker runs presently mad. God
    noble Claudio! caught Benedick, will
    cost thousand pound ere 'a cured.
  Mess. hold friends you, lady.
  Beat. Do, good friend.
  Leon. run mad, niece.
  Beat. No, till hot January.
  Mess. Pedro approach'd.

  Enter Pedro, Claudio, Benedick, Balthasar, John Bastard.
  
  Pedro. Good Signior Leonato, meet trouble? The
    fashion world avoid cost, encounter it.
  Leon. trouble house likeness Grace;
    trouble gone, comfort remain; depart
    me, sorrow abides happiness takes leave.
  Pedro. embrace charge willingly. your
    daughter.
  Leon. mother hath times told so.
  Bene. doubt, sir, ask'd her?
  Leon. Signior Benedick, no; child.
  Pedro. full, Benedick. guess you
    are, man. lady fathers herself. happy, lady;
    honourable father.
  Bene. Signior Leonato father, head
    shoulders Messina, is.
  Beat. talking, Signior Benedick.
    marks you.
  Bene. What, dear Lady Disdain! living?
  Beat. Disdain die hath meet
    food feed Signior Benedick? Courtesy convert  
    disdain presence.
  Bene. courtesy turncoat. loved of
    ladies, excepted; find my
    heart hard heart, love none.
  Beat. dear happiness women! troubled
    pernicious suitor. God cold blood, of
    humour that. hear dog bark crow
    man swear loves me.
  Bene. God ladyship mind! gentleman
    scape predestinate scratch'd face.
  Beat. Scratching make worse 'twere face as
    were.
  Bene. Well, rare parrot-teacher.
  Beat. bird tongue beast yours.
  Bene. horse speed tongue, good a
    continuer. way, God's name! done.
  Beat. end jade's trick. old.
  Pedro. sum all, Leonato. Signior Claudio Signior
    Benedick, dear friend Leonato hath invited all. him
    stay month, heartly prays  
    occasion detain longer. dare swear no
    hypocrite, prays heart.
  Leon. swear, lord, forsworn. [To Don
    John] bid welcome, lord. reconciled the
    Prince brother, owe duty.
  John. you. words, you.
  Leon. Grace lead on?
  Pedro. hand, Leonato. together.
                            Exeunt. Manent Benedick Claudio.
  Claud. Benedick, didst thou note daughter Signior Leonato?
  Bene. noted not, look'd her.
  Claud. modest young lady?
  Bene. question me, honest man do, simple
    true judgment? speak custom, as
    professed tyrant sex?
  Claud. No. pray thee speak sober judgment.
  Bene. Why, i' faith, methinks low high praise,
    brown fair praise, great praise.
    commendation afford her, other
    is, unhandsome,  
    is, her.
  Claud. Thou thinkest sport. pray thee how
    thou lik'st her.
  Bene. buy her, enquire her?
  Claud. world buy jewel?
  Bene. Yea, case put into. speak sad
    brow? play flouting Jack, Cupid a
    good hare-finder Vulcan rare carpenter? Come, key
    man song?
  Claud. mine eye sweetest lady look'd on.
  Bene. spectacles, matter.
    cousin, possess'd fury,exceeds
    beauty doth of
    December. hope intent turn husband, have
    you?
  Claud. scarce trust myself, sworn the
    contrary, Hero wife.
  Bene. Is't this? faith, hath world man but
    wear cap suspicion? a
    bachelor threescore again? to, i' faith! thou wilt  
    thrust thy neck yoke, wear print sigh away
    Sundays.

                       Enter Pedro.

    Look! Pedro returned seek you.
  Pedro. secret hath held here, to
    Leonato's?
  Bene. Grace constrain tell.
  Pedro. charge thee thy allegiance.
  Bene. hear, Count Claudio. secret dumb man, I
    so; but, allegiance--mark this-on
    allegiance! love. who? Grace's
    part. Mark short answer is: Hero, Leonato's short
    daughter.
  Claud. so, utt'red.
  Bene. tale, lord: 'It so, 'twas so;
    indeed, God forbid so!'
  Claud. passion change shortly, God forbid be
    otherwise.  
  Pedro. Amen, love her; lady worthy.
  Claud. speak fetch in, lord.
  Pedro. troth, speak thought.
  Claud. And, faith, lord, spoke mine.
  Bene. And, faiths troths, lord, spoke mine.
  Claud. love her, feel.
  Pedro. worthy, know.
  Bene. feel loved, she
    worthy, opinion fire melt me.
    die stake.
  Pedro. Thou wast obstinate heretic of
    beauty.
  Claud. maintain part force his
    will.
  Bene. woman conceived me, her; brought me
    up, likewise give humble thanks; have
    rechate winded forehead, hang bugle invisible
    baldrick, women pardon me. them
    wrong mistrust any, trust
    none; fine (for finer),  
    live bachelor.
  Pedro. thee, ere die, pale love.
  Bene. anger, sickness, hunger, lord; with
    love. Prove lose blood love get
    drinking, pick mine eyes ballad-maker's pen
    hang door brothel house sign of
    blind Cupid.
  Pedro. Well, thou dost fall faith, thou wilt
    prove notable argument.
  Bene. do, hang bottle cat shoot me; and
    hits me, clapp'd shoulder call'd
    Adam.
  Pedro. Well, time try.
    'In time savage bull doth bear yoke.'
  Bene. savage bull may; Benedick bear
    it, pluck bull's horns set forehead, and
    vilely painted, great letters write
    'Here good horse hire,' signify sign
    'Here Benedick married man.'
  Claud. happen, thou wouldst horn-mad.  
  Pedro. Nay, Cupid spent quiver Venice, thou
    wilt quake shortly.
  Bene. earthquake then.
  Pedro. Well, temporize hours. meantime,
    good Signior Benedick, repair Leonato's, commend and
    fail supper; hath made
    great preparation.
  Bene. matter embassage; and
    commit you--
  Claud. tuition God. house--if it--
  Pedro. sixth July. loving friend, Benedick.
  Bene. Nay, mock not, mock not. body discourse is
    guarded fragments, guards slightly
    basted neither. Ere flout ends further, examine
    conscience. leave you.                   Exit.
  Claud. liege, Highness good.
  Pedro. love thine teach. Teach how,
    thou shalt apt learn
    hard lesson thee good.
  Claud. Hath Leonato son, lord?  
  Pedro. child Hero; heir.
    Dost thou affect her, Claudio?
  Claud.O lord,
    onward ended action,
    look'd soldier's eye,
    lik'd, rougher task hand
    drive liking love;
    return'd war-thoughts
    left places vacant, rooms
    thronging soft delicate desires,
    prompting fair young Hero is,
    lik'd ere wars.
  Pedro. Thou wilt lover presently
    tire hearer book words.
    thou dost love fair Hero, cherish it,
    break father,
    thou shalt her. Wast end
    thou began'st twist fine story?
  Claud. sweetly minister love,
    love's grief complexion!  
    liking sudden seem,
    salv'd longer treatise.
  Pedro. bridge broader flood?
    fairest grant necessity.
    Look, serve fit. 'Tis once, thou lovest,
    fit thee remedy.
    revelling to-night.
    assume thy part disguise
    fair Hero Claudio,
    bosom unclasp heart
    hearing prisoner force
    strong encounter amorous tale.
    father break,
    conclusion is, thine.
    practice put presently.                 Exeunt.




Scene II.
A room Leonato's house.

Enter [at door] Leonato [at door, Antonio] man,
brother Leonato.

  Leon. now, brother? cousin son? Hath he
    provided music?
  Ant. busy it. But, brother, strange
    news dreamt of.
  Leon. good?
  Ant. event stamps them; good cover, they
    show outward. Prince Count Claudio, walking a
    thick-pleached alley mine orchard, overheard by
    man mine: Prince discovered Claudio loved my
    niece daughter meant acknowledge night a
    dance, found accordant, meant the
    present time top instantly break it.
  Leon. Hath fellow wit told this?
  Ant. good sharp fellow. send him, question him
    yourself.
  Leon. No, no. hold dream till itself;  
    acquaint daughter withal, better
    prepared answer, peradventure true. and
    it.                              [Exit Antonio.]

         [Enter Antonio's Son Musician, others.]

    [To Son] Cousin, do.
    --[To Musician] O, cry mercy, friend. me,
    skill.--Good cousin, care busy
    time.                                                Exeunt.




Scene III.
Another room Leonato's house.]

Enter Sir John Bastard Conrade, companion.

  Con. goodyear, lord! measure
    sad?
  John. measure occasion breeds; therefore
    sadness limit.
  Con. hear reason.
  John. heard it, blessings brings it?
  Con. present remedy, patient sufferance.
  John. thou (being, thou say'st thou art, born
    Saturn) goest apply moral medicine a
    mortifying mischief. hide am: sad when
    cause, smile man's jests; eat have
    stomach, wait man's leisure; sleep drowsy,
    tend man's business; laugh merry, claw no
    man humour.
  Con. Yea, make full show till may
    controlment. late stood against
    brother, hath ta'en newly grace,  
    impossible true root fair
    weather make yourself. needful frame the
    season harvest.
  John. canker hedge rose grace,
    fits blood disdain'd to
    fashion carriage rob love any. this, cannot
    flattering honest man, denied but
    plain-dealing villain. trusted muzzle and
    enfranchis'd clog; decreed sing in
    cage. mouth, bite; liberty, I
    liking. meantime am, seek
    alter me.
  Con. make discontent?
  John. make it, only.

                       Enter Borachio.

    here? news, Borachio?
  Bora. yonder great supper. Prince brother is
    royally entertain'd Leonato, give intelligence  
    intended marriage.
  John. serve model build mischief on?
    fool betroths unquietness?
  Bora. Marry, brother's hand.
  John. Who? exquisite Claudio?
  Bora. he.
  John. proper squire! who? who? he?
  Bora. Marry, Hero, daughter heir Leonato.
  John. forward March-chick! this?
  Bora. entertain'd perfumer, smoking musty
    room, Prince Claudio, hand hand sad
    conference. whipt arras heard agreed
    Prince woo Hero himself, having
    obtain'd her, give Count Claudio.
  John. Come, come, thither. prove food my
    displeasure. young start-up hath glory my
    overthrow. cross way, bless way.
    sure, assist me?
  Con. death, lord.
  John. great supper. cheer greater  
    subdued. cook o' mind! prove
    done?
  Bora. wait lordship.
                                                         Exeunt.




<<THIS ELECTRONIC VERSION COMPLETE WORKS WILLIAM

ACT II. Scene I.
A hall Leonato's house.

Enter Leonato, [Antonio] Brother, Hero Daughter,
and Beatrice Niece, Kinsman; [also Margaret Ursula].

  Leon. Count John supper?
  Ant. not.
  Beat. tartly gentleman looks! am
    heart-burn'd hour after.
  Hero. melancholy disposition.
  Beat. excellent man made midway
    Benedick. image says
    nothing, lady's eldest son, evermore
    tattling.
  Leon. half Signior Benedick's tongue Count John's mouth,
    half Count John's melancholy Signior Benedick's face--
  Beat. good leg good foot, uncle, money in
    purse, man win woman world--if 'a
    good will.
  Leon. troth, niece, thou wilt thee husband if
    thou shrewd thy tongue.  
  Ant. faith, curst.
  Beat. curst curst. lessen God's sending
    way, said, 'God sends curst cow short horns,'
    cow curst sends none.
  Leon. So, curst, God send horns.
  Beat. Just, send husband; blessing am
    knees morning evening. Lord, not
    endure husband beard face. lie in
    woollen!
  Leon. light husband hath beard.
  Beat. him? dress apparel make
    waiting gentlewoman? hath beard a
    youth, hath beard man; that
    youth me; a
    man, him. sixpence in
    earnest berrord lead apes hell.
  Leon. then, hell?
  Beat. No; gate, devil meet an
    cuckold horns head, 'Get heaven,
    Beatrice, heaven. place maids.'  
    deliver apes, Saint Peter--for heavens.
    shows bachelors sit, live merry
    day long.
  Ant. [to Hero] Well, niece, trust rul'd your
    father.
  Beat. faith. cousin's duty make cursy say,
    'Father, you.' that, cousin, him
    handsome fellow, make cursy, say,
    'Father, me.'
  Leon. Well, niece, hope day fitted husband.
  Beat. till God make men metal earth. Would
    grieve woman overmaster'd piece valiant
    dust? make account life clod wayward marl?
    No, uncle, none. Adam's sons brethren, I
    hold sin match kinred.
  Leon. Daughter, remember told you. Prince solicit
    kind, answer.
  Beat. fault music, cousin, wooed
    good time. Prince important, is
    measure everything, dance answer. For, hear me,  
    Hero: wooing, wedding, repenting Scotch jig, a
    measure, cinque-pace: suit hot hasty like
    Scotch jig--and full fantastical; wedding, mannerly
    modest, measure, full state ancientry; comes
    Repentance bad legs falls cinque-pace
    faster faster, till sink grave.
  Leon. Cousin, apprehend passing shrewdly.
  Beat. good eye, uncle; church daylight.
  Leon. revellers ent'ring, brother. Make good room.
                                                 [Exit Antonio.]

    Enter, [masked,] Pedro, Claudio, Benedick, Balthasar.
       [With enter Antonio, masked. enter]
       John [and Borachio (without masks), stand aside
                 dance].

  Pedro. Lady, walk bout friend?
  Hero. walk softly sweetly nothing,
    walk; walk away.
  Pedro. company?  
  Hero. please.
  Pedro. so?
  Hero. favour, God defend lute be
    case!
  Pedro. visor Philemon's roof; house Jove.
  Hero. then, visor thatch'd.
  Pedro. Speak low speak love.         [Takes aside.]
  Balth. Well, me.
  Marg. sake, ill
    qualities.
  Balth. one?
  Marg. prayers aloud.
  Balth. love better. hearers cry Amen.
  Marg. God match good dancer!
  Balth. Amen.
  Marg. God sight dance done!
    Answer, clerk.
  Balth. words. clerk answered.
                                              [Takes aside.]
  Urs. enough. Signior Antonio.  
  Ant. word, not.
  Urs. waggling head.
  Ant. true, counterfeit him.
  Urs. ill-well very
    man. dry hand down. he, he!
  Ant. word, not.
  Urs. Come, come, excellent
    wit? virtue hide itself? to, mum he. Graces will
    appear, end.              [ step aside.]
  Beat. told so?
  Bene. No, pardon me.
  Beat. are?
  Bene. now.
  Beat. disdainful, good wit the
    'Hundred Merry Tales.' Well, Signior Benedick said
    so.
  Bene. he?
  Beat. enough.
  Bene. I, me.
  Beat. make laugh?  
  Bene. pray you, he?
  Beat. Why, Prince's jester, dull fool. his
    gift devising impossible slanders. libertines
    delight him; commendation wit, in
    villany; pleases men angers them, then
    laugh beat him. fleet.
    boarded me.
  Bene. gentleman, say.
  Beat. Do, do. break comparison me; which
    peradventure, marked laugh'd at, strikes into
    melancholy; partridge wing saved, fool
    eat supper night.
                                                        [Music.]
    follow leaders.
  Bene. good thing.
  Beat. Nay, lead ill, leave next
    turning.
        Dance. Exeunt (all John, Borachio, Claudio].
  John. brother amorous Hero hath withdrawn her
    father break it. ladies follow  
    visor remains.
  Bora. Claudio. bearing.
  John. Signior Benedick?
  Claud. well. he.
  John. Signior, brother love. is
    enamour'd Hero. pray dissuade her; no
    equal birth. part honest man it.
  Claud. loves her?
  John. heard swear affection.
  Bora. too, swore marry tonight.
  John. Come, banquet.
                                          Exeunt. Manet Claudio.
  Claud. answer Benedick
    hear ill news ears Claudio.
                                                      [Unmasks.]
    'Tis so. Prince wooes himself.
    Friendship constant things
    Save office affairs love.
    hearts love tongues;
    eye negotiate  
    trust agent; beauty witch
    charms faith melteth blood.
    accident hourly proof,
    mistrusted not. Farewell Hero!

                  Enter Benedick [unmasked].

  Bene. Count Claudio?
  Claud. Yea, same.
  Bene. Come, me?
  Claud. Whither?
  Bene. willow, business, County. What
    fashion wear garland of? neck, an
    usurer's chain? arm, lieutenant's scarf? You
    wear way, Prince hath Hero.
  Claud. joy her.
  Bene. Why, spoken honest drovier. sell
    bullocks. Prince served you
    thus?
  Claud. pray leave me.  
  Bene. Ho! strike blind man! 'Twas boy that
    stole meat, beat post.
  Claud. be, leave you.                Exit.
  Bene. Alas, poor hurt fowl! creep sedges. But,
    Lady Beatrice me, me! The
    Prince's fool! Ha! title am
    merry. Yea, apt wrong. so
    reputed. base (though bitter) disposition Beatrice
    puts world person out. Well,
    revenged may.

                         Enter Pedro.

  Pedro. Now, signior, Count? him?
  Bene. Troth, lord, played part Lady Fame, found
    melancholy lodge warren. told him, I
    told true, Grace good of
    young lady, off'red company willow tree,
    make garland, forsaken, bind him
    rod, worthy whipt.  
  Pedro. whipt? fault?
  Bene. flat transgression schoolboy who, overjoyed
    finding bird's nest, shows companion, steals
    it.
  Pedro. Wilt thou make trust transgression? transgression is
    stealer.
  Bene. amiss rod made, the
    garland too; garland worn himself, the
    rod bestowed you, who, it, stol'n
    bird's nest.
  Pedro. teach sing restore owner.
  Bene. singing answer saying, faith say
    honestly.
  Pedro. Lady Beatrice hath quarrel you. gentleman that
    danc'd told wrong'd you.
  Bene. O, misus'd past endurance block! oak but
    green leaf answered her; visor
    began assume life scold her. told me, not
    thinking myself, Prince's jester, that
    duller great thaw; huddling jest jest  
    impossible conveyance stood man mark,
    army shooting me. speaks poniards, every
    word stabs. breath terrible terminations,
    living her; infect North
    Star. marry endowed that
    Adam left transgress'd. made
    Hercules turn'd spit, yea, cleft club make
    fire too. Come, talk her. find the
    infernal Ate good apparel. God scholar would
    conjure her, certainly, here, man live as
    quiet hell sanctuary; people sin purpose,
    thither; disquiet, horror,
    perturbation her.

           Enter Claudio Beatrice, Leonato, Hero.

  Pedro. Look, comes.
  Bene. Grace command service world's end? I
    slightest errand Antipodes can
    devise send on; fetch toothpicker  
    furthest inch Asia; bring length Prester John's
    foot; fetch hair great Cham's beard; any
    embassage Pygmies--rather hold words'
    conference harpy. employment me?
  Pedro. None, desire good company.
  Bene. O God, sir, dish love not! endure Lady
    Tongue.                                              [Exit.]
  Pedro. Come, lady, come; lost heart Signior
    Benedick.
  Beat. Indeed, lord, lent awhile, gave for
    it--a double heart single one. Marry, won
    false dice; Grace I
    lost it.
  Pedro. put down, lady; put down.
  Beat. me, lord, prove
    mother fools. brought Count Claudio, sent
    seek.
  Pedro. Why, now, Count? Wherefore sad?
  Claud. sad, lord.
  Pedro. then? sick?  
  Claud. Neither, lord.
  Beat. Count sad, sick, merry, well; but
    civil count--civil orange, jealous
    complexion.
  Pedro. I' faith, lady, blazon true; I'll
    sworn, so, conceit false. Here, Claudio, I
    wooed thy name, fair Hero won. broke with
    father, good obtained. day marriage,
    God give thee joy!
  Leon. Count, daughter, fortunes. His
    Grace hath made match, grace Amen it!
  Beat. Speak, Count, 'tis cue.
  Claud. Silence perfectest herald joy. little
    happy much. Lady, mine, yours.
    give dote exchange.
  Beat. Speak, cousin; or, cannot, stop mouth kiss
    speak neither.
  Pedro. faith, lady, merry heart.
  Beat. Yea, lord; it, poor fool, windy
    side care. cousin tells ear  
    heart.
  Claud. doth, cousin.
  Beat. Good Lord, alliance! world but
    I, sunburnt. sit corner cry 'Heigh-ho for
    husband!'
  Pedro. Lady Beatrice, one.
  Beat. father's getting. Hath your
    Grace ne'er brother you? father excellent
    husbands, maid them.
  Pedro. me, lady?
  Beat. No, lord, working days:
    Grace costly wear day. beseech your
    Grace pardon me. born speak mirth matter.
  Pedro. silence offends me, merry becomes
    you, o' question born merry hour.
  Beat. No, sure, lord, mother cried; star
    danc'd, born. Cousins, God give joy!
  Leon. Niece, things told of?
  Beat. cry mercy, uncle, Grace's pardon.    Exit.
  Pedro. troth, pleasant-spirited lady.  
  Leon. melancholy element her, lord. She
    sad sleeps, sad then; I
    heard daughter hath dreamt unhappiness
    wak'd laughing.
  Pedro. endure hear husband.
  Leon. O, means! mocks wooers suit.
  Pedro. excellent wife Benedick.
  Leon. O Lord, lord! week married, would
    talk mad.
  Pedro. County Claudio, church?
  Claud. To-morrow, lord. Time crutches till love all
    rites.
  Leon. till Monday, dear son, just
    sevennight; time too, things answer
    mind.
  Pedro. Come, shake head long breathing;
    warrant thee, Claudio, time dully us.
    interim undertake Hercules' labours, which
    is, bring Signior Benedick Lady Beatrice a
    mountain affection th' th' other. fain  
    match, doubt fashion will
    minister assistance give direction.
  Leon. lord, you, cost ten nights'
    watchings.
  Claud. I, lord.
  Pedro. too, gentle Hero?
  Hero. modest office, lord, cousin a
    good husband.
  Pedro. Benedick unhopefullest husband know.
    praise him: noble strain, approved
    valour, confirm'd honesty. teach humour
    cousin, fall love Benedick; I,
    [to Leonato Claudio] helps, practise on
    Benedick that, quick wit queasy
    stomach, fall love Beatrice. this,
    Cupid longer archer; glory ours, are
    love-gods. me, drift.
                                                         Exeunt.




Scene II.
A hall Leonato's house.

Enter [Don] John Borachio.

  John. so. Count Claudio marry daughter of
    Leonato.
  Bora. Yea, lord; cross it.
  John. bar, cross, impediment med'cinable me.
    sick displeasure him, whatsoever athwart his
    affection ranges evenly mine. canst thou cross this
    marriage?
  Bora. honestly, lord, covertly dishonesty
    me.
  John. Show briefly how.
  Bora. told lordship, year since, in
    favour Margaret, waiting gentlewoman Hero.
  John. remember.
  Bora. can, unseasonable instant night, appoint her
    lady's chamber window.
  John. life death marriage?
  Bora. poison lies temper.  
    Prince brother; spare hath wronged
    honour marrying renowned Claudio (whose estimation do
    mightily hold up) contaminated stale, as
    Hero.
  John. proof make that?
  Bora. Proof misuse Prince, vex Claudio, undo
    Hero, kill Leonato. issue?
  John. endeavour anything.
  Bora. then; find meet hour draw Pedro Count
    Claudio alone; Hero loves me; intend
    kind zeal Prince Claudio, as--in love of
    brother's honour, hath made match, friend's
    reputation, cozen'd semblance of
    maid--that discover'd thus. scarcely believe
    trial. Offer instances; bear no
    likelihood chamber window, hear me
    call Margaret Hero, hear Margaret term Claudio; bring them
    night intended wedding (for in
    meantime fashion matter Hero be
    absent) truth Hero's  
    disloyalty jealousy call'd assurance the
    preparation overthrown.
  John. Grow adverse issue can, put in
    practice. cunning working this, thy fee a
    thousand ducats.
  Bora. constant accusation, cunning not
    shame me.
  John. presently learn day marriage.
                                                         Exeunt.




Scene III.
Leonato's orchard.

Enter Benedick alone.

  Bene. Boy!

                    [Enter Boy.]

  Boy. Signior?
  Bene. chamber window lies book. Bring in
    orchard.
  Boy. already, sir.
  Bene. that, thee again.
    (Exit Boy.) man, much
    man fool dedicates behaviours love,
    will, hath laugh'd shallow follies others,
    argument scorn falling love; such
    man Claudio. music him
    drum fife; hear tabor
    pipe. walk'd ten mile
    afoot good armour; lie ten nights awake  
    carving fashion doublet. wont speak plain
    purpose, honest man soldier; is
    turn'd orthography; words fantastical banquet--
    strange dishes. converted with
    eyes? tell; not. sworn but
    love transform oyster; oath it,
    till made oyster make a
    fool. woman fair, well; wise, am
    well; virtuous, well; till graces in
    woman, woman grace. Rich shall
    be, certain; wise, none; virtuous, never
    cheapen her; fair, her; mild, not
    me; noble, angel; good discourse, an
    excellent musician, hair colour it
    God. Ha, Prince Monsieur Love! hide in
    arbour.                                         [Hides.]

              Enter Pedro, Leonato, Claudio.
                      Music [within].
  
  Pedro. Come, hear music?
  Claud. Yea, good lord. evening is,
    hush'd purpose grace harmony!
  Pedro. Benedick hath hid himself?
  Claud. O, well, lord. music ended,
    fit kid-fox pennyworth.

                   Enter Balthasar Music.

  Pedro. Come, Balthasar, hear song again.
  Balth. O, good lord, tax bad voice
    slander music once.
  Pedro. witness excellency
    put strange face perfection.
    pray thee sing, woo more.
  Balth. talk wooing, sing,
    wooer doth commence suit
    thinks worthy, wooes,
    swear loves.
  Pedro. Nay, pray thee come;  
    thou wilt hold longer argument,
    notes.
  Balth. Note notes:
    note mine worth noting.
  Pedro. Why, crotchets speaks!
    Note notes, forsooth, nothing!                  [Music.]
  Bene. [aside] divine air! soul ravish'd! not
    strange sheep's guts hale souls men's bodies?
    Well, horn money, all's done.
                                              [Balthasar sings.]
                      Song.

        Sigh more, ladies, sigh more!
          Men deceivers ever,
        foot sea, shore;
          thing constant never.
            sigh so,
            go,
          blithe bonny,
        Converting sounds woe  
          Hey nonny, nonny.

        Sing ditties, sing moe,
          dumps dull heavy!
        fraud men so,
          summer leavy.
            sigh so, &c.

  Pedro. troth, good song.
  Balth. ill singer, lord.
  Pedro. Ha, no, no, faith! Thou sing'st shift.
  Bene. [aside] dog howl'd thus,
    hang'd him; pray God bad voice bode no
    mischief. live heard night raven, what
    plague it.
  Pedro. Yea, marry. Dost thou hear, Balthasar? pray thee us
    excellent music; to-morrow night the
    Lady Hero's chamber window.
  Balth. can, lord.
  Pedro. so. Farewell.  
                                Exit Balthasar [with Musicians].
    hither, Leonato. told to-day? that
    niece Beatrice love Signior Benedick?
  Claud. O, ay!-[Aside Pedro] Stalk on, stalk on; fowl sits.
    --I lady loved man.
  Leon. No, neither; wonderful dote
    Signior Benedick, hath outward behaviours
    seem'd abhor.
  Bene. [aside] Is't possible? Sits wind corner?
  Leon. troth, lord, it, but
    loves enraged affection. past the
    infinite thought.
  Pedro. doth counterfeit.
  Claud. Faith, enough.
  Leon. O God, counterfeit? counterfeit passion
    life passion discovers it.
  Pedro. Why, effects passion shows she?
  Claud. [aside] Bait hook well! fish bite.
  Leon. effects, lord? sit you--you heard my
    daughter how.  
  Claud. indeed.
  Pedro. How, how, pray you? amaze me. thought her
    spirit invincible assaults affection.
  Leon. sworn had, lord--especially against
    Benedick.
  Bene. [aside] gull white-bearded
    fellow speaks it. Knavery cannot, sure, hide such
    reverence.
  Claud. [aside] hath ta'en th' infection. Hold up.
  Pedro. Hath made affection Benedick?
  Leon. No, swears will. torment.
  Claud. 'Tis true indeed. daughter says. 'Shall I,' says
    she, 'that oft encount'red scorn, write him
    love him?'"
  Leon. beginning write him; for
    twenty times night, sit her
    smock till writ sheet paper. daughter tells us
    all.
  Claud. talk sheet paper, remember pretty jest
    daughter told of.  
  Leon. O, writ it, reading over, found
    'Benedick' 'Beatrice' sheet?
  Claud. That.
  Leon. O, tore letter thousand halfpence, rail'd at
    immodest write she
    knew flout her. 'I measure him,' she, 'by own
    spirit; flout writ me. Yea, I
    love him, should.'
  Claud. knees falls, weeps, sobs, beats her
    heart, tears hair, prays, curses--'O sweet Benedick! God give
    patience!'
  Leon. doth indeed; daughter so. ecstasy hath so
    overborne daughter afeard will
    desperate outrage herself. true.
  Pedro. good Benedick knew other, she
    discover it.
  Claud. end? make sport torment the
    poor lady worse.
  Pedro. should, alms hang him! an
    excellent sweet lady, (out suspicion) virtuous.  
  Claud. exceeding wise.
  Pedro. loving Benedick.
  Leon. O, lord, wisdom blood combating tender body,
    ten proofs blood hath victory. sorry
    her, cause, uncle guardian.
  Pedro. bestowed dotage me. have
    daff'd respects made half myself. pray you
    Benedick hear 'a say.
  Leon. good, you?
  Claud. Hero thinks surely die; die
    love not, die ere make love known,
    die, woo her, bate one
    breath accustomed crossness.
  Pedro. doth well. make tender love, 'tis
    scorn it; man (as all) hath
    contemptible spirit.
  Claud. proper man.
  Pedro. hath good outward happiness.
  Claud. God! mind, wise.
  Pedro. doth show sparks wit.  
  Claud. valiant.
  Pedro. Hector, assure you; managing quarrels you
    wise, avoids great
    discretion, undertakes Christianlike fear.
  Leon. fear God, 'a necessarily peace. he
    break peace, enter quarrel fear and
    trembling.
  Pedro. do; man doth fear God, howsoever it
    large jests make. Well, am
    niece. seek Benedick of
    love?
  Claud. him, lord. wear good
    counsel.
  Leon. Nay, impossible; wear heart first.
  Pedro. Well, hear daughter. it
    cool while. love Benedick well, would
    modestly examine unworthy good a
    lady.
  Leon. lord, .walk? Dinner ready.
                                               [They walk away.]  
  Claud. dote this, trust my
    expectation.
  Pedro. net spread her, your
    daughter gentlewomen carry. sport be, they
    hold opinion another's dotage, matter.
    scene see, dumb
    show. send call dinner.
                       Exeunt [Don Pedro, Claudio, Leonato].

                [Benedick advances arbour.]

  Bene. trick. conference sadly borne; they
    truth Hero; pity lady.
    affections full bent. Love me? Why, it
    requited. hear censur'd. bear
    proudly perceive love her. too
    die give sign affection. did
    marry. proud. Happy that
    hear detractions put mending. the
    lady fair--'tis truth, bear witness; virtuous  
    --'tis so, reprove it; wise, loving me--by
    troth, addition wit, great argument of
    folly, horribly love her. chance
    odd quirks remnants wit broken I
    railed long marriage. doth appetite
    alters? man loves meat youth endure
    age. quips sentences paper bullets of
    brain awe man career humour? No, world
    peopled. die bachelor, not
    live till married.

                 Enter Beatrice.

    Beatrice. day, fair lady! spy
    marks love her.
  Beat. bid dinner.
  Bene. Fair Beatrice, pains.
  Beat. pains pains to
    me. painful, come.
  Bene. pleasure message?  
  Beat. Yea, knives point, and
    choke daw withal. stomach, signior. Fare well.
Exit.
  Bene. Ha! 'Against bid dinner.'
    double meaning that. 'I pains those
    pains me.' to
    say, 'Any pains easy thanks.' I
    pity her, villain; love her, I
    Jew. picture.                   Exit.

ACT III. Scene I.
Leonato's orchard.

Enter Hero Gentlewomen, Margaret Ursula.

  Hero. Good Margaret, run thee parlour.
    shalt thou find cousin Beatrice
    Proposing Prince Claudio.
    Whisper ear her, Ursley
    Walk orchard, discourse
    her. thou overheard'st us;
    bid steal pleached bower,
    honeysuckles, ripened sun,
    Forbid sun enter--like favourites,
    Made proud princes, advance pride
    power bred it. hide her
    listen propose. thy office.
    Bear thee leave alone.
  Marg. make come, warrant you, presently.    [Exit.]
  Hero. Now, Ursula, Beatrice doth come,
    trace alley down,
    talk Benedick.  
    him, thy part
    praise man merit.
    talk thee Benedick
    sick love Beatrice. matter
    Cupid's crafty arrow made,
    wounds hearsay.

                   [Enter Beatrice.]

    begin;
    Beatrice lapwing runs
    Close ground, hear conference.

               [Beatrice hides arbour].

  Urs. pleasant'st angling fish
    Cut golden oars silver stream
    greedily devour treacherous bait.
    angle Beatrice, now
    couched woodbine coverture.  
    Fear part dialogue.
  Hero. her, ear lose nothing
    false sweet bait lay it.
                                     [They approach arbour.]
    No, truly, Ursula, disdainful.
    spirits coy wild
    haggards rock.
  Urs. sure
    Benedick loves Beatrice entirely?
  Hero. Prince, new-trothed lord.
  Urs. bid it, madam?
  Hero. entreat acquaint it;
    persuaded them, lov'd Benedick,
    wrestle affection
    Beatrice it.
  Urs. so? Doth gentleman
    Deserve full, fortunate bed
    Beatrice couch upon?
  Hero. O god love! doth deserve
    yielded man:  
    Nature fram'd woman's heart
    prouder stuff Beatrice.
    Disdain scorn ride sparkling eyes,
    Misprizing on; wit
    Values highly her
    matter weak. love,
    shape project affection,
    self-endeared.
  Urs. so;
    good
    knew love, make sport it.
  Hero. Why, speak truth. man,
    wise, noble, young, rarely featur'd,
    spell backward. fair-fac'd,
    swear gentleman sister;
    black, why, Nature, drawing antic,
    Made foul blot; tall, lance ill-headed;
    low, agate vilely cut;
    speaking, why, vane blown winds;
    silent, why, block moved none.  
    turns man wrong side out
    truth virtue that
    simpleness merit purchaseth.
  Urs. Sure, sure, carping commendable.
  Hero. No, odd, fashions,
    Beatrice is, commendable.
    dare so? speak,
    mock air; O, laugh me
    myself, press death wit!
    Benedick, cover'd fire,
    Consume sighs, waste inwardly.
    death die mocks,
    bad die tickling.
  Urs. it. Hear say.
  Hero. No; Benedick
    counsel fight passion.
    truly, devise honest slanders
    stain cousin with. doth know
    ill word empoison liking.
  Urs. O, cousin wrong!  
    true judgment
    (Having swift excellent wit
    priz'd have) refuse
    rare gentleman Signior Benedick.
  Hero. man Italy,
    excepted dear Claudio.
  Urs. pray angry me, madam,
    Speaking fancy: Signior Benedick,
    shape, bearing, argument, valour,
    foremost report Italy.
  Hero. hath excellent good name.
  Urs. excellence earn ere it.
    married, madam?
  Hero. Why, day to-morrow! Come, in.
    show thee attires, thy counsel
    furnish to-morrow.
                                               [They walk away.]
  Urs. lim'd, warrant you! caught her, madam.
  Hero. prove so, loving haps;
    Cupid kills arrows, traps.  
                                       Exeunt [Hero Ursula].

    [Beatrice advances arbour.]

  Beat. fire mine ears? true?
    Stand condemn'd pride scorn much?
    Contempt, farewell! maiden pride, adieu!
    glory lives back such.
    And, Benedick, love on; requite thee,
    Taming wild heart thy loving hand.
    thou dost love, kindness incite thee
    bind loves holy band;
    thou dost deserve, I
    reportingly.                    Exit.




Scene II.
A room Leonato's house.

Enter Pedro, Claudio, Benedick, Leonato.

  Pedro. stay till marriage consummate, go
    Arragon.
  Claud. bring thither, lord, vouchsafe me.
  Pedro. Nay, great soil gloss your
    marriage show child coat forbid wear
    it. bold Benedick company; for, from
    crown head sole foot, mirth.
    hath thrice cut Cupid's bowstring, little
    hangman dare shoot him. hath heart sound a
    bell; tongue clapper, heart thinks,
    tongue speaks.
  Bene. Gallants, been.
  Leon. I. Methinks sadder.
  Claud. hope love.
  Pedro. Hang him, truant! true drop blood be
    touch'd love. sad, money.
  Bene. toothache.  
  Pedro. Draw it.
  Bene. Hang it!
  Claud. hang draw afterwards.
  Pedro. What? sigh toothache?
  Leon. humour worm.
  Bene. Well, master grief it.
  Claud. love.
  Pedro. appearance fancy him, fancy
    hath strange disguises; Dutchman to-day, a
    Frenchman to-morrow; shape countries once, as
    German waist downward, slops, Spaniard from
    hip upward, doublet. fancy this
    foolery, appears hath, fool fancy, you
    is.
  Claud. love woman, believing
    signs. 'A brushes hat o' mornings. bode?
  Pedro. Hath man barber's?
  Claud. No, barber's man hath him, the
     ornament cheek hath stuff'd tennis balls.
  Leon. younger did, loss beard.  
  Pedro. Nay, 'a rubs civet. smell by
    that?
  Claud. say, sweet youth's love.
  Pedro. greatest note melancholy.
  Claud. wont wash face?
  Pedro. Yea, paint himself? hear say
    him.
  Claud. Nay, jesting spirit, new-crept a
    lutestring, govern'd stops.
  Pedro. tells heavy tale him. Conclude, conclude,
    love.
  Claud. Nay, loves him.
  Pedro. too. warrant, not.
  Claud. Yes, ill conditions; all, dies for
    him.
  Pedro. buried face upwards.
  Bene. charm toothache. signior, walk
    me. studied wise words speak
    you, hobby-horses hear.
                                  [Exeunt Benedick Leonato.]  
  Pedro. life, break Beatrice!
  Claud. 'Tis so. Hero Margaret played their
    parts Beatrice, bears bite one
    meet.

                 Enter John Bastard.

  John. lord brother, God save you.
  Pedro. Good den, brother.
  John. leisure serv'd, speak you.
  Pedro. private?
  John. you. Count Claudio hear, I
    speak concerns him.
  Pedro. matter?
  John. [to Claudio] Means lordship married tomorrow?
  Pedro. does.
  John. that, know.
  Claud. impediment, pray discover it.
  John. love not. hereafter, and
    aim manifest. brother,  
    holds dearness heart hath holp to
    effect ensuing marriage--surely suit ill spent labour
    ill bestowed!
  Pedro. Why, matter?
  John. you, and, circumstances short'ned (for
    long a-talking of), lady disloyal.
  Claud. Who? Hero?
  John. she--Leonato's Hero, Hero, man's Hero.
  Claud. Disloyal?
  John. word good paint wickedness. say
    worse; worse title, fit to
    it. till warrant. to-night, you
    chamber window ent'red, night her
    wedding day. love then, to-morrow wed her. it
    fit honour change mind.
  Claud. so?
  Pedro. it.
  John. dare trust see, confess you
    know. follow me, show enough; you
    heard more, proceed accordingly.  
  Claud. to-night marry her
    to-morrow, congregation wed, I
    shame her.
  Pedro. And, wooed thee obtain her, join with
    thee disgrace her.
  John. disparage farther till witnesses.
    Bear coldly till midnight, issue show itself.
  Pedro. O day untowardly turned!
  Claud. O mischief strangely thwarting!
  John. O plague prevented!
    Sequel.
                                                         Exeunt.




Scene III.
A street.

Enter Dogberry compartner [Verges], Watch.

  Dog. good men true?
  Verg. Yea, pity suffer salvation,
    body soul.
  Dog. Nay, punishment good should
    allegiance them, chosen Prince's watch.
  Verg. Well, give charge, neighbour Dogberry.
  Dog. First, desartless man constable?
  1. Watch. Hugh Oatcake, sir, George Seacoal; write
    read.
  Dog. hither, neighbour Seacoal. God hath bless'd a
    good name. well-favoured man gift fortune, but
    write read nature.
  2. Watch. which, Master Constable--
  Dog. have. knew answer. Well, your
    favour, sir, why, give God make boast it; and
    writing reading, no
    vanity. thought  
    senseless fit man constable watch. Therefore
    bear lanthorn. charge: comprehend
    vagrom men; bid man stand, Prince's
    name.
  2. Watch. 'a stand?
  Dog. then, note him, go, presently
    call rest watch God rid of
    knave.
  Verg. stand bidden, the
    Prince's subjects.
  Dog. True, meddle Prince's
    subjects. make noise streets; for
    watch babble talk tolerable, be
    endured.
  2. Watch. sleep talk. belongs to
    watch.
  Dog. Why, speak ancient quiet watchman, I
    sleeping offend. care your
    bills stol'n. Well, call alehouses
    bid drunk bed.  
  2. Watch. not?
  Dog. then, till sober. make you
    answer, men you
    for.
  2. Watch. Well, sir.
  Dog. meet thief, suspect him, virtue your
    office, true man; kind men, you
    meddle make them, why, honesty.
  2. Watch. thief, lay hands on
    him?
  Dog. Truly, office may; touch
    pitch defil'd. peaceable you, do
    thief, show is, steal
    company.
  Verg. called merciful man, partner.
  Dog. Truly, hang dog will, man who
    hath honesty him.
  Verg. hear child cry night, call the
    nurse bid it.
  2. Watch. nurse asleep hear us?  
  Dog. then, depart peace child wake with
    crying; ewe hear lamb baes will
    answer calf bleats.
  Verg. 'Tis true.
  Dog. end charge: you, constable, present
    Prince's person. meet Prince night,
    stay him.
  Verg. Nay, by'r lady, 'a cannot.
  Dog. shillings on't man the
    statutes, stay him! Marry, Prince be
    willing; watch offend man, is
    offence stay man will.
  Verg. By'r lady, so.
  Dog. Ha, ah, ha! Well, masters, good night. matter
    weight chances, call me. fellows' counsels and
    own, good night. Come, neighbour.
  2. Watch. Well, masters, hear charge. sit here
    church bench till two, bed.
  Dog. word more, honest neighbours. pray watch about
    Signior Leonato's door; wedding tomorrow,  
    great coil to-night. Adieu. vigitant, beseech
    you.                           Exeunt [Dogberry Verges].

                     Enter Borachio Conrade.

  Bora. What, Conrade!
  2. Watch. [aside] Peace! stir not!
  Bora. Conrade, say!
  Con. Here, man. thy elbow.
  Bora. Mass, elbow itch'd! thought scab
    follow.
  Con. owe thee answer that; forward thy
    tale.
  Bora. Stand thee close penthouse, drizzles
    rain, will, true drunkard, utter thee.
  2. Watch. [aside] treason, masters. stand close.
  Bora. earned John thousand ducats.
  Con. villany dear?
  Bora. Thou shouldst villany
    rich; rich villains poor ones,  
    poor make price will.
  Con. it.
  Bora. shows thou art unconfirm'd. Thou knowest the
    fashion doublet, hat, cloak, man.
  Con. Yes, apparel.
  Bora. fashion.
  Con. Yes, fashion fashion.
  Bora. Tush! fool's fool. seest thou
    deformed thief fashion is?
  2. Watch. [aside] Deformed. 'A bas vile thief
    year; 'a gentleman. remember
    name.
  Bora. Didst thou hear somebody?
  Con. No; 'twas vane house.
  Bora. Seest thou not, say, deformed thief fashion is?
    giddily 'a turns hot-bloods fourteen
    five-and-thirty? fashioning Pharaoh's
    soldiers reechy painting, god Bel's priests
    church window, shaven Hercules in
    smirch'd worm-eaten tapestry, codpiece  
    massy club?
  Con. see; fashion wears more
    apparel man. art thou thyself giddy the
    fashion too, thou hast shifted thy tale telling
    fashion?
  Bora. neither. to-night wooed Margaret,
    Lady Hero's gentlewoman, Hero. leans me
    mistress' chamber window, bids thousand times
    good night--I tale vilely; thee how
    Prince, Claudio master, planted and
    possessed master John, afar orchard this
    amiable encounter.
  Con. thought Margaret Hero?
  Bora. did, Prince Claudio; devil my
    master knew Margaret; partly oaths, which
    possess'd them, partly dark night, deceive
    them, chiefly villany, confirm slander
    John made, Claudio enrag'd; swore would
    meet her, appointed, morning temple, and
    there, congregation, shame  
    o'ernight send home husband.
  2. Watch. charge Prince's stand!
  1. Watch. Call Master Constable. here
    recover'd dangerous piece lechery known
    commonwealth.
  2. Watch. Deformed them. him; 'a wears a
    lock.
  Con. Masters, masters--
  1. Watch. made bring Deformed forth, warrant you.
  Con. Masters--
  2. Watch. speak, charge you. obey with
    us.
  Bora. prove goodly commodity, of
    men's bills.
  Con. commodity question, warrant you. Come, obey you.
                                                         Exeunt.




Scene IV.
A Room Leonato's house.

Enter Hero, Margaret Ursula.

  Hero. Good Ursula, wake cousin Beatrice desire rise.
  Urs. will, lady.
  Hero. bid hither.
  Urs. Well.                                             [Exit.]
  Marg. Troth, rebato better.
  Hero. No, pray thee, good Meg, wear this.
  Marg. troth, 's good, warrant cousin will
    so.
  Hero. cousin's fool, thou art another. wear but
    this.
  Marg. tire excellently, hair a
    thought browner; gown's rare fashion, i' faith.
    Duchess Milan's gown praise so.
  Hero. O, exceeds, say.
  Marg. troth, 's nightgown respect yours--
    cloth-o'-gold cuts, lac'd silver, set pearls
    sleeves, side-sleeves, skirts, round underborne  
    blush tinsel. fine, quaint, graceful, excellent
    fashion, worth ten on't.
  Hero. God give joy wear it! heart exceeding heavy.
  Marg. 'Twill heavier weight man.
  Hero. Fie thee! art ashamed?
  Marg. what, lady? speaking honourably? marriage
    honourable beggar? lord honourable without
    marriage? say, 'saving reverence,
    husband.' bad thinking wrest true speaking, I'll
    offend nobody. harm 'the heavier husband'?
    None, think, husband wife.
    'tis light, heavy. Lady Beatrice else.
    comes.

                               Enter Beatrice.

  Hero. Good morrow, coz.
  Beat. Good morrow, sweet Hero.
  Hero. Why, now? speak sick tune?
  Beat. tune, methinks.  
  Marg. Clap's 'Light o' love.' burden. Do
    sing it, dance it.
  Beat. Yea, 'Light o' love' heels! then, husband
    stables enough, lack barnes.
  Marg. O illegitimate construction! scorn heels.
  Beat. 'Tis o'clock, cousin; 'tis time ready.
    troth, exceeding ill. Hey-ho!
  Marg. hawk, horse, husband?
  Beat. letter begins all, H.
  Marg. Well, turn'd Turk, sailing by
    star.
  Beat. means fool, trow?
  Marg. I; God send heart's desire!
  Hero. gloves Count me, excellent
    perfume.
  Beat. stuff'd, cousin; smell.
  Marg. maid, stuff'd! goodly catching cold.
  Beat. O, God me! God me! long profess'd
    apprehension?
  Marg. left it. Doth wit rarely?  
  Beat. enough. wear cap. my
    troth, sick.
  Marg. distill'd carduus benedictus lay it
    heart. thing qualm.
  Hero. thou prick'st thistle.
  Beat. Benedictus? benedictus? moral this
    'benedictus.'
  Marg. Moral? No, troth, moral meaning; meant
    plain holy thistle. perchance are
    love. Nay, by'r lady, fool I
    list; list can; cannot
    think, heart thinking, in
    love, love, love.
    Benedick another, man. He
    swore marry; heart
    eats meat grudging; converted I
    not, methinks eyes women do.
  Beat. pace thy tongue keeps?
  Marg. false gallop.
  
                         Enter Ursula.

  Urs. Madam, withdraw. Prince, Count, Signior Benedick, Don
    John, gallants town fetch to
    church.
  Hero. dress me, good coz, good Meg, good Ursula.
                                                       [Exeunt.]




Scene V.
The hall Leonato's house.

Enter Leonato Constable [Dogberry] Headborough [verges].

  Leon. me, honest neighbour?
  Dog. Marry, sir, confidence decerns
    nearly.
  Leon. Brief, pray you; busy time me.
  Dog. Marry, is, sir.
  Verg. Yes, truth is, sir.
  Leon. it, good friends?
  Dog. Goodman Verges, sir, speaks matter--an old
    man, sir, wits blunt as, God help, would
    desire were; but, faith, honest skin his
    brows.
  Verg. Yes, God honest man living an
    man honester I.
  Dog. Comparisons odorous. Palabras, neighbour Verges.
  Leon. Neighbours, tedious.
  Dog. pleases worship so, poor Duke's  
    officers; truly, mine part, tedious a
    king, find heart bestow worship.
  Leon. thy tediousness me, ah?
  Dog. Yea, 'twere thousand pound 'tis; hear as
    good exclamation worship man city; and
    poor man, glad hear it.
  Verg. I.
  Leon. fain say.
  Verg. Marry, sir, watch to-night, excepting worship's
    presence, ha' ta'en couple arrant knaves in
    Messina.
  Dog. good man, sir; talking. say, 'When
    age in, wit out.' God us! world to
    see! said, i' faith, neighbour Verges. Well, God's good
    man. men ride horse, ride behind. honest
    soul, i' faith, sir, troth is, broke bread; but
    God worshipp'd; men alike, alas, good
    neighbour!
  Leon. Indeed, neighbour, short you.
  Dog. Gifts God gives.  
  Leon. leave you.
  Dog. word, sir. watch, sir, comprehended two
    aspicious persons, morning examined
    worship.
  Leon. examination bring me. in
    great haste, you.
  Dog. suffigance.
  Leon. Drink wine ere go. Fare well.

                       [Enter Messenger.]

  Mess. lord, stay give daughter her
    husband.
  Leon. wait them. ready.
                                 [Exeunt Leonato Messenger.]
  Dog. Go, good partner, Francis Seacoal; bid bring
    pen inkhorn jail. examination these
    men.
  Verg. wisely.
  Dog. spare wit, warrant you.  
    drive non-come. learned writer to
    set excommunication, meet jail.
                                                       [Exeunt.]

ACT IV. Scene I.
A church.

Enter Pedro, [John the] Bastard, Leonato, Friar [Francis], Claudio,
Benedick, Hero, Beatrice, [and Attendants].

  Leon. Come, Friar Francis, brief. plain form of
    marriage, recount duties
    afterwards.
  Friar. hither, lord, marry lady?
  Claud. No.
  Leon. married her. Friar, marry her.
  Friar. Lady, married count?
  Hero. do.
  Friar. impediment should
    conjoined, charge souls utter it.
  Claud. any, Hero?
  Hero. None, lord.
  Friar. any, Count?
  Leon. dare make answer--none.
  Claud. O, men dare do! men do! men daily do, not
    knowing do!  
  Bene. now? interjections? then, laughing, as,
    ah, ha, he!
  Claud. Stand thee by, friar. Father, leave:
    free unconstrained soul
    Give maid daughter?
  Leon. freely, son, God give me.
  Claud. give back worth
    counterpoise rich precious gift?
  Pedro. Nothing, render again.
  Claud. Sweet Prince, learn noble thankfulness.
    There, Leonato, back again.
    Give rotten orange friend.
    sign semblance honour.
    Behold maid blushes here!
    O, authority show truth
    cunning sin cover withal!
    blood modest evidence
    witness simple virtue, swear,
    her, maid
    exterior shows? none:  
    heat luxurious bed;
    blush guiltiness, modesty.
  Leon. mean, lord?
  Claud. married,
    knit soul approved wanton.
  Leon. Dear lord, you, proof,
    vanquish'd resistance youth
    made defeat virginity--
  Claud. say. her,
    embrace husband,
    extenuate forehand sin.
    No, Leonato,
    tempted word large,
    But, brother sister, show'd
    Bashful sincerity comely love.
  Hero. seem'd you?
  Claud. seeming! write it.
    Dian orb,
    chaste bud ere blown;
    intemperate blood  
    Venus, pamp'red animals
    rage savage sensuality.
  Hero. lord doth speak wide?
  Leon. Sweet Prince, speak you?
  Pedro. speak?
    stand dishonour'd about
    link dear friend common stale.
  Leon. things spoken, dream?
  John. Sir, spoken, things true.
  Bene. nuptial.
  Hero. 'True!' O God!
  Claud. Leonato, stand here?
    Prince, Prince's brother?
    face Hero's? eyes own?
  Leon. so; this, lord?
  Claud. move question daughter,
    fatherly kindly power
    her, bid answer truly.
  Leon. charge thee so, thou art child.
  Hero. O, God defend me! beset!  
    kind catechising call this?
  Claud. make answer name.
  Hero. Hero? blot name
    reproach?
  Claud. Marry, Hero!
    Hero blot Hero's virtue.
    man talk'd yesternight,
    window betwixt twelve one?
    Now, maid, answer this.
  Hero. talk'd man hour, lord.
  Pedro. Why, maiden. Leonato,
    hear. honour,
    Myself, brother, grieved Count
    her, hear her, hour night
    Talk ruffian chamber window,
    hath indeed, liberal villain,
    Confess'd vile encounters had
    thousand times secret.
  John. Fie, fie! nam'd, lord--
    spoke of;  
    chastity, language
    offence utter them. Thus, pretty lady,
    thy misgovernment.
  Claud. O Hero! Hero hadst thou been
    half thy outward graces plac'd
    thy thoughts counsels thy heart!
    fare thee well, foul, fair! Farewell,
    Thou pure impiety impious purity!
    thee lock gates love,
    eyelids conjecture hang,
    turn beauty thoughts harm,
    gracious.
  Leon. Hath man's dagger point me?
                                                  [Hero swoons.]
  Beat. Why, now, cousin? Wherefore sink down?
  John. go. things, light,
    Smother spirits up.
                      [Exeunt Pedro, Juan, Claudio.]
  Bene. doth lady?
  Beat. Dead, think. Help, uncle!  
    Hero! why, Hero! Uncle! Signior Benedick! Friar!
  Leon. O Fate, thy heavy hand!
    Death fairest cover shame
    wish'd for.
  Beat. now, cousin Hero?
  Friar. comfort, lady.
  Leon. Dost thou up?
  Friar. Yea, wherefore not?
  Leon. Wherefore? Why, doth earthly thing
    Cry shame her? deny
    story printed blood?
    live, Hero; ope thine eyes;
    For, thou wouldst quickly die,
    Thought thy spirits stronger thy shames,
    rearward reproaches
    Strike thy life. Griev'd I, one?
    Child frugal nature's frame?
    O, thee! one?
    wast thou lovely eyes?
    charitable hand  
    beggar's issue gates,
    smirched mir'd infamy,
    said, 'No part mine;
    shame derives unknown loins'?
    mine, mine lov'd, mine prais'd,
    mine proud on--mine much
    mine,
    Valuing her--why, she, O, fall'n
    pit ink, wide sea
    Hath drops wash clean again,
    salt season give
    foul tainted flesh!
  Bene. Sir, sir, patient.
    part, attir'd wonder,
    say.
  Beat. O, soul, cousin belied!
  Bene. Lady, bedfellow night?
  Beat. No, truly, not; although, night,
    twelvemonth bedfellow
  Leon. Confirm'd, confirm'd! O, stronger made  
    barr'd ribs iron!
    princes lie? Claudio lie,
    lov'd that, speaking foulness,
    Wash'd tears? her! die.
  Friar. Hear little;
    silent long,
    fortune,
    noting lady. mark'd
    thousand blushing apparitions
    start face, thousand innocent shames
    angel whiteness beat blushes,
    eye hath appear'd fire
    burn errors princes hold
    maiden truth. Call fool;
    Trust reading observation,
    experimental seal doth warrant
    tenure book; trust age,
    reverence, calling, divinity,
    sweet lady lie guiltless here
    biting error.  
  Leon. Friar, be.
    Thou seest grace hath left
    add damnation
    sin perjury: denies it.
    seek'st thou cover excuse
    appears proper nakedness?
  Friar. Lady, man accus'd of?
  Hero. accuse me; none.
    man alive
    maiden modesty doth warrant,
    sins lack mercy! O father,
    Prove man convers'd
    hours unmeet, yesternight
    Maintain'd change words creature,
    Refuse me, hate me, torture death!
  Friar. strange misprision princes.
  Bene. bent honour;
    wisdoms misled this,
    practice lives John bastard,
    spirits toil frame villanies.  
  Leon. not. speak truth her,
    hands tear her. wrong honour,
    proudest hear it.
    Time hath dried blood mine,
    age eat invention,
    fortune made havoc means,
    bad life reft friends,
    find awak'd kind
    strength limb policy mind,
    Ability means, choice friends,
    quit throughly.
  Friar. Pause awhile
    counsel sway case.
    daughter princes left dead,
    awhile secretly in,
    publish dead indeed;
    Maintain mourning ostentation,
    family's monument
    Hang mournful epitaphs, rites
    appertain burial.  
  Leon. this? do?
  Friar. Marry, carried behalf
    Change slander remorse. good.
    dream strange course,
    travail greater birth.
    dying, maintain'd,
    instant accus'd,
    lamented, pitied, excus'd
    hearer; falls out
    prize worth
    Whiles enjoy it, lack'd lost,
    Why, rack value, find
    virtue possession show us
    Whiles ours. fare Claudio.
    hear died words,
    Th' idea life sweetly creep
    study imagination,
    lovely organ life
    apparell'd precious habit,
    moving, delicate, full life,  
    eye prospect soul
    liv'd indeed. mourn
    (If love interest liver)
    accused her--
    No, thought accusation true.
    so, doubt success
    fashion event shape
    lay likelihood.
    aim levell'd false,
    supposition lady's death
    quench infamy.
    sort well, conceal her,
    befits wounded reputation,
    reclusive religious life,
    eyes, tongues, minds, injuries.
  Bene. Signior Leonato, friar advise you;
    inwardness love
    Prince Claudio,
    Yet, mine honour, deal this
    secretly justly soul  
    body.
  Leon. flow grief,
    smallest twine lead me.
  Friar. 'Tis consented. Presently away;
    strange sores strangely strain cure.
    Come, lady, die live. wedding day
    prolong'd. patience endure.
                         Exeunt [all Benedick Beatrice].
  Bene. Lady Beatrice, wept while?
  Beat. Yea, weep longer.
  Bene. desire that.
  Beat. reason. freely.
  Bene. Surely fair cousin wronged.
  Beat. Ah, man deserve right
     her!
  Bene. show friendship?
  Beat. way, friend.
  Bene. man it?
  Beat. man's office, yours.
  Bene. love world you.  
    strange?
  Beat. strange thing not. for
    loved you. not; and
    lie not. confess nothing, deny nothing. sorry
    cousin.
  Bene. sword, Beatrice, thou lovest me.
  Beat. swear, eat it.
  Bene. swear love me, make eat
    love you.
  Beat. eat word?
  Bene. sauce devised it. protest love
    thee.
  Beat. then, God forgive me!
  Bene. offence, sweet Beatrice?
  Beat. stayed happy hour. protest I
    loved you.
  Bene. thy heart.
  Beat. love heart left to
    protest.
  Bene. Come, bid thee.  
  Beat. Kill Claudio.
  Bene. Ha! wide world!
  Beat. kill deny it. Farewell.
  Bene. Tarry, sweet Beatrice.
  Beat. gone, here. love you. Nay, I
    pray go.
  Bene. Beatrice--
  Beat. faith, go.
  Bene. friends first.
  Beat. dare easier friends fight mine
    enemy.
  Bene. Claudio thine enemy?
  Beat. 'a approved height villain, hath
    slandered, scorned, dishonoured kinswoman? O a
    man! What? bear hand hands, and
    public accusation, uncover'd slander, unmitigated
    rancour--O God, man! eat heart the
    market place.
  Bene. Hear me, Beatrice!
  Beat. Talk man window!-a proper saying!  
  Bene. Nay Beatrice--
  Beat. Sweet Hero! wrong'd, sland'red, undone.
  Bene. Beat--
  Beat. Princes Counties! Surely princely testimony, goodly
    count, Count Comfect, sweet gallant surely! O man
    sake! friend man my
    sake! manhood melted cursies, valour compliment,
    men turn'd tongue, trim too. now
    valiant Hercules tells lie,and swears it. I
    man wishing; die woman with
    grieving.
  Bene. Tarry, good Beatrice. hand, love thee.
  Beat. love swearing it.
  Bene. soul Count Claudio hath wrong'd Hero?
  Beat. Yea, thought soul.
  Bene. Enough, engag'd, challenge him. kiss your
    hand, leave you. hand, Claudio render a
    dear account. hear me, me. comfort your
    cousin. dead-and farewell.
                                                       [Exeunt.]




Scene II.
A prison.

Enter Constables [Dogberry Verges] Sexton, gowns,
[and Watch, Conrade and] Borachio.

  Dog. dissembly appear'd?
  Verg. O, stool cushion sexton.
  Sex. malefactors?
  Dog. Marry, partner.
  Verg. Nay, certain. exhibition examine.
  Sex. offenders examined? them
    Master Constable.
  Dog. Yea, marry, me. name,
    friend?
  Bor. Borachio.
  Dog. Pray write Borachio. Yours, sirrah?
  Con. gentleman, sir, Conrade.
  Dog. Write Master Gentleman Conrade. Masters, serve
    God?
  Both. Yea, sir, hope.
  Dog. Write hope serve God; write God first,  
    God defend God villains! Masters,
    proved false
    knaves, thought shortly. answer
    yourselves?
  Con. Marry, sir, none.
  Dog. marvellous witty fellow, assure you; about
    him. hither, sirrah. word ear. Sir, say
    you, thought false knaves.
  Bora. Sir, none.
  Dog. Well, stand aside. Fore God, tale.
    writ none?
  Sex. Master Constable, examine. call
    watch accusers.
  Dog. Yea, marry, eftest way. watch forth.
    Masters, charge Prince's accuse men.
  1. Watch. man said, sir, John Prince's brother
    villain.
  Dog. Write Prince John villain. Why, flat perjury,
    call prince's brother villain.
  Bora. Master Constable--  
  Dog. Pray thee, fellow, peace. thy look, promise
    thee.
  Sex. heard else?
  2. Watch. Marry, received thousand ducats John
    accusing Lady Hero wrongfully.
  Dog. Flat burglary committed.
  Verg. Yea, th' mass, is.
  Sex. else, fellow?
  1. Watch. Count Claudio mean, words, to
    disgrace Hero assembly, marry her.
  Dog. O villain! thou wilt condemn'd everlasting redemption
    this.
  Sex. else?
  Watchmen. all.
  Sex. more, masters, deny. Prince John is
    morning secretly stol'n away. Hero manner
    accus'd, manner refus'd, grief this
    suddenly died. Master Constable, men bound and
    brought Leonato's. show their
    examination.                                         [Exit.]  
  Dog. Come, opinion'd.
  Verg. hands--
  Con. Off, coxcomb!
  Dog. God's life, sexton? write the
    Prince's officer coxcomb. Come, bind them.--Thou naughty varlet!
  Con. Away! ass, ass.
  Dog. Dost thou suspect place? Dost thou suspect my
    years? O write ass! But, masters,
    remember ass. written down, yet
    forget ass. No, thou villain, thou art full of
    piety, prov'd thee good witness. wise
    fellow; more, officer; more, a
    householder; more, pretty piece flesh any
    Messina, law, to! rich
    fellow enough, to! fellow hath losses; one
    hath gowns handsome him. Bring him
    away. O writ ass!
                                                         Exeunt.
