ACT V. SCENE I.
Plains Rome

Enter LUCIUS army GOTHS drums colours

  LUCIUS. Approved warriors faithful friends,
    received letters great Rome
    signifies hate bear Emperor
    desirous sight are.
    Therefore, great lords, be, titles witness,
    Imperious impatient wrongs;
    Rome hath scath,
    make treble satisfaction.
  GOTH. Brave slip, sprung great Andronicus,
    terror, comfort,
    high exploits honourable deeds
    Ingrateful Rome requites foul contempt,
    bold us: follow thou lead'st,
    stinging bees hottest summer's day,
    Led master flow'red fields,
    aveng'd cursed Tamora.  
  GOTHS. saith, him.
  LUCIUS. humbly him, all.
    here, led lusty Goth?

     Enter GOTH, leading AARON CHILD arms

  GOTH. Renowned Lucius, troops stray'd
    gaze ruinous monastery;
    earnestly fix mine eye
    wasted building, suddenly
    heard child cry underneath wall.
    made noise, heard
    crying babe controll'd discourse:
    'Peace, tawny slave, half half thy dam!
    thy hue bewray brat thou art,
    nature lent thee thy mother's look,
    Villain, thou mightst emperor;
    bull cow milk-white,
    beget coal-black calf.
    Peace, villain, peace!'- rates babe-  
    'For bear thee trusty Goth,
    Who, thou art Empress' babe,
    hold thee dearly thy mother's sake.'
    this, weapon drawn, rush'd him,
    Surpris'd suddenly, brought hither
    needful man.
  LUCIUS. O worthy Goth, incarnate devil
    robb'd Andronicus good hand;
    pearl pleas'd Empress' eye;
    base fruit burning lust.
    Say, wall-ey'd slave, wouldst thou convey
    growing image thy fiend-like face?
    dost speak? What, deaf? word?
    halter, soldiers! Hang tree,
    side fruit bastardy.
  AARON. Touch boy, royal blood.
  LUCIUS. sire good.
    hang child, sprawl-
    sight vex father's soul withal.
    ladder.  
                [A ladder brought, AARON made climb]
  AARON. Lucius, save child,
    bear Emperess.
    thou this, show thee wondrous things
    highly advantage thee hear;
    thou wilt not, befall befall,
    speak 'Vengeance rot all!'
  LUCIUS. on; thou speak'st,
    Thy child live, nourish'd.
  AARON. thee! Why, assure thee, Lucius,
    'Twill vex thy soul hear speak;
    talk murders, rapes, massacres,
    Acts black night, abominable deeds,
    Complots mischief, treason, villainies,
    Ruthful hear, piteously perform'd;
    buried death,
    thou swear child live.
  LUCIUS. thy mind; thy child live.
  AARON. Swear shall, begin.
  LUCIUS. swear by? Thou believest god;  
    granted, canst thou oath?
  AARON. not? not;
    Yet, thou art religious
    hast thing thee called conscience,
    twenty popish tricks ceremonies
    thee careful observe,
    urge thy oath. know
    idiot holds bauble god,
    oath god swears,
    urge him. thou shalt vow
    god- god soe'er be
    thou adorest hast reverence-
    save boy, nourish bring up;
    discover nought thee.
  LUCIUS. god swear thee will.
  AARON. thou, begot Empress.
  LUCIUS. O insatiate luxurious woman!
  AARON. Tut, Lucius, deed charity
    thou shalt hear anon.
    'Twas sons murdered Bassianus;  
    cut thy sister's tongue, ravish'd her,
    cut hands, trimm'd thou sawest.
  LUCIUS. O detestable villain! Call'st thou trimming?
  AARON. Why, wash'd, cut, trimm'd, 'twas
    Trim sport it.
  LUCIUS. O barbarous beastly villains thyself!
  AARON. Indeed, tutor instruct them.
    codding spirit mother,
    card won set;
    bloody mind, think, learn'd me,
    true dog fought head.
    Well, deeds witness worth.
    train'd thy brethren guileful hole
    dead corpse Bassianus lay;
    wrote letter thy father found,
    hid gold letter mention'd,
    Confederate Queen sons;
    done, thou hast rue,
    stroke mischief it?
    play'd cheater thy father's hand,  
    And, it, drew apart
    broke heart extreme laughter.
    pried crevice wall,
    When, hand, sons' heads;
    Beheld tears, laugh'd heartily
    mine eyes rainy his;
    told Empress sport,
    swooned pleasing tale,
    tidings gave twenty kisses.
  GOTH. What, canst thou blush?
  AARON. Ay, black dog, is.
  LUCIUS. Art thou heinous deeds?
  AARON. Ay, thousand more.
    curse day- yet, think,
    compass curse-
    notorious ill;
    kill man, devise death;
    Ravish maid, plot it;
    Accuse innocent, forswear myself;
    Set deadly enmity friends;  
    Make poor men's cattle break necks;
    Set fire barns hay-stacks night,
    bid owners quench tears.
    Oft digg'd dead men graves,
    set upright dear friends' door
    sorrows forgot,
    skins, bark trees,
    knife carved Roman letters
    'Let sorrow die, dead.'
    Tut, thousand dreadful things
    willingly kill fly;
    grieves heartily indeed
    ten thousand more.
  LUCIUS. Bring devil, die
    sweet death hanging presently.
  AARON. devils, devil,
    live burn everlasting fire,
    company hell
    torment bitter tongue!
  LUCIUS. Sirs, stop mouth, speak more.  

                       Enter AEMILIUS

  GOTH. lord, messenger Rome
    Desires admitted presence.
  LUCIUS. near.
    Welcome, Aemilius. news Rome?
  AEMILIUS. Lord Lucius, Princes Goths,
    Roman Emperor greets me;
    And, understands arms,
    craves parley father's house,
    demand hostages,
    immediately deliver'd.
  GOTH. general?
  LUCIUS. Aemilius, Emperor give pledges
    father uncle Marcus.
    come. March away.                         Exeunt




SCENE II.
Rome. TITUS' house

Enter TAMORA, sons, DEMETRIUS CHIRON, disguised

  TAMORA. Thus, strange sad habiliment,
    encounter Andronicus,
    Revenge, below
    join heinous wrongs.
    Knock study, keeps
    ruminate strange plots dire revenge;
    Revenge join him,
    work confusion enemies.

         knock TITUS opens study door, above

  TITUS. doth molest contemplation?
    trick make ope door,
    sad decrees fly away
    study effect?
    deceiv'd;  
    bloody lines set down;
    written executed.
  TAMORA. Titus, talk thee.
  TITUS. No, word. grace talk,
    Wanting hand give accord?
    Thou hast odds me; more.
  TAMORA. thou didst me, thou wouldst talk me.
  TITUS. mad, thee enough:
    Witness wretched stump, witness crimson lines;
    Witness trenches made grief care;
    Witness tiring day heavy night;
    Witness sorrow thee well
    proud Empress, mighty Tamora.
    thy coming hand?
  TAMORA. thou, sad man, Tamora:
    thy enemy thy friend.
    Revenge, th' infernal kingdom
    ease gnawing vulture thy mind
    working wreakful vengeance thy foes.
    world's light;  
    Confer murder death;
    hollow cave lurking-place,
    vast obscurity misty vale,
    bloody murder detested rape
    couch fear find out;
    ears dreadful name-
    Revenge, makes foul offender quake.
  TITUS. Art thou Revenge? art thou me
    torment mine enemies?
  TAMORA. am; me.
  TITUS. service ere thee.
    Lo, thy side Rape Murder stands;
    give surance thou art Revenge-
    Stab them, tear thy chariot wheels;
    thy waggoner
    whirl thee globes.
    Provide thee proper palfreys, black jet,
    hale thy vengeful waggon swift away,
    find murderers guilty caves;
    thy car loaden heads,  
    dismount, thy waggon wheel
    Trot, servile footman, day long,
    Hyperion's rising east
    downfall sea.
    day day heavy task,
    thou destroy Rapine Murder there.
  TAMORA. ministers, me.
  TITUS. thy ministers? call'd?
  TAMORA. Rape Murder; called so
    'Cause vengeance kind men.
  TITUS. Good Lord, Empress' sons are!
    Empress! worldly men
    miserable, mad, mistaking eyes.
    O sweet Revenge, thee;
    And, arm's embracement content thee,
    embrace thee by.
  TAMORA. closing fits lunacy.
    Whate'er forge feed brain-sick humours,
    uphold maintain speeches,
    firmly takes Revenge;  
    And, credulous mad thought,
    make send Lucius son,
    whilst banquet hold sure,
    find cunning practice hand
    scatter disperse giddy Goths,
    Or, least, make enemies.
    See, comes, ply theme.

                 Enter TITUS, below

  TITUS. Long forlorn, thee.
    Welcome, dread Fury, woeful house.
    Rapine Murder, too.
    Empress sons are!
    fitted, Moor.
    hell afford devil?
    wot Empress wags
    company Moor;
    And, represent queen aright,
    convenient devil.  
    are. do?
  TAMORA. wouldst thou do, Andronicus?
  DEMETRIUS. Show murderer, deal him.
  CHIRON. Show villain hath rape,
    reveng'd him.
  TAMORA. Show thousand hath thee wrong,
    revenged all.
  TITUS. round wicked streets Rome,
    thou find'st man thyself,
    Good Murder, stab him; murderer.
    thou him, thy hap
    find thee,
    Good Rapine, stab him; ravisher.
    thou them; Emperor's court
    queen, attended Moor;
    shalt thou thine proportion,
    doth resemble thee.
    pray thee, violent death;
    violent mine.
  TAMORA. hast thou lesson'd us; do.  
    thee, good Andronicus,
    send Lucius, thy thrice-valiant son,
    leads Rome band warlike Goths,
    bid banquet thy house;
    here, thy solemn feast,
    bring Empress sons,
    Emperor himself, thy foes;
    thy mercy stoop kneel,
    shalt thou ease thy angry heart.
    Andronicus device?
  TITUS. Marcus, brother! 'Tis sad Titus calls.

                  Enter MARCUS

    Go, gentle Marcus, thy nephew Lucius;
    Thou shalt inquire Goths.
    Bid repair me, bring him
    chiefest princes Goths;
    Bid encamp soldiers are.
    Emperor Empress  
    Feast house, feast them.
    thou love; him,
    aged father's life.
  MARCUS. do, return again.            Exit
  TAMORA. thy business,
    ministers me.
  TITUS. Nay, nay, Rape Murder stay me,
    call brother back again,
    cleave revenge Lucius.
  TAMORA.  [Aside sons]  you, boys? abide
      him,
    Whiles lord Emperor
    govern'd determin'd jest?
    Yield humour, smooth speak fair,
    tarry till turn again.
  TITUS.  [Aside]  knew all, suppos'd mad,
    o'er reach devices,
    pair cursed hell-hounds dam.
  DEMETRIUS. Madam, depart pleasure; leave here.
  TAMORA. Farewell, Andronicus, Revenge  
    lay complot betray thy foes.
  TITUS. thou dost; and, sweet Revenge, farewell.
                                                     Exit TAMORA
  CHIRON. us, man, employ'd?
  TITUS. Tut, work do.
    Publius, hither, Caius, Valentine.

          Enter PUBLIUS, CAIUS, VALENTINE

  PUBLIUS. will?
  TITUS. two?
  PUBLIUS. Empress' sons, them: Chiron, Demetrius.
  TITUS. Fie, Publius, fie! thou art deceiv'd.
    Murder, Rape other's name;
    bind them, gentle Publius-
    Caius Valentine, lay hands them.
    Oft heard hour,
    find it; bind sure,
    stop mouths begin cry.             Exit
                         [They lay hold CHIRON DEMETRIUS]  
  CHIRON. Villains, forbear! Empress' sons.
  PUBLIUS. commanded.
    Stop close mouths, speak word.
    bound? bind fast.

               Re-enter TITUS ANDRONICUS
        knife, LAVINIA, basin

  TITUS. Come, come, Lavinia; look, thy foes bound.
    Sirs, stop mouths, speak me;
    hear fearful words utter.
    O villains, Chiron Demetrius!
    stands spring stain'd mud;
    goodly summer winter mix'd.
    kill'd husband; vile fault
    brothers condemn'd death,
    hand cut made merry jest;
    sweet hands, tongue, dear
    hands tongue, spotless chastity,
    Inhuman traitors, constrain'd forc'd.  
    say, speak?
    Villains, shame beg grace.
    Hark, wretches! martyr you.
    hand left cut throats,
    Whiles Lavinia 'tween stumps doth hold
    basin receives guilty blood.
    mother means feast me,
    calls Revenge, thinks mad.
    Hark, villains! grind bones dust,
    blood make paste;
    paste coffin rear,
    make pasties shameful heads;
    bid strumpet, unhallowed dam,
    earth, swallow increase.
    feast bid to,
    banquet surfeit on;
    worse Philomel us'd daughter,
    worse Progne reveng'd.
    prepare throats. Lavinia, come,
    Receive blood; dead,  
    grind bones powder small,
    hateful liquor temper it;
    paste vile heads bak'd.
    Come, come, officious
    make banquet, prove
    stern bloody Centaurs' feast.
                                         [He cuts throats]
    So.
    bring in, play cook,
    ready mother comes.
                                 Exeunt, bearing dead bodies




SCENE III.
The court TITUS' house

Enter Lucius, MARCUS, GOTHS, AARON prisoner,
and CHILD arms attendant

  LUCIUS. Uncle Marcus, 'tis father's mind
    repair Rome, content.
    GOTH. thine, befall fortune will.
  LUCIUS. Good uncle, barbarous Moor,
    ravenous tiger, accursed devil;
    receive sust'nance, fetter him,
    Till brought Empress' face
    testimony foul proceedings.
    ambush friends strong;
    fear Emperor means good us.
  AARON. devil whisper curses ear,
    prompt tongue utter forth
    venomous malice swelling heart!
  LUCIUS. Away, inhuman dog, unhallowed slave!
    Sirs, uncle convey in.  
                        Exeunt GOTHS AARON. Flourish within
    trumpets show Emperor hand.

            Sound trumpets. Enter SATURNINUS and
    TAMORA, AEMILIUS, TRIBUNES, SENATORS, others

  SATURNINUS. What, hath firmament suns one?
  LUCIUS. boots thee thyself sun?
  MARCUS. Rome's Emperor, nephew, break parle;
    quarrels quietly debated.
    feast ready careful Titus
    Hath ordain'd honourable end,
    peace, love, league, good Rome.
    you, therefore, draw nigh places.
  SATURNINUS. Marcus, will.
                      [A table brought in. company sit down]

               Trumpets sounding, enter TITUS
         cook, placing dishes, LAVINIA
   veil face; YOUNG LUCIUS,  

  TITUS. Welcome, lord; welcome, dread Queen;
    Welcome, ye warlike Goths; welcome, Lucius;
    all. cheer poor,
    'Twill fill stomachs; eat it.
  SATURNINUS. art thou attir'd, Andronicus?
  TITUS. well
    entertain Highness Empress.
  TAMORA. beholding you, good Andronicus.
  TITUS. Highness knew heart, were.
    lord Emperor, resolve this:
    rash Virginius
    slay daughter hand,
    enforc'd, stain'd, deflower'd?
  SATURNINUS. was, Andronicus.
  TITUS. reason, mighty lord.
  SATURNINUS. girl survive shame,
    presence renew sorrows.
  TITUS. reason mighty, strong, effectual;
    pattern, precedent, lively warrant  
    me, wretched, perform like.
    Die, die, Lavinia, thy shame thee;   [He kills her]
    thy shame thy father's sorrow die!
  SATURNINUS. hast thou done, unnatural unkind?
  TITUS. Kill'd tears made blind.
    woeful Virginius was,
    thousand times he
    outrage; done.
  SATURNINUS. What, ravish'd? deed.
  TITUS. Will't eat?  Will't Highness feed?
  TAMORA. hast thou slain thine daughter thus?
  TITUS. I; 'twas Chiron Demetrius.
    ravish'd her, cut tongue;
    they, 'twas they, wrong.
  SATURNINUS. Go, fetch presently.
  TITUS. Why, are, baked pie,
    Whereof mother daintily hath fed,
    Eating flesh hath bred.
    'Tis true, 'tis true: witness knife's sharp point.
                                          [He stabs EMPRESS]  
  SATURNINUS. Die, frantic wretch, accursed deed!
                                                [He stabs TITUS]
  LUCIUS. son's eye behold father bleed?
    meed meed, death deadly deed.
                   [He stabs SATURNINUS. great tumult. LUCIUS,
               MARCUS, friends balcony]
  MARCUS. sad-fac'd men, people sons Rome,
    uproars sever'd, flight fowl
    Scatter'd winds high tempestuous gusts?
    O, teach knit again
    scattered corn mutual sheaf,
    broken limbs body;
    Rome bane herself,
    mighty kingdoms curtsy to,
    forlorn desperate castaway,
    shameful execution herself.
    frosty signs chaps age,
    Grave witnesses true experience,
    induce attend words,
    [To Lucius]  Speak, Rome's dear friend, erst ancestor,  
    solemn tongue discourse
    love-sick Dido's sad attending ear
    story baleful burning night,
    subtle Greeks surpris'd King Priam's Troy.
    Sinon hath bewitch'd ears,
    hath brought fatal engine in
    Troy, Rome, civil wound.
    heart compact flint steel;
    utter bitter grief,
    floods tears drown oratory
    break utt'rance, time
    move ye attend most,
    force commiseration.
    Rome's young Captain, tale;
    stand weep hear speak.
  LUCIUS. Then, gracious auditory, you
    Chiron damn'd Demetrius
    murd'red Emperor's brother;
    ravished sister.
    fell faults brothers beheaded,  
    father's tears despis'd, basely cozen'd
    true hand fought Rome's quarrel out
    enemies grave.
    Lastly, unkindly banished,
    gates shut me, turn'd weeping out,
    beg relief Rome's enemies;
    drown'd enmity true tears,
    op'd arms embrace friend.
    turned forth, you,
    preserv'd welfare blood
    bosom enemy's point,
    Sheathing steel advent'rous body.
    Alas! vaunter, I;
    scars witness, dumb are,
    report full truth.
    But, soft! methinks digress much,
    Citing worthless praise. O, pardon me!
    friends by, men praise themselves.
  MARCUS. turn speak. Behold child.
                  [Pointing CHILD attendant's arms]  
    Tamora delivered,
    issue irreligious Moor,
    Chief architect plotter woes.
    villain alive Titus' house,
    Damn'd is, witness true.
    judge Titus revenge
    wrongs unspeakable, past patience,
    living man bear.
    heard truth: you, Romans?
    aught amiss, show wherein,
    And, place behold pleading,
    poor remainder Andronici
    Will, hand hand, headlong hurl ourselves,
    ragged stones beat souls,
    make mutual closure house.
    Speak, Romans, speak; shall,
    Lo, hand hand, Lucius fall.
  AEMILIUS. Come, come, thou reverend man Rome,
    bring Emperor gently thy hand,
    Lucius Emperor;  
    common voice cry so.
  ALL. Lucius, hail, Rome's royal Emperor!
  MARCUS. Go, Titus' sorrowful house,
    hale misbelieving Moor
    adjudg'd direful slaught'ring death,
    punishment wicked life.          Exeunt some
              attendants. LUCIUS, MARCUS, descend
  ALL. Lucius, hail, Rome's gracious governor!
  LUCIUS. Thanks, gentle Romans! govern so
    heal Rome's harms wipe woe!
    But, gentle people, give aim awhile,
    nature puts heavy task.
    Stand aloof; but, uncle, draw near
    shed obsequious tears trunk.
    O, warm kiss thy pale cold lips.  [Kisses TITUS]
    sorrowful drops thy blood-stain'd face,
    true duties thy noble son!
  MARCUS. Tear tear loving kiss kiss
    Thy brother Marcus tenders thy lips.
    O, sum pay  
    Countless infinite, pay them!
  LUCIUS. hither, boy; come, come, come, learn us
    melt showers. Thy grandsire lov'd thee well;
    time danc'd thee knee,
    Sung thee asleep, loving breast thy pillow;
    story hath told thee,
    bid thee bear pretty tales mind
    talk dead gone.
  MARCUS. thousand times hath poor lips,
    living, warm'd thine!
    O, now, sweet boy, give latest kiss!
    Bid farewell; commit grave;
    kindness, leave them.
  BOY. O grandsire, grandsire! ev'n heart
    dead, live again!
    O Lord, speak weeping;
    tears choke me, ope mouth.

            Re-enter attendants AARON
  
  ROMAN. sad Andronici, woes;
    Give sentence execrable wretch
    hath breeder dire events.
  LUCIUS. Set breast-deep earth, famish him;
    stand rave cry food.
    relieves pities him,
    offence dies. doom.
    stay fast'ned earth.
  AARON. Ah, wrath mute fury dumb?
    baby, I, base prayers
    repent evils done;
    Ten thousand worse did
    perform, will.
    good deed life did,
    repent soul.
  LUCIUS. loving friends convey Emperor hence,
    give burial father's grave.
    father Lavinia forthwith
    closed household's monument.
    ravenous tiger, Tamora,  
    funeral rite, man mourning weed,
    mournful bell ring burial;
    throw beasts birds prey.
    life beastly devoid pity,
    dead, birds pity.           Exeunt

THE END

1602

THE HISTORY TROILUS CRESSIDA

by William Shakespeare


DRAMATIS PERSONAE

  PRIAM, King Troy

    sons:
  HECTOR
  TROILUS
  PARIS
  DEIPHOBUS
  HELENUS

  MARGARELON, bastard son Priam

     Trojan commanders:
  AENEAS
  ANTENOR

  CALCHAS, Trojan priest, taking part Greeks
  PANDARUS, uncle Cressida
  AGAMEMNON, Greek general
  MENELAUS, brother
  
    Greek commanders:
  ACHILLES
  AJAX
  ULYSSES
  NESTOR
  DIOMEDES
  PATROCLUS

  THERSITES, deformed scurrilous Greek
  ALEXANDER, servant Cressida
  SERVANT Troilus
  SERVANT Paris
  SERVANT Diomedes

  HELEN, wife Menelaus
  ANDROMACHE, wife Hector
  CASSANDRA, daughter Priam, prophetess
  CRESSIDA, daughter Calchas

  Trojan Greek Soldiers, Attendants  

                          SCENE:
             Troy Greek camp it

PROLOGUE
                  TROILUS CRESSIDA
                        PROLOGUE

    Troy, lies scene. isles Greece
    princes orgillous, high blood chaf'd,
    port Athens ships
    Fraught ministers instruments
    cruel war. Sixty wore
    crownets regal th' Athenian bay
    Put Phrygia; vow made
    ransack Troy, strong immures
    ravish'd Helen, Menelaus' queen,
    wanton Paris sleeps-and quarrel.
    Tenedos come,
    deep-drawing barks disgorge
    war-like fraughtage. Dardan plains
    fresh unbruised Greeks pitch
    brave pavilions: Priam's six-gated city,
    Dardan, Tymbria, Helias, Chetas, Troien,
    Antenorides, massy staples
    corresponsive fulfilling bolts,
    Sperr sons Troy.  
    expectation, tickling skittish spirits
    side, Troyan Greek,
    Sets hazard-and come
    Prologue arm'd, confidence
    author's pen actor's voice, suited
    conditions argument,
    you, fair beholders, play
    Leaps o'er vaunt firstlings broils,
    Beginning middle; starting away,
    digested play.
    find fault; pleasures are;
    good bad, 'tis chance war.

ACT I. SCENE 1.
Troy. PRIAM'S palace

Enter TROILUS armed, PANDARUS

  TROILUS. Call varlet; unarm again.
    war walls Troy
    find cruel battle within?
    Troyan master heart,
    field; Troilus, alas, hath none!
  PANDARUS. gear ne'er mended?
  TROILUS. Greeks strong, skilful strength,
    Fierce skill, fierceness valiant;
    weaker woman's tear,
    Tamer sleep, fonder ignorance,
    valiant virgin night,
    skilless unpractis'd infancy.
  PANDARUS. Well, told this; part,
    meddle make farther. cake
    wheat tarry grinding.
  TROILUS. tarried?
  PANDARUS. Ay, grinding; tarry bolting.  
  TROILUS. tarried?
  PANDARUS. Ay, bolting; tarry leavening.
  TROILUS. tarried.
  PANDARUS. Ay, leavening; word
    'hereafter' kneading, making cake, heating
    oven, baking; nay, stay cooling too,
    chance burn lips.
  TROILUS. Patience herself, goddess e'er be,
    Doth lesser blench suff'rance do.
    Priam's royal table sit;
    fair Cressid thoughts-
    So, traitor, thence.
  PANDARUS. Well, look'd yesternight fairer her
    look, woman else.
  TROILUS. thee: heart,
    wedged sigh, rive twain,
    Hector father perceive me,
    have, sun doth light storm,
    Buried sigh wrinkle smile.
    sorrow couch'd gladness  
    mirth fate turns sudden sadness.
  PANDARUS. hair darker Helen's- well,
    to- comparison women. But, for
    part, kinswoman; not, term it,
    praise her, heard talk yesterday, as
    did.  dispraise sister Cassandra's wit; but-
  TROILUS. O Pandarus! thee, Pandarus-
    thee hopes lie drown'd,
    Reply fathoms deep
    lie indrench'd. thee mad
    Cressid's love. Thou answer'st 'She fair'-
    Pourest open ulcer heart-
    eyes, hair, cheek, gait, voice,
    Handlest thy discourse. O, hand,
    comparison whites ink
    Writing reproach; soft seizure
    cygnet's harsh, spirit sense
    Hard palm ploughman! thou tell'st me,
    true thou tell'st me, love her;
    But, thus, oil balm,  
    Thou lay'st gash love hath me
    knife made it.
  PANDARUS. speak truth.
  TROILUS. Thou dost speak much.
  PANDARUS. Faith, meddle it. is: if
    fair, 'tis her; not, the
    mends hands.
  TROILUS. Good Pandarus! now, Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. labour travail, ill thought of
    ill thought you; between, but
    small labour.
  TROILUS. What, art thou angry, Pandarus? What, me?
  PANDARUS. kin me, fair as
    Helen. kin me, fair Friday
    Helen Sunday. care I? care a
    blackamoor; 'tis me.
  TROILUS. fair?
  PANDARUS. care no. fool stay
    father. Greeks; her
    time her. part, meddle make  
    i' th' matter.
  TROILUS. Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. I.
  TROILUS. Sweet Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. Pray you, speak me: leave all
    found it, end.               Exit. Sound alarum
  TROILUS. Peace, ungracious clamours! Peace, rude sounds!
    Fools sides! Helen fair,
    blood daily paint thus.
    fight argument;
    starv'd subject sword.
    Pandarus-O gods, plague me!
    Cressid Pandar;
    tetchy woo'd woo
    stubborn-chaste suit.
    me, Apollo, thy Daphne's love,
    Cressid is, Pandar, we?
    bed India; lies, pearl;
    Ilium resides
    call'd wild wand'ring flood;  
    Ourself merchant, sailing Pandar
    doubtful hope, convoy, bark.

                Alarum. Enter AENEAS

  AENEAS. now, Prince Troilus! Wherefore afield?
  TROILUS. there. woman's answer sorts,
    womanish thence.
    news, Aeneas, field to-day?
  AENEAS. Paris returned home, hurt.
  TROILUS. whom, Aeneas?
  AENEAS. Troilus, Menelaus.
  TROILUS. Paris bleed: 'tis scar scorn;
    Paris gor'd Menelaus' horn.                      [Alarum]
  AENEAS. Hark good sport town to-day!
  TROILUS. home, 'would might' 'may.'
    sport abroad. bound thither?
  AENEAS. swift haste.
  TROILUS. Come, together.                          Exeunt




ACT I. SCENE 2.
Troy. street

Enter CRESSIDA man ALEXANDER

  CRESSIDA. by?
  ALEXANDER. Queen Hecuba Helen.
  CRESSIDA. they?
  ALEXANDER. eastern tower,
    height commands subject vale,
    battle. Hector, patience
    virtue fix'd, to-day mov'd.
    chid Andromache, struck armourer;
    And, husbandry war,
    sun rose harness'd light,
    field he; flower
    prophet weep foresaw
    Hector's wrath.
  CRESSIDA. anger?
  ALEXANDER. noise goes, this: Greeks
    lord Troyan blood, nephew Hector;
    call Ajax.  
  CRESSIDA. Good; him?
  ALEXANDER. man se,
    stands alone.
  CRESSIDA. men, drunk, sick, no
    legs.
  ALEXANDER. man, lady, hath robb'd beasts their
    additions: valiant lion, churlish the
    bear, slow elephant-a man nature hath crowded
    humours valour crush'd folly, folly sauced
    discretion. man hath virtue hath a
    glimpse of, man attaint carries stain of
    it; melancholy merry hair; he
    hath joints thing; joint
    gouty Briareus, hands use, purblind
    Argus, eyes sight.
  CRESSIDA. man, makes smile, make Hector
      angry?
  ALEXANDER. yesterday cop'd Hector battle and
    struck down, disdain shame whereof hath since
    Hector fasting waking.  

                          Enter PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA. here?
  ALEXANDER. Madam, uncle Pandarus.
  CRESSIDA. Hector's gallant man.
  ALEXANDER. world, lady.
  PANDARUS. that? that?
  CRESSIDA. Good morrow, uncle Pandarus.
  PANDARUS. Good morrow, cousin Cressid. talk of?- Good
    morrow, Alexander.-How you, cousin? Ilium?
  CRESSIDA. morning, uncle.
  PANDARUS. talking came? Hector arm'd
    ere Ilium? Helen up, she?
  CRESSIDA. Hector gone; Helen up.
  PANDARUS. E'en so. Hector stirring early.
  CRESSIDA. talking of, anger.
  PANDARUS. angry?
  CRESSIDA. here.
  PANDARUS. True, so; too; lay  
    today, that. Troilus not
    him; heed Troilus, tell
    too.
  CRESSIDA. What, angry too?
  PANDARUS. Who, Troilus? Troilus man two.
  CRESSIDA. O Jupiter! comparison.
  PANDARUS. What, Troilus Hector? man
    him?
  CRESSIDA. Ay, knew him.
  PANDARUS. Well, Troilus Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. say, Hector.
  PANDARUS. No, Hector Troilus degrees.
  CRESSIDA. 'Tis them: himself.
  PANDARUS. Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! were!
  CRESSIDA. is.
  PANDARUS. Condition barefoot India.
  CRESSIDA. Hector.
  PANDARUS. Himself! no, himself. 'a himself!
    Well, gods above; time friend end. Well, Troilus,
    well! heart body! No, Hector  
    man Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. Excuse me.
  PANDARUS. elder.
  CRESSIDA. Pardon me, pardon me.
  PANDARUS. Th' other's to't; tale
    th' other's to't. Hector wit this
    year.
  CRESSIDA. own.
  PANDARUS. qualities.
  CRESSIDA. matter.
  PANDARUS. beauty.
  CRESSIDA. 'Twould him: own's better.
  PANDARUS. judgment, niece. Helen swore th'
    day Troilus, brown favour, 'tis, must
    confess- brown neither-
  CRESSIDA. No, brown.
  PANDARUS. Faith, truth, brown brown.
  CRESSIDA. truth, true true.
  PANDARUS. prais'd complexion Paris.
  CRESSIDA. Why, Paris hath colour enough.  
  PANDARUS. has.
  CRESSIDA. Troilus much. prais'd him
    above, complexion higher his; colour
    enough, higher, flaming praise good
    complexion. lief Helen's golden tongue commended
    Troilus copper nose.
  PANDARUS. swear Helen loves Paris.
  CRESSIDA. merry Greek indeed.
  PANDARUS. Nay, does. th' day
    compass'd window-and past or
    hairs chin-
  CRESSIDA. tapster's arithmetic bring his
    particulars total.
  PANDARUS. Why, young, pound
    lift brother Hector.
  CRESSIDA. young man lifter?
  PANDARUS. prove Helen loves him: and
    puts white hand cloven chin-
  CRESSIDA. Juno mercy! cloven?
  PANDARUS. Why, know, 'tis dimpled. smiling  
    man Phrygia.
  CRESSIDA. O, smiles valiantly!
  PANDARUS. not?
  CRESSIDA. O yes, 'twere cloud autumn!
  PANDARUS. Why, to, then! prove Helen loves
    Troilus-
  CRESSIDA. Troilus stand proof, prove so.
  PANDARUS. Troilus! Why, esteems esteem an
    addle egg.
  CRESSIDA. love addle egg love idle
    head, eat chickens i' th' shell.
  PANDARUS. choose laugh tickled his
    chin. Indeed, marvell's white hand, needs
    confess.
  CRESSIDA. rack.
  PANDARUS. takes spy white hair chin.
  CRESSIDA. Alas, poor chin! wart richer.
  PANDARUS. laughing! Queen Hecuba laugh'd that
    eyes ran o'er.
  CRESSIDA. millstones.  
  PANDARUS. Cassandra laugh'd.
  CRESSIDA. temperate fire pot her
    eyes. eyes run o'er too?
  PANDARUS. Hector laugh'd.
  CRESSIDA. laughing?
  PANDARUS. Marry, white hair Helen spied Troilus'
    chin.
  CRESSIDA. An't green hair laugh'd too.
  PANDARUS. laugh'd hair pretty
    answer.
  CRESSIDA. answer?
  PANDARUS. Quoth 'Here's fifty hairs chin,
    white.'
  CRESSIDA. question.
  PANDARUS. true; make question that. 'Two fifty
    hairs,' quoth 'and white. white hair father,
    rest sons.' 'Jupiter!' quoth 'which of
    hairs Paris husband?' 'The forked one,' quoth he,
    'pluck't give him.' laughing! and
    Helen blush'd, Paris chaf'd; rest  
    laugh'd pass'd.
  CRESSIDA. now; great by.
  PANDARUS. Well, cousin, told thing yesterday; on't.
  CRESSIDA. do.
  PANDARUS. sworn 'tis true; weep you, 'twere a
    man born April.
  CRESSIDA. spring tears, 'twere nettle
    May.                                    [Sound retreat]
  PANDARUS. Hark! coming field. stand up
    pass Ilium? Good niece, do,
    sweet niece Cressida.
  CRESSIDA. pleasure.
  PANDARUS. Here, here, excellent place; see
    bravely. names pass
    by; mark Troilus rest.

                       AENEAS passes

  CRESSIDA. Speak loud.
  PANDARUS. Aeneas. brave man?  
    flowers Troy, you. mark Troilus; see
    anon.

                       ANTENOR passes

  CRESSIDA. that?
  PANDARUS. Antenor. shrewd wit, you; and
    man good enough; o' th' soundest judgments in
    Troy, whosoever, proper man person. Troilus?
    show Troilus anon. me, nod
    me.
  CRESSIDA. give nod?
  PANDARUS. see.
  CRESSIDA. do, rich more.

                     HECTOR passes

  PANDARUS. Hector, that, that, you, that; a
    fellow! thy way, Hector! brave man, niece. O brave
    Hector! looks. countenance! Is't  
    brave man?
  CRESSIDA. O, brave man!
  PANDARUS. 'a not? man's heart good. what
    hacks helmet! yonder, see? you
    there. jesting; laying on; take't who
    will, say. hacks.
  CRESSIDA. swords?
  PANDARUS. Swords! anything, cares not; devil him,
    one. God's lid, one's heart good. Yonder
    Paris, yonder Paris.

                       PARIS passes

    ye yonder, niece; is't gallant man too, is't not? Why,
    brave now. hurt home to-day? not
    hurt. Why, Helen's heart good now, ha! could
    Troilus now! Troilus anon.

                      HELENUS passes
  
  CRESSIDA. that?
  PANDARUS. Helenus. marvel Troilus is. That's
    Helenus. to-day. Helenus.
  CRESSIDA. Helenus fight, uncle?
  PANDARUS. Helenus! no. Yes, fight indifferent well. marvel
    Troilus is. Hark! hear people cry 'Troilus'?
    Helenus priest.
  CRESSIDA. sneaking fellow yonder?

                    TROILUS passes

  PANDARUS. Where? yonder? Deiphobus. 'Tis Troilus. a
    man, niece. Hem! Brave Troilus, prince chivalry!
  CRESSIDA. Peace, shame, peace!
  PANDARUS. Mark him; note him. O brave Troilus! him,
    niece; sword bloodied, helm more
    hack'd Hector's; looks, goes! O
    admirable youth! twenty. thy way,
    Troilus, thy way. sister grace daughter a
    goddess, choice. O admirable man! Paris? Paris  
    dirt him; and, warrant, Helen, change, give an
    eye boot.
  CRESSIDA. more.

                 Common soldiers pass

  PANDARUS. Asses, fools, dolts! chaff bran, chaff bran!
    porridge meat! live die eyes Troilus.
    Ne'er look, ne'er look; eagles gone. Crows daws,
    crows daws! man Troilus than
    Agamemnon Greece.
  CRESSIDA. Greeks Achilles, man than
    Troilus.
  PANDARUS. Achilles? drayman, porter, camel!
  CRESSIDA. Well, well.
  PANDARUS. Well, well! Why, discretion? any
    eyes? man is? birth, beauty, good
    shape, discourse, manhood, learning, gentleness, virtue, youth,
    liberality, like, spice salt season man?
  CRESSIDA. Ay, minc'd man; bak'd date  
    pie, man's date out.
  PANDARUS. woman! man ward you
    lie.
  CRESSIDA. back, defend belly; wit, defend
    wiles; secrecy, defend mine honesty; mask, to
    defend beauty; you, defend these; these
    wards lie at, thousand watches.
  PANDARUS. watches.
  CRESSIDA. Nay, watch that; the
    chiefest too. ward hit,
    watch telling blow; swell
    past hiding, past watching
  PANDARUS. another!

                   Enter TROILUS' BOY

  BOY. Sir, lord instantly speak you.
  PANDARUS. Where?
  BOY. house; unarms him.
  PANDARUS. Good boy, come.                       Exit Boy  
    doubt hurt. Fare ye well, good niece.
  CRESSIDA. Adieu, uncle.
  PANDARUS. you, niece, by.
  CRESSIDA. bring, uncle.
  PANDARUS. Ay, token Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. token, bawd.
                                                        Exit PANDARUS
    Words, vows, gifts, tears, love's full sacrifice,
    offers another's enterprise;
    Troilus thousand-fold see
    glass Pandar's praise be,
    hold off. Women angels, wooing:
    Things won done; joy's soul lies doing.
    belov'd nought this:
    Men prize thing ungain'd is.
    knew
    Love sweet desire sue;
    maxim love teach:
    Achievement command; ungain'd, beseech.
    heart's content firm love doth bear,  
    mine eyes appear.                 Exit




ACT I. SCENE 3.
The Grecian camp. AGAMEMNON'S tent

Sennet. Enter AGAMEMNON, NESTOR, ULYSSES, DIOMEDES, MENELAUS, others

  AGAMEMNON. Princes,
    grief hath set jaundies o'er cheeks?
    ample proposition hope makes
    designs begun earth below
    Fails promis'd largeness; checks disasters
    Grow veins actions highest rear'd,
    knots, conflux meeting sap,
    Infects sound pine, diverts grain
    Tortive errant growth.
    Nor, princes, matter us
    short suppose far
    years' siege Troy walls stand;
    Sith action hath before,
    Whereof record, trial draw
    Bias thwart, answering aim,
    unbodied figure thought  
    gave't surmised shape. then, princes,
    cheeks abash'd behold works
    call shames, are, indeed, nought else
    protractive trials great Jove
    find persistive constancy men;
    fineness metal found
    fortune's love? bold coward,
    wise fool, artist unread,
    hard soft, affin'd kin.
    wind tempest frown
    Distinction, broad powerful fan,
    Puffing all, winnows light away;
    hath mass matter itself
    Lies rich virtue unmingled.
  NESTOR. due observance thy godlike seat,
    Great Agamemnon, Nestor apply
    Thy latest words. reproof chance
    Lies true proof men. sea smooth,
    shallow bauble boats dare sail
    patient breast, making  
    nobler bulk!
    ruffian Boreas enrage
    gentle Thetis, anon behold
    strong-ribb'd bark liquid mountains cut,
    Bounding moist elements
    Perseus' horse. saucy boat,
    weak untimber'd sides now
    Co-rivall'd greatness? harbour fled
    made toast Neptune. so
    Doth valour's show valour's worth divide
    storms fortune; ray brightness
    herd hath annoyance breeze
    tiger; splitting wind
    Makes flexible knees knotted oaks,
    flies fled shade-why, thing courage
    rous'd rage, rage doth sympathise,
    accent tun'd self-same key
    Retorts chiding fortune.
  ULYSSES. Agamemnon,
    Thou great commander, nerve bone Greece,  
    Heart numbers, soul spirit
    tempers minds all
    shut up-hear Ulysses speaks.
    applause approbation
    which, [To AGAMEMNON] mighty, thy place sway,
    [To NESTOR] And, thou reverend, thy stretch'd-out life,
    give speeches- such
    Agamemnon hand Greece
    hold high brass; again
    venerable Nestor, hatch'd silver,
    bond air, strong axle-tree
    heaven rides, knit Greekish ears
    experienc'd tongue-yet both,
    Thou great, wise, hear Ulysses speak.
  AGAMEMNON. Speak, Prince Ithaca; be't expect
    matter needless, importless burden,
    Divide thy lips confident,
    rank Thersites opes mastic jaws,
    hear music, wit, oracle.
  ULYSSES. Troy, basis, down,  
    great Hector's sword lack'd master,
    instances:
    specialty rule hath neglected;
    Grecian tents stand
    Hollow plain, hollow factions.
    general hive,
    foragers repair,
    honey expected? Degree vizarded,
    Th' unworthiest shows fairly mask.
    heavens themselves, planets, centre,
    Observe degree, priority, place,
    Insisture, course, proportion, season, form,
    Office, custom, line order;
    glorious planet Sol
    noble eminence enthron'd spher'd
    Amidst other, med'cinable eye
    Corrects ill aspects planets evil,
    posts, commandment king,
    Sans check, good bad. planets
    evil mixture disorder wander,  
    plagues portents, mutiny,
    raging sea, shaking earth,
    Commotion winds! Frights, changes, horrors,
    Divert crack, rend deracinate,
    unity married calm states
    fixture! O, degree shak'd,
    ladder high designs,
    enterprise sick! communities,
    Degrees schools, brotherhoods cities,
    Peaceful commerce dividable shores,
    primogenity due birth,
    Prerogative age, crowns, sceptres, laurels,
    degree, stand authentic place?
    degree away, untune string,
    hark discord follows! thing melts
    mere oppugnancy: bounded waters
    lift bosoms higher shores,
    make sop solid globe;
    Strength lord imbecility,
    rude son strike father dead;  
    Force right; or, rather, wrong-
    endless jar justice resides-
    lose names, justice too.
    includes power,
    Power will, appetite;
    appetite, universal wolf,
    doubly seconded power,
    make perforce universal prey,
    eat himself. Great Agamemnon,
    chaos, degree suffocate,
    choking.
    neglection degree is
    pace backward, purpose
    hath climb. general's disdain'd
    step below, next,
    beneath; step,
    Exampl'd pace sick
    superior, grows envious fever
    pale bloodless emulation.
    'tis fever Troy foot,  
    sinews. end tale length,
    Troy weakness stands, strength.
  NESTOR. wisely hath Ulysses discover'd
    fever whereof power sick.
  AGAMEMNON. nature sickness found, Ulysses,
    remedy?
  ULYSSES. great Achilles, opinion crowns
    sinew forehand host,
    ear full airy fame,
    Grows dainty worth, tent
    Lies mocking designs; Patroclus
    lazy bed livelong day
    Breaks scurril jests;
    ridiculous awkward action-
    Which, slanderer, imitation calls-
    pageants us. Sometime, great Agamemnon,
    Thy topless deputation puts on;
    strutting player conceit
    Lies hamstring, doth rich
    hear wooden dialogue sound  
    'Twixt stretch'd footing scaffoldage-
    to-be-pitied o'er-wrested seeming
    acts thy greatness in; speaks
    'Tis chime a-mending; terms unsquar'd,
    Which, tongue roaring Typhon dropp'd,
    hyperboles. fusty stuff
    large Achilles, press'd bed lolling,
    deep chest laughs loud applause;
    Cries 'Excellent! 'tis Agamemnon just.
    play Nestor; hem, stroke thy beard,
    drest oration.'
    done-as extremest ends
    parallels, Vulcan wife;
    god Achilles cries 'Excellent!
    'Tis Nestor right. play me, Patroclus,
    Arming answer night alarm.'
    then, forsooth, faint defects age
    scene mirth: cough spit
    And, palsy-fumbling gorget,
    Shake rivet. sport  
    Sir Valour dies; cries 'O, enough, Patroclus;
    give ribs steel! split all
    pleasure spleen.' fashion
    abilities, gifts, natures, shapes,
    Severals generals grace exact,
    Achievements, plots, orders, preventions,
    Excitements field speech truce,
    Success loss, not, serves
    stuff make paradoxes.
  NESTOR. imitation twain-
    Who, Ulysses says, opinion crowns
    imperial voice-many infect.
    Ajax grown self-will'd bears head
    rein, full proud place
    broad Achilles; tent him;
    Makes factious feasts; rails state war
    Bold oracle, sets Thersites,
    slave gall coins slanders mint,
    match comparisons dirt,
    weaken discredit exposure,  
    rank soever rounded danger.
  ULYSSES. tax policy call cowardice,
    Count wisdom member war,
    Forestall prescience, esteem act
    hand. mental parts
    contrive hands strike
    fitness calls on, know, measure
    observant toil, enemies' weight-
    Why, hath finger's dignity:
    call bed-work, mapp'ry, closet-war;
    ram batters wall,
    great swinge rudeness poise,
    place hand made engine,
    fineness souls
    reason guide execution.
  NESTOR. granted, Achilles' horse
    Makes Thetis' sons.                                 [Tucket]
  AGAMEMNON. trumpet? Look, Menelaus.
  MENELAUS. Troy.
  
                      Enter AENEAS

  AGAMEMNON. fore tent?
  AENEAS. great Agamemnon's tent, pray you?
  AGAMEMNON. this.
  AENEAS. herald prince
    fair message kingly eyes?
  AGAMEMNON. surety stronger Achilles' an
    Fore Greekish heads, voice
    Call Agamemnon head general.
  AENEAS. Fair leave large security. may
    stranger imperial looks
    eyes mortals?
  AGAMEMNON. How?
  AENEAS. Ay;
    ask, waken reverence,
    bid cheek ready blush
    Modest Morning coldly eyes
    youthful Phoebus.
    god office, guiding men?  
    high mighty Agamemnon?
  AGAMEMNON. Troyan scorns us, men Troy
    ceremonious courtiers.
  AENEAS. Courtiers free, debonair, unarm'd,
    bending angels; fame peace.
    soldiers, galls,
    Good arms, strong joints, true swords; and, Jove's accord,
    full heart. peace, Aeneas,
    Peace, Troyan; lay thy finger thy lips.
    worthiness praise distains worth,
    prais'd bring praise forth;
    repining enemy commends,
    breath fame blows; praise, sole pure, transcends.
  AGAMEMNON. Sir, Troy, call Aeneas?
  AENEAS. Ay, Greek, name.
  AGAMEMNON. affair, pray you?
  AENEAS. Sir, pardon; 'tis Agamemnon's ears.
  AGAMEMNON. hears nought privately Troy.
  AENEAS. Troy whisper him;
    bring trumpet awake ear,  
    set sense attentive bent,
    speak.
  AGAMEMNON. Speak frankly wind;
    Agamemnon's sleeping hour.
    thou shalt know, Troyan, awake,
    tells thee himself.
  AENEAS. Trumpet, blow loud,
    Send thy brass voice lazy tents;
    Greek mettle, know
    Troy means fairly spoke aloud.
                                                      [Sound trumpet]
    have, great Agamemnon, Troy
    prince called Hector-Priam father-
    dull long-continued truce
    resty grown; bade trumpet
    purpose speak: Kings, princes, lords!
    fair'st Greece
    holds honour higher ease,
    seeks praise fears peril,
    valour fear,  
    loves mistress confession
    truant vows lips loves,
    dare avow beauty worth
    arms hers-to challenge.
    Hector, view Troyans Greeks,
    make good it:
    hath lady wiser, fairer, truer,
    Greek couple arms;
    to-morrow trumpet call
    Mid-way tents walls Troy
    rouse Grecian true love.
    come, Hector honour him;
    none, Troy, retires,
    Grecian dames sunburnt worth
    splinter lance. much.
  AGAMEMNON. told lovers, Lord Aeneas.
    soul kind,
    left home. soldiers;
    soldier mere recreant prove
    means not, hath not, love.  
    is, hath, means be,
    meets Hector; else, he.
  NESTOR. Nestor, man
    Hector's grandsire suck'd. now;
    Grecian mould
    noble man hath spark fire
    answer love, me
    hide silver beard gold beaver,
    vantbrace put wither'd brawn,
    And, meeting him, lady
    fairer grandame, chaste
    world. youth flood,
    prove truth drops blood.
  AENEAS. heavens forfend scarcity youth!
  ULYSSES. Amen.
  AGAMEMNON. Fair Lord Aeneas, touch hand;
    pavilion lead you, first.
    Achilles word intent;
    lord Greece, tent tent.
    feast go,  
    find noble foe.
                                    Exeunt ULYSSES NESTOR
  ULYSSES. Nestor!
  NESTOR. Ulysses?
  ULYSSES. young conception brain;
    time bring shape.
  NESTOR. is't?
  ULYSSES. 'tis:
    Blunt wedges rive hard knots. seeded pride
    hath maturity blown up
    rank Achilles cropp'd
    Or, shedding, breed nursery evil
    overbulk all.
  NESTOR. Well, how?
  ULYSSES. challenge gallant Hector sends,
    spread general name,
    Relates purpose Achilles.
  NESTOR. True. purpose perspicuous substance
    grossness characters sum up;
    And, publication, make strain  
    Achilles, brain barren
    banks Libya-though, Apollo knows,
    'Tis dry enough-will great speed judgment,
    Ay, celerity, find Hector's purpose
    Pointing him.
  ULYSSES. wake answer, you?
  NESTOR. Why, 'tis meet. oppose
    Hector bring honours off,
    Achilles? 't sportful combat,
    trial opinion dwells;
    Troyans taste dear'st repute
    fin'st palate; trust me, Ulysses,
    imputation oddly pois'd
    vile action; success,
    particular, give scantling
    good bad general;
    indexes, small pricks
    subsequent volumes, seen
    baby figure giant mas
    things large. suppos'd  
    meets Hector issues choice;
    choice, mutual act souls,
    Makes merit election, doth boil,
    'twere all, man distill'd
    virtues; miscarrying,
    heart receives conquering part,
    steel strong opinion themselves?
    entertain'd, limbs instruments,
    working swords bows
    Directive limbs.
  ULYSSES. Give pardon speech.
    'tis meet Achilles meet Hector.
    us, merchants, show foulest wares
    perchance sell; not, lustre
    show show better,
    showing worst first. consent
    Hector Achilles meet;
    honour shame this
    dogg'd strange followers.
  NESTOR. eyes. they?  
  ULYSSES. glory Achilles shares Hector,
    proud, wear him;
    insolent;
    parch Afric sun
    pride salt scorn eyes,
    scape Hector fair. foil'd,
    Why, main opinion crush
    taint man. No, make lott'ry;
    And, device, blockish Ajax draw
    sort fight Hector. ourselves
    Give allowance man;
    physic great Myrmidon,
    broils loud applause, make fall
    crest, prouder blue Iris bends.
    dull brainless Ajax safe off,
    dress voices; fail,
    opinion still
    men. But, hit miss,
    project's life shape sense assumes-
    Ajax employ'd plucks Achilles' plumes.  
  NESTOR. Now, Ulysses, begin relish thy advice;
    give taste thereof forthwith
    Agamemnon. straight.
    curs tame other: pride alone
    tarre mastiffs on, 'twere bone.          Exeunt

ACT II. SCENE 1.
The Grecian camp

Enter Ajax THERSITES

  AJAX. Thersites!
  THERSITES. Agamemnon-how boils full, over, generally?
  AJAX. Thersites!
  THERSITES. boils run-say so. general run
    then? botchy core?
  AJAX. Dog!
  THERSITES. matter him;
    now.
  AJAX. Thou bitch-wolf's son, canst thou hear? Feel, then.
                                                        [Strikes him]
  THERSITES. plague Greece thee, thou mongrel beef-witted
    lord!
  AJAX. Speak, then, thou whinid'st leaven, speak. beat thee
    handsomeness.
  THERSITES. sooner rail thee wit holiness; I
    thy horse sooner con oration thou learn a
    prayer book. Thou canst strike, canst thou? red murrain  
    o' thy jade's tricks!
  AJAX. Toadstool, learn proclamation.
  THERSITES. Dost thou sense, thou strikest thus?
  AJAX. proclamation!
  THERSITES. Thou art proclaim'd, fool, think.
  AJAX. not, porpentine, not; fingers itch.
  THERSITES. thou didst itch head foot the
    scratching thee; make thee loathsomest scab in
    Greece. thou art incursions, thou strikest as
    slow another.
  AJAX. say, proclamation.
  THERSITES. Thou grumblest railest hour Achilles; and
    thou art full envy greatness Cerberus at
    Proserpina's beauty-ay, thou bark'st him.
  AJAX. Mistress Thersites!
  THERSITES. Thou shouldst strike him.
  AJAX. Cobloaf!
  THERSITES. pun thee shivers fist, a
    sailor breaks biscuit.
  AJAX. whoreson cur!                               [Strikes him]  
  THERSITES. Do, do.
  AJAX. Thou stool witch!
  THERSITES. Ay, do, do; thou sodden-witted lord! Thou hast more
    brain mine elbows; assinico tutor thee. You
    scurvy valiant ass! Thou art thrash Troyans, thou
    art bought sold wit barbarian
    slave. thou beat me, begin thy heel tell
    thou art inches, thou thing bowels, thou!
  AJAX. dog!
  THERSITES. scurvy lord!
  AJAX. cur!                                        [Strikes him]
  THERSITES. Mars idiot! Do, rudeness; do, camel; do, do.

                 Enter ACHILLES PATROCLUS

  ACHILLES. Why, now, Ajax! Wherefore thus?
    now, Thersites! matter, man?
  THERSITES. there, you?
  ACHILLES. Ay; matter?
  THERSITES. Nay, him.  
  ACHILLES. do. matter?
  THERSITES. Nay, regard well.
  ACHILLES. Well! why, do.
  THERSITES. him; ever
    be, Ajax.
  ACHILLES. that, fool.
  THERSITES. Ay, fool himself.
  AJAX. beat thee.
  THERSITES. Lo, lo, lo, lo, modicums wit utters! His
    evasions ears long. bobb'd brain than
    beat bones. buy sparrows penny, and
    pia mater worth ninth part sparrow. This
    lord, Achilles, Ajax-who wears wit belly guts
    head-I'll him.
  ACHILLES. What?
  THERSITES. Ajax-             [AJAX offers strike him]
  ACHILLES. Nay, good Ajax.
  THERSITES. wit-
  ACHILLES. Nay, hold you.
  THERSITES. stop eye Helen's needle,  
    fight.
  ACHILLES. Peace, fool.
  THERSITES. peace quietness, fool not-
    there; he; there.
  AJAX. O thou damned cur! shall-
  ACHILLES. set wit fool's?
  THERSITES. No, warrant you, fool's shame it.
  PATROCLUS. Good words, Thersites.
  ACHILLES. quarrel?
  AJAX. bade vile owl learn tenour the
    proclamation, rails me.
  THERSITES. serve thee not.
  AJAX. Well, to, to.
  THERSITES. serve voluntary.
  ACHILLES. service suff'rance; 'twas voluntary. No
    man beaten voluntary. Ajax voluntary, as
    impress.
  THERSITES. E'en so; great deal wit lies your
    sinews, liars. Hector great catch
    knock brains: 'a good crack  
    fusty nut kernel.
  ACHILLES. What, too, Thersites?
  THERSITES. Ulysses Nestor-whose wit mouldy ere
    grandsires nails toes-yoke draught
    oxen, make plough wars.
  ACHILLES. What, what?
  THERSITES. Yes, good sooth. Achilles, Ajax, to-
  AJAX. cut tongue.
  THERSITES. 'Tis matter; speak thou
    afterwards.
  PATROCLUS. words, Thersites; peace!
  THERSITES. hold peace Achilles' brach bids me, shall
    I?
  ACHILLES. you, Patroclus.
  THERSITES. hang'd clotpoles ere more
    tents. wit stirring, leave
    faction fools.                                        Exit
  PATROCLUS. good riddance.
  ACHILLES. Marry, this, sir, proclaim'd host,
    Hector, hour sun,  
    trumpet 'twixt tents Troy,
    To-morrow morning, call knight arms
    hath stomach; dare
    Maintain what; 'tis trash. Farewell.
  AJAX. Farewell. answer him?
  ACHILLES. not; 'tis put lott'ry. Otherwise. knew his
    man.
  AJAX. O, meaning you! learn it.            Exeunt




ACT II. SCENE 2.
Troy. PRIAM'S palace

Enter PRIAM, HECTOR, TROILUS, PARIS, HELENUS

  PRIAM. hours, lives, speeches, spent,
    Nestor Greeks:
    'Deliver Helen, damage else-
    honour, loss time, travail, expense,
    Wounds, friends, dear consum'd
    hot digestion cormorant war-
    struck off.' Hector, to't?
  HECTOR. man lesser fears Greeks I,
    toucheth particular,
    Yet, dread Priam,
    lady softer bowels,
    spongy suck sense fear,
    ready cry 'Who follows?'
    Hector is. wound peace surety,
    Surety secure; modest doubt call'd
    beacon wise, tent searches
    th' bottom worst. Helen go.  
    sword drawn question,
    tithe soul 'mongst thousand dismes
    Hath dear Helen-I mean, ours.
    lost tenths ours
    guard thing ours, worth us,
    name, ten,
    merit's reason denies
    yielding up?
  TROILUS. Fie, fie, brother!
    Weigh worth honour king,
    great dread father's, scale
    common ounces? counters sum
    past-proportion infinite,
    buckle waist fathomless
    spans inches diminutive
    fears reasons? Fie, godly shame!
  HELENUS. marvel bite sharp reasons,
    empty them. father
    Bear great sway affairs reasons,
    speech hath tells so?  
  TROILUS. dreams slumbers, brother priest;
    fur gloves reason. reasons:
    enemy intends harm;
    sword employ'd perilous,
    reason flies object harm.
    marvels, then, Helenus beholds
    Grecian sword, set
    wings reason heels
    fly chidden Mercury Jove,
    star disorb'd? Nay, talk reason,
    shut gates sleep. Manhood honour
    hare hearts, fat thoughts
    cramm'd reason. Reason respect
    Make livers pale lustihood deject.
  HECTOR. Brother, worth doth, cost
    keeping.
  TROILUS. aught 'tis valued?
  HECTOR. dwells will:
    holds estimate dignity
    'tis precious  
    prizer. 'Tis mad idolatry
    make service greater god-I
    dotes attributive
    infectiously affects,
    image th' affected merit.
  TROILUS. to-day wife, election
    led conduct will;
    enkindled mine eyes ears,
    traded pilots 'twixt dangerous shores
    judgment: avoid,
    distaste elected,
    wife chose? evasion
    blench stand firm honour.
    turn back silks merchant
    soil'd them; remainder viands
    throw unrespective sieve,
    full. thought meet
    Paris vengeance Greeks;
    breath full consent benied sails;
    seas winds, wranglers, truce,  
    service. touch'd ports desir'd;
    aunt Greeks held captive
    brought Grecian queen, youth freshness
    Wrinkles Apollo's, makes stale morning.
    her? Grecians aunt.
    worth keeping? Why, pearl
    price hath launch'd thousand ships,
    turn'd crown'd kings merchants.
    avouch 'twas wisdom Paris went-
    needs, cried 'Go, go'-
    confess brought home worthy prize-
    needs, clapp'd hands,
    cried 'Inestimable!' -why now
    issue proper wisdoms rate,
    deed fortune did-
    Beggar estimation priz'd
    Richer sea land? O theft base,
    stol'n fear keep!
    thieves unworthy thing stol'n
    country disgrace  
    fear warrant native place!
  CASSANDRA. [Within] Cry, Troyans, cry.
  PRIAM. noise, shriek this?
  TROILUS. 'Tis mad sister; voice.
  CASSANDRA. [Within] Cry, Troyans.
  HECTOR. Cassandra.

                  Enter CASSANDRA, raving

  CASSANDRA. Cry, Troyans, cry. Lend ten thousand eyes,
    fill prophetic tears.
  HECTOR. Peace, sister, peace.
  CASSANDRA. Virgins boys, mid-age wrinkled eld,
    Soft infancy, canst cry,
    Add clamours. pay betimes
    moiety mass moan come.
    Cry, Troyans, cry. Practise eyes tears.
    Troy be, goodly Ilion stand;
    firebrand brother, Paris, burns all.
    Cry, Troyans, cry, Helen woe!  
    Cry, cry. Troy burns, Helen go.                  Exit
  HECTOR. Now, youthful Troilus, high strains
    divination sister work
    touches remorse, blood
    madly hot discourse reason,
    fear bad success bad cause,
    qualify same?
  TROILUS. Why, brother Hector,
    justness act
    event doth form it;
    deject courage minds
    Cassandra's mad. brain-sick raptures
    distaste goodness quarrel
    hath honours engag'd
    make gracious. private part,
    touch'd Priam's sons;
    Jove forbid us
    things offend weakest spleen
    fight maintain.
  PARIS. world convince levity  
    undertakings counsels;
    attest gods, full consent
    Gave wings propension, cut of
    fears attending dire project.
    what, alas, single arms?
    propugnation man's valour
    stand push enmity those
    quarrel excite? Yet, protest,
    pass difficulties,
    ample power will,
    Paris ne'er retract hath done
    faint pursuit.
  PRIAM. Paris, speak
    besotted sweet delights.
    honey still, gall;
    valiant praise all.
  PARIS. Sir, propose myself
    pleasures beauty brings it;
    soil fair rape
    Wip'd honourable keeping her.  
    treason ransack'd queen,
    Disgrace great worths, shame me,
    deliver possession up
    terms base compulsion! be
    degenerate strain this
    set footing generous bosoms?
    meanest spirit party
    heart dare sword draw
    Helen defended; noble
    life ill bestow'd death unfam'd
    Helen subject. Then, say,
    fight well
    world's large spaces parallel.
  HECTOR. Paris Troilus, well;
    question hand
    gloz'd, superficially; much
    Unlike young men, Aristode thought
    Unfit hear moral philosophy.
    reasons allege conduce
    hot passion distemp'red blood  
    make free determination
    'Twixt wrong; pleasure revenge
    ears deaf adders voice
    true decision. Nature craves
    dues rend'red owners. Now,
    nearer debt humanity
    wife husband? law
    nature corrupted affection;
    great minds, partial indulgence
    benumbed wills, resist same;
    law well-order'd nation
    curb raging appetites are
    disobedient refractory.
    Helen, then, wife Sparta's king-
    is-these moral laws
    nature nations speak aloud
    back return'd. persist
    wrong extenuates wrong,
    makes heavy. Hector's opinion
    this, truth. Yet, ne'er less,  
    spritely brethren, propend you
    resolution Helen still;
    'tis hath dependence
    joint dignities.
  TROILUS. Why, touch'd life design.
    glory affected
    performance heaving spleens,
    drop Troyan blood
    Spent defence. But, worthy Hector,
    theme honour renown,
    spur valiant magnanimous deeds,
    present courage beat foes,
    fame time canonize us;
    presume brave Hector lose
    rich advantage promis'd glory
    smiles forehead action
    wide world's revenue.
  HECTOR. yours,
    valiant offspring great Priamus.
    roisting challenge  
    dull factious nobles Greeks
    strike amazement drowsy spirits.
    advertis'd great general slept,
    Whilst emulation army crept.
    This, presume, wake him.                            Exeunt




ACT II. SCENE 3.
The Grecian camp. tent ACHILLES

Enter THERSITES, solus

  THERSITES. now, Thersites! What, lost labyrinth thy
    fury? elephant Ajax carry thus? beats me, I
    rail him. O worthy satisfaction! otherwise: that
    beat him, whilst rail'd me! 'Sfoot, learn to
    conjure raise devils, issue spiteful
    execrations. Achilles, rare engineer! Troy be
    till undermine it, walls stand till
    fall themselves. O thou great thunder-darter Olympus,
    forget thou art Jove, king gods, and, Mercury, lose
    serpentine craft thy caduceus, ye that
    less-than-little wit have!
    short-arm'd ignorance abundant scarce,
    circumvention deliver fly spider without
    drawing massy irons cutting web. this, the
    vengeance camp! or, rather, Neapolitan
    bone-ache! that, methinks, curse depending those
    war placket. prayers; devil Envy  
    'Amen.' ho! Lord Achilles!

                      Enter PATROCLUS

  PATROCLUS. there? Thersites! Good Thersites, and
    rail.
  THERSITES. 'a rememb'red gilt counterfeit, thou
    wouldst slipp'd contemplation; no
    matter; thyself thyself! common curse mankind, folly
    ignorance, thine great revenue! Heaven bless thee from
    tutor, discipline thee! thy blood thy
    direction till thy death. lays thee says
    thou art fair corse, sworn sworn upon't never
    shrouded lazars. Amen. Achilles?
  PATROCLUS. What, art thou devout? Wast thou prayer?
  THERSITES. Ay, heavens hear me!
  PATROCLUS. Amen.

                      Enter ACHILLES
  
  ACHILLES. there?
  PATROCLUS. Thersites, lord.
  ACHILLES. Where, where? O, where? Art thou come? Why, cheese, my
    digestion, hast thou served thyself table so
    meals? Come, Agamemnon?
  THERSITES. Thy commander, Achilles. me, Patroclus, what's
    Achilles?
  PATROCLUS. Thy lord, Thersites. me, pray thee, what's
    Thersites?
  THERSITES. Thy knower, Patroclus. me, Patroclus, art
    thou?
  PATROCLUS. Thou knowest.
  ACHILLES. O, tell, tell,
  THERSITES. decline question. Agamemnon commands
    Achilles; Achilles lord; Patroclus' knower; and
    Patroclus fool.
  PATROCLUS. rascal!
  THERSITES. Peace, fool! done.
  ACHILLES. privileg'd man. Proceed, Thersites.
  THERSITES. Agamemnon fool; Achilles fool; Thersites  
    fool; and, aforesaid, Patroclus fool.
  ACHILLES. Derive this; come.
  THERSITES. Agamemnon fool offer command Achilles;
    Achilles fool commanded Agamemnon; Thersites a
    fool serve fool; Patroclus fool positive.
  PATROCLUS. fool?
  THERSITES. Make demand Creator. suffices thou
    art. you, here?
  ACHILLES. Come, Patroclus, speak nobody. me,
    Thersites.                                                   Exit
  THERSITES. patchery, juggling, knavery.
    argument whore cuckold-a good quarrel draw
    emulous factions bleed death upon. dry serpigo on
    subject, war lechery confound all!               Exit

         Enter AGAMEMNON, ULYSSES, NESTOR, DIOMEDES,
                   AJAX, CALCHAS

  AGAMEMNON. Achilles?
  PATROCLUS. tent; ill-dispos'd, lord.  
  AGAMEMNON. here.
    shent messengers; lay by
    appertainings, visiting him.
    told so; lest, perchance, think
    dare move question place
    are.
  PATROCLUS. him.                              Exit
  ULYSSES. opening tent.
    sick.
  AJAX. Yes, lion-sick, sick proud heart. call it
    melancholy, favour man; but, head, 'tis
    pride. why, why? show cause. word, lord.
                                              [Takes AGAMEMNON aside]
  NESTOR. moves Ajax bay him?
  ULYSSES. Achilles hath inveigled fool him.
  NESTOR.Who, Thersites?
  ULYSSES. He.
  NESTOR. Ajax lack matter, lost argument
  ULYSSES. No; argument argument-
    Achilles.  
  NESTOR. better; fraction their
    faction. strong composure fool disunite!
  ULYSSES. amity wisdom knits not, folly easily untie.

                    Re-enter PATROCLUS

    Patroclus.
  NESTOR. Achilles him.
  ULYSSES. elephant hath joints, courtesy; legs
    legs necessity, flexure.
  PATROCLUS. Achilles bids sorry
    thing sport pleasure
    move greatness noble state
    call him; hopes other
    health digestion sake,
    after-dinner's breath.
  AGAMEMNON. Hear you, Patroclus.
    acquainted answers;
    evasion, wing'd swift scorn,
    outfly apprehensions.  
    attribute hath, reason
    ascribe him. virtues,
    virtuously part beheld,
    eyes begin lose gloss;
    Yea, fair fruit unwholesome dish,
    rot untasted. him
    speak him; sin
    over-proud
    under-honest, self-assumption greater
    note judgment; worthier himself
    tend savage strangeness puts on,
    Disguise holy strength command,
    underwrite observing kind
    humorous predominance; yea, watch
    pettish lunes, ebbs, flows, if
    passage carriage action
    Rode tide. this, ad
    overhold price much
    him, him, engine
    portable, lie report:  
    Bring action hither; war.
    stirring dwarf allowance give
    sleeping giant. so.
  PATROCLUS. shall, bring answer presently.            Exit
  AGAMEMNON. voice satisfied;
    speak him. Ulysses, enter you.
                                                         Exit ULYSSES
  AJAX. another?
  AGAMEMNON. thinks is.
  AJAX. much? thinks better
    man am?
  AGAMEMNON. question.
  AJAX. subscribe thought is?
  AGAMEMNON. No, noble Ajax; strong, valiant, wise,
    noble, gentle, altogether tractable.
  AJAX. man proud? doth pride grow? not
    pride is.
  AGAMEMNON. mind clearer, Ajax, virtues the
    fairer. proud eats himself. Pride glass,
    trumpet, chronicle; praises  
    deed devours deed praise.

                      Re-enter ULYSSES

  AJAX. hate proud man hate engend'ring toads.
  NESTOR. [Aside] loves himself: is't strange?
  ULYSSES. Achilles field to-morrow.
  AGAMEMNON. excuse?
  ULYSSES. doth rely none;
    carries stream dispose,
    observance respect any,
    peculiar self-admission.
  AGAMEMNON. not, fair request,
    Untent person share air us?
  ULYSSES. Things small nothing, request's sake only,
    makes important; possess'd greatness,
    speaks pride
    quarrels self-breath. Imagin'd worth
    Holds blood swol'n hot discourse
    'twixt mental active parts  
    Kingdom'd Achilles commotion rages,
    batters himself. say?
    plaguy proud death tokens it
    Cry 'No recovery.'
  AGAMEMNON. Ajax him.
    Dear lord, greet tent.
    'Tis holds well; led
    request himself.
  ULYSSES. O Agamemnon, so!
    consecrate steps Ajax makes
    Achilles. proud lord
    bastes arrogance seam
    suffers matter world
    Enter thoughts, save doth revolve
    ruminate himself-shall worshipp'd
    hold idol he?
    No, thrice-worthy valiant lord
    stale palm, nobly acquir'd,
    Nor, will, assubjugate merit,
    amply titled Achilles is,  
    Achilles.
    enlard fat-already pride,
    add coals Cancer burns
    entertaining great Hyperion.
    lord him! Jupiter forbid,
    thunder 'Achilles him.'
  NESTOR. [Aside] O, well! rubs vein him.
  DIOMEDES. [Aside] silence drinks applause!
  AJAX. him, armed fist pash o'er the
    face.
  AGAMEMNON. O, no, go.
  AJAX. 'a proud pheeze pride.
    him.
  ULYSSES. worth hangs quarrel.
  AJAX. paltry, insolent fellow!
  NESTOR. [Aside] describes himself!
  AJAX. sociable?
  ULYSSES. [Aside] raven chides blackness.
  AJAX. humours blood.
  AGAMEMNON. [Aside] physician  
    patient.
  AJAX. men mind-
  ULYSSES. [Aside] Wit fashion.
  AJAX. 'A bear so, 'a eat's words first.
    pride carry it?
  NESTOR. [Aside] 'twould, carry half.
  ULYSSES. [Aside] 'A ten shares.
  AJAX. knead him, make supple.
  NESTOR. [Aside] warm. Force praises;
    pour in, pour in; ambition dry.
  ULYSSES. [To AGAMEMNON] lord, feed dislike.
  NESTOR. noble general, so.
  DIOMEDES. prepare fight Achilles.
  ULYSSES. 'tis naming harm.
    man-but 'tis face;
    silent.
  NESTOR. Wherefore so?
    emulous, Achilles is.
  ULYSSES. world, valiant.
  AJAX. whoreson dog, palter thus!  
    Troyan!
  NESTOR. vice Ajax now-
  ULYSSES. proud.
  DIOMEDES. covetous praise.
  ULYSSES. Ay, surly borne.
  DIOMEDES. strange, self-affected.
  ULYSSES. heavens, lord, thou art sweet composure
    Praise gat thee, gave thee suck;
    Fam'd thy tutor, thy parts nature
    Thrice-fam'd beyond, erudition;
    disciplin'd thine arms fight-
    Mars divide eternity twain
    give half; and, thy vigour,
    Bull-bearing Milo addition yield
    sinewy Ajax. praise thy wisdom,
    Which, bourn, pale, shore, confines
    Thy spacious dilated parts. Nestor,
    Instructed antiquary times-
    must, is, wise;
    pardon, father Nestor, days  
    green Ajax' brain temper'd,
    eminence him,
    Ajax.
  AJAX. call father?
  NESTOR. Ay, good son.
  DIOMEDES. rul'd him, Lord Ajax.
  ULYSSES. tarrying here; hart Achilles
    thicket. great general
    call state war;
    Fresh kings Troy. To-morrow
    main power stand fast;
    lord-come knights east west
    cull flower, Ajax cope best.
  AGAMEMNON. council. Achilles sleep.
    Light boats sail swift, greater hulks draw deep.
    Exeunt
