ACT III. SCENE 1.
Troy. PRIAM'S palace

Music sounds within. Enter PANDARUS SERVANT

  PANDARUS. Friend, you-pray you, word. follow young
    Lord Paris?
  SERVANT. Ay, sir, me.
  PANDARUS. depend him, mean?
  SERVANT. Sir, depend lord.
  PANDARUS. depend notable gentleman; praise
    him.
  SERVANT. lord praised!
  PANDARUS. me, not?
  SERVANT. Faith, sir, superficially.
  PANDARUS. Friend, better: Lord Pandarus.
  SERVANT. hope honour better.
  PANDARUS. desire it.
  SERVANT. state grace.
  PANDARUS. Grace! so, friend; honour lordship titles.
    music this?
  SERVANT. partly know, sir; music parts.  
  PANDARUS. musicians?
  SERVANT. Wholly, sir.
  PANDARUS. play to?
  SERVANT. hearers, sir.
  PANDARUS. pleasure, friend?
  SERVANT. mine, sir, love music.
  PANDARUS. Command, mean, friend.
  SERVANT. command, sir?
  PANDARUS. Friend, understand another: courtly,
    thou art cunning. request men play?
  SERVANT. to't, indeed, sir. Marry, sir, request of
    Paris lord, person; mortal Venus,
    heart-blood beauty, love's invisible soul-
  PANDARUS. Who, cousin, Cressida?
  SERVANT. No, sir, Helen. find her
    attributes?
  PANDARUS. seem, fellow, thou hast Lady
    Cressida. speak Paris Prince Troilus; I
    make complimental assault him, business
    seethes.  
  SERVANT. Sodden business! stew'd phrase indeed!

              Enter PARIS HELEN, attended

  PANDARUS. Fair you, lord, fair company!
    Fair desires, fair measure, fairly guide them- especially
    you, fair queen! Fair thoughts fair pillow.
  HELEN. Dear lord, full fair words.
  PANDARUS. speak fair pleasure, sweet queen. Fair prince,
    good broken music.
  PARIS. broke it, cousin; life, make it
    again; piece piece your
    performance.
  HELEN. full harmony.
  PANDARUS. Truly, lady, no.
  HELEN. O, sir-
  PANDARUS. Rude, sooth; good sooth, rude.
  PARIS. said, lord. Well, fits.
  PANDARUS. business lord, dear queen. lord, you
    vouchsafe word?  
  HELEN. Nay, hedge out. hear sing,
    certainly-
  PANDARUS. sweet queen, pleasant me. But, marry,
    thus, lord: dear lord esteemed friend, your
    brother Troilus-
  HELEN. Lord Pandarus, honey-sweet lord-
  PANDARUS. to, sweet queen, to-commends most
    affectionately you-
  HELEN. bob melody. do, our
    melancholy head!
  PANDARUS. Sweet queen, sweet queen; sweet queen, i' faith.
  HELEN. make sweet lady sad sour offence.
  PANDARUS. Nay, serve turn; not,
    truth, la. Nay, care words; no, no. -And, my
    lord, desires that, King call supper,
    make excuse.
  HELEN. Lord Pandarus!
  PANDARUS. sweet queen, sweet queen?
  PARIS. exploit's hand? sups to-night?
  HELEN. Nay, but, lord-  
  PANDARUS. sweet queen?-My cousin fall with
    you.
  HELEN. sups.
  PARIS. lay life, disposer Cressida.
  PANDARUS. No, no, matter; wide. Come, disposer
    sick.
  PARIS. Well, make's excuse.
  PANDARUS. Ay, good lord. Cressida?
    No, poor disposer's sick.
  PARIS. spy.
  PANDARUS. spy! spy?-Come, give instrument.
    Now, sweet queen.
  HELEN. Why, kindly done.
  PANDARUS. niece horribly love thing have, sweet
    queen.
  HELEN. it, lord, Lord Paris.
  PANDARUS. He! No, him; twain.
  HELEN. Falling in, falling out, make three.
  PANDARUS. Come, come. hear this; sing a
    song now.  
  HELEN. Ay, ay, prithee now. troth, sweet lord, thou hast a
    fine forehead.
  PANDARUS. Ay, may, may.
  HELEN. thy song love. love undo all. O Cupid,
    Cupid, Cupid!
  PANDARUS. Love! Ay, shall, i' faith.
  PARIS. Ay, good now, love, love, love.
  PANDARUS. good troth, begins so.                      [Sings]

    Love, love, love, love, more!
           For, oh, love's bow
           Shoots buck doe;
           shaft confounds
           wounds,
    tickles sore.
    lovers cry, O ho, die!
       wound kill
    Doth turn O ho! ha! ha! he!
       dying love lives still.
    O ho! while, ha! ha! ha!  
    O ho! groans ha! ha! ha!-hey ho!

  HELEN. love, i' faith, tip nose.
  PARIS. eats doves, love; breeds hot blood,
    hot blood begets hot thoughts, hot thoughts beget hot
    deeds, hot deeds love.
  PANDARUS. generation love: hot blood, hot thoughts,
    hot deeds? Why, vipers. love generation of
    vipers? Sweet lord, a-field today?
  PARIS. Hector, Deiphobus, Helenus, Antenor, gallantry
    Troy. fain arm'd to-day, Nell not
    so. chance brother Troilus not?
  HELEN. hangs lip something. all, Lord Pandarus.
  PANDARUS. I, honey-sweet queen. long hear spend
    to-day. remember brother's excuse?
  PARIS. hair.
  PANDARUS. Farewell, sweet queen.
  HELEN. Commend niece.
  PANDARUS. will, sweet queen.                Exit. Sound retreat
  PARIS. field. Priam's hall  
    greet warriors. Sweet Helen, woo you
    unarm Hector. stubborn buckles,
    white enchanting fingers touch'd,
    obey edge steel
    force Greekish sinews; more
    island kings-disarm great Hector.
  HELEN. 'Twill make proud servant, Paris;
    Yea, receive duty
    palm beauty have,
    Yea, overshines ourself.
  PARIS. Sweet, thought love thee.                     Exeunt




ACT III. SCENE 2.
Troy. PANDARUS' orchard

Enter PANDARUS TROILUS' BOY, meeting

  PANDARUS. now! thy master? cousin Cressida's?
  BOY. No, sir; stays conduct thither.

                      Enter TROILUS

  PANDARUS. O, comes. now, now!
  TROILUS. Sirrah, walk off.                                 Exit Boy
  PANDARUS. cousin?
  TROILUS. No, Pandarus. stalk door
    strange soul Stygian banks
    Staying waftage. O, thou Charon,
    give swift transportance fields
    wallow lily beds
    Propos'd deserver! O gentle Pandar,
    Cupid's shoulder pluck painted wings,
    fly Cressid!
  PANDARUS. Walk i' th' orchard, bring straight.  
      Exit
  TROILUS. giddy; expectation whirls round.
    Th' imaginary relish sweet
    enchants sense; be
    wat'ry palate tastes indeed
    Love's thrice-repured nectar? Death, fear me;
    Swooning destruction; joy fine,
    subtle-potent, tun'd sharp sweetness,
    capacity ruder powers.
    fear much; fear besides
    lose distinction joys;
    doth battle, charge heaps
    enemy flying.

                     Re-enter PANDARUS

  PANDARUS. making ready, straight; be
    witty now. blush, fetches wind short, as
    fray'd sprite. fetch her. the
    prettiest villain; fetches breath short new-ta'en  
    sparrow.                                                     Exit
  TROILUS. passion doth embrace bosom.
    heart beats thicker feverous pulse,
    powers bestowing lose,
    vassalage unawares encount'ring
    eye majesty.

              Re-enter PANDARUS CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. Come, come, blush? Shame's baby.-Here she
    now; swear oaths sworn me.-
    What, again? watch'd ere made
    tame, you? ways, ways; draw
    backward, put i' th' fills.-Why speak to
    her?-Come, draw curtain picture.
    Alas day, loath offend daylight! 'twere
    dark, close sooner. So, so; rub on, kiss mistress
    now, kiss fee-farm! Build there, carpenter; air is
    sweet. Nay, fight hearts ere part you. The
    falcon tercel, ducks i' th' river. to,  
    to.
  TROILUS. bereft words, lady.
  PANDARUS. Words pay debts, give deeds; bereave
    o' th' deeds too, call activity question.
    What, billing again? 'In witness whereof parties
    interchangeably.' in, in; fire.
      Exit
  CRESSIDA. walk in, lord?
  TROILUS. O Cressid, wish'd thus!
  CRESSIDA. Wish'd, lord! gods grant-O lord!
  TROILUS. grant? makes pretty abruption?
    curious dreg espies sweet lady fountain our
    love?
  CRESSIDA. dregs water, fears eyes.
  TROILUS. Fears make devils cherubims; truly.
  CRESSIDA. Blind fear, reason leads, finds safer footing
    blind reason stumbling fear. fear worst oft
    cures worse.
  TROILUS. O, lady apprehend fear! Cupid's pageant
    presented monster.  
  CRESSIDA. monstrous neither?
  TROILUS. Nothing, undertakings vow weep seas,
    live fire, cat rocks, tame tigers; thinking harder our
    mistress devise imposition undergo any
    difficulty imposed. monstruosity love, lady, that
    infinite, execution confin'd; desire
    boundless, act slave limit.
  CRESSIDA. lovers swear performance are
    able, reserve ability perform; vowing
    perfection ten, discharging the
    tenth part one. voice lions act
    hares, monsters?
  TROILUS. such? we. Praise are
    tasted, prove; head bare till merit
    crown it. perfection reversion praise in
    present. desert birth; and, being
    born, addition humble. words fair faith:
    Troilus Cressid envy worst shall
    mock truth; truth speak truest not
    truer Troilus.  
  CRESSIDA. walk in, lord?

                    Re-enter PANDARUS

  PANDARUS. What, blushing still? talking yet?
  CRESSIDA. Well, uncle, folly commit, dedicate you.
  PANDARUS. that; lord boy you, you'll
    give me. true lord; flinch, chide it.
  TROILUS. hostages: uncle's word firm
    faith.
  PANDARUS. Nay, give word too: kindred, though
    long ere wooed, constant won;
    burs, you; stick are
    thrown.
  CRESSIDA. Boldness brings heart.
    Prince Troilus, lov'd night day
    weary months.
  TROILUS. Cressid hard win?
  CRESSIDA. Hard won; won, lord,
    glance ever-pardon me.  
    confess much, play tyrant.
    love now; till much
    master it. faith, lie;
    thoughts unbridled children, grown
    headstrong mother. See, fools!
    blabb'd? true us,
    unsecret ourselves?
    But, lov'd well, woo'd not;
    yet, good faith, wish'd man,
    women men's privilege
    speaking first. Sweet, bid hold tongue,
    rapture surely speak
    thing repent. See, see, silence,
    Cunning dumbness, weakness draws
    soul counsel. Stop mouth.
  TROILUS. shall, albeit sweet music issues thence.
  PANDARUS. Pretty, i' faith.
  CRESSIDA. lord, beseech you, pardon me;
    'Twas purpose beg kiss.
    asham'd. O heavens! done?  
    time leave, lord.
  TROILUS. leave, sweet Cressid!
  PANDARUS. Leave! leave till to-morrow morning-
  CRESSIDA. Pray you, content you.
  TROILUS. offends you, lady?
  CRESSIDA. Sir, mine company.
  TROILUS. shun yourself.
  CRESSIDA. try.
    kind resides you;
    unkind self, leave
    another's fool. gone.
    wit? speak.
  TROILUS. speak speak wisely.
  CRESSIDA. Perchance, lord, show craft love;
    fell roundly large confession
    angle thoughts; wise-
    love not; wise love
    Exceeds man's might; dwells gods above.
  TROILUS. O thought woman-
    As, can, presume you-  
    feed aye lamp flames love;
    constancy plight youth,
    Outliving beauty's outward, mind
    doth renew swifter blood decays!
    persuasion convince me
    integrity truth you
    affronted match weight
    winnowed purity love.
    uplifted! but, alas,
    true truth's simplicity,
    simpler infancy truth.
  CRESSIDA. war you.
  TROILUS. O virtuous fight,
    wars right!
    True swains love world come
    Approve truth Troilus, rhymes,
    Full protest, oath, big compare,
    similes, truth tir'd iteration-
    true steel, plantage moon,
    sun day, turtle mate,  
    iron adamant, earth th' centre-
    Yet, comparisons truth,
    truth's authentic author cited,
    'As true Troilus' crown verse
    sanctify numbers.
  CRESSIDA. Prophet be!
    false, swerve hair truth,
    time hath forgot itself,
    waterdrops worn stones Troy,
    blind oblivion swallow'd cities up,
    mighty states characterless grated
    dusty nothing-yet memory
    false false, false maids love,
    Upbraid falsehood th' 'As false
    air, water, wind, sandy earth,
    fox lamb, wolf heifer's calf,
    Pard hind, stepdame son'-
    Yea, say, stick heart falsehood,
    'As false Cressid.'
  PANDARUS. to, bargain made; seal it, seal it;  
    witness. hold hand; cousin's. you
    prove false another, pains to
    bring together, pitiful goers- call'd to
    world's end name-call Pandars; all
    constant men Troiluses, false women Cressids, all
    brokers Pandars. 'Amen.'
  TROILUS. Amen.
  CRESSIDA. Amen.
  PANDARUS. Amen. show chamber
    bed; bed, speak your
    pretty encounters, press death. Away!
    Cupid grant tongue-tied maidens here,
    Bed, chamber, pander, provide gear!                Exeunt




ACT III. SCENE 3.
The Greek camp

Flourish. Enter AGAMEMNON, ULYSSES, DIOMEDES, NESTOR, AJAX, MENELAUS,
and CALCHAS

  CALCHAS. Now, Princes, service done,
    Th' advantage time prompts aloud
    call recompense. mind
    That, sight bear things come,
    abandon'd Troy, left possession,
    Incurr'd traitor's name, expos'd myself
    possess'd conveniences
    doubtful fortunes, sequest'ring all
    time, acquaintance, custom, condition,
    Made tame familiar nature;
    here, service, become
    world, strange, unacquainted-
    beseech you, taste,
    give benefit
    regist'red promise,
    live behalf.  
  AGAMEMNON. wouldst thou us, Troyan? Make demand.
  CALCHAS. Troyan prisoner call'd Antenor,
    Yesterday took; Troy holds dear.
    Oft you-often therefore-
    Desir'd Cressid great exchange,
    Troy hath denied; Antenor,
    know, wrest affairs
    negotiations slack
    Wanting manage; almost
    Give prince blood, son Priam,
    change him. sent, great Princes,
    buy daughter; presence
    strike service done
    accepted pain.
  AGAMEMNON. Diomedes bear him,
    bring Cressid hither. Calchas have
    requests us. Good Diomed,
    Furnish fairly interchange;
    Withal, bring word Hector to-morrow
    answer'd challenge. Ajax ready.  
  DIOMEDES. undertake; 'tis burden
    proud bear.
                                          Exeunt DIOMEDES CALCHAS

           ACHILLES PATROCLUS stand tent

  ULYSSES. Achilles stands i' th' entrance tent.
    general pass strangely him,
    forgot; and, Princes all,
    Lay negligent loose regard him.
    last. 'Tis question me
    unplausive eyes bent, turn'd him?
    so, derision med'cinable
    strangeness pride,
    desire drink.
    good. Pride hath glass
    show pride; supple knees
    Feed arrogance proud man's fees.
  AGAMEMNON. execute purpose, put on
    form strangeness pass along.  
    lord; greet not,
    disdainfully, shake more
    look'd on. lead way.
  ACHILLES. general speak me?
    mind. fight 'gainst Troy.
  AGAMEMNON. Achilles? aught us?
  NESTOR. you, lord, aught general?
  ACHILLES. No.
  NESTOR. Nothing, lord.
  AGAMEMNON. better.
                                          Exeunt AGAMEMNON NESTOR
  ACHILLES. Good day, good day.
  MENELAUS. you? you?                              Exit
  ACHILLES. What, cuckold scorn me?
  AJAX. now, Patroclus?
  ACHILLES. Good morrow, Ajax.
  AJAX. Ha?
  ACHILLES. Good morrow.
  AJAX. Ay, good day too.                               Exit
  ACHILLES. fellows? Achilles?  
  PATROCLUS. pass strangely. us'd bend,
    send smiles Achilles,
    humbly us'd creep
    holy altars.
  ACHILLES. What, poor late?
    'Tis certain, greatness, fall'n fortune,
    fall men too. declin'd is,
    read eyes others
    feel fall; men, butterflies,
    Show mealy wings summer;
    man simply man
    Hath honour, honour honours
    him, place, riches, favour,
    Prizes accident, oft merit;
    fall, slippery standers,
    love lean'd slippery too,
    Doth pluck another, together
    Die fall. 'tis me:
    Fortune friends; enjoy
    ample point possess  
    Save men's looks; do, methinks, find out
    worth rich beholding
    given. Ulysses.
    interrupt reading.
    now, Ulysses!
  ULYSSES. Now, great Thetis' son!
  ACHILLES. reading?
  ULYSSES. strange fellow here
    Writes man-how dearly parted,
    having, in-
    make boast hath,
    feels owes, reflection;
    virtues shining others
    Heat them, retort heat again
    giver.
  ACHILLES. strange, Ulysses.
    beauty borne face
    bearer not, commends itself
    others' eyes; doth eye itself-
    pure spirit sense-behold itself,  
    itself; eye eye opposed
    Salutes other's form;
    speculation turns itself
    Till hath travell'd, mirror'd there
    itself. strange all.
  ULYSSES. strain position-
    familiar-but author's drift;
    Who, circumstance, expressly proves
    man lord anything,
    consisting,
    Till communicate parts others;
    doth aught
    Till behold formed th' applause
    th' extended; who, arch, reverb'rate
    voice again; or, gate steel
    Fronting sun, receives renders back
    figure heat. rapt this;
    apprehended immediately
    Th' unknown Ajax. Heavens, man there!
    horse what!  
    Nature, things are
    abject regard dear use!
    things dear esteem
    poor worth! to-morrow-
    act chance doth throw him-
    Ajax renown'd. O heavens, men do,
    men leave do!
    men creep skittish Fortune's-hall,
    Whiles play idiots eyes!
    man eats another's pride,
    pride fasting wantonness!
    Grecian lords!-why, already
    clap lubber Ajax shoulder,
    foot brave Hector's breast,
    great Troy shrinking.
  ACHILLES. it; pass'd me
    misers beggars-neither gave me
    Good word look. What, deeds forgot?
  ULYSSES. Time hath, lord, wallet back,
    puts alms oblivion,  
    great-siz'd monster ingratitudes.
    scraps good deeds past, devour'd
    fast made, forgot soon
    done. Perseverance, dear lord,
    honour bright. hang
    fashion, rusty mail
    monumental mock'ry. instant way;
    honour travels strait narrow -
    abreast. path,
    emulation hath thousand sons
    pursue; give way,
    hedge direct forthright,
    ent'red tide rush by
    leave hindmost;
    Or, gallant horse fall'n rank,
    Lie pavement abject rear,
    O'er-run trampled on. present,
    past, o'ertop yours;
    Time fashionable host,
    slightly shakes parting guest th' hand;  
    arms out-stretch'd, fly,
    Grasps corner. smiles,
    farewell sighing. O, virtue seek
    Remuneration thing was;
    beauty, wit,
    High birth, vigour bone, desert service,
    Love, friendship, charity, subjects all
    envious calumniating Time.
    touch nature makes world kin-
    consent praise new-born gawds,
    made moulded things past,
    give dust gilt
    laud gilt o'er-dusted.
    present eye praises present object.
    marvel not, thou great complete man,
    Greeks begin worship Ajax,
    things motion sooner catch eye
    stirs not. cry thee,
    might, again,
    thou wouldst entomb thyself alive  
    case thy reputation thy tent,
    glorious deeds fields late
    Made emulous missions 'mongst gods themselves,
    drave great Mars faction.
  ACHILLES. privacy
    strong reasons.
  ULYSSES. 'gainst privacy
    reasons potent heroical.
    'Tis known, Achilles, love
    Priam's daughters.
  ACHILLES. Ha! known!
  ULYSSES. wonder?
    providence watchful state
    grain Plutus' gold;
    Finds bottom th' uncomprehensive deeps;
    place thought, almost, gods,
    thoughts unveil dumb cradles.
    mystery-with relation
    Durst meddle-in soul state,
    hath operation divine  
    breath pen give expressure to.
    commerce Troy
    perfectly yours, lord;
    fit Achilles much
    throw Hector Polyxena.
    grieve young Pyrrhus home,
    fame island sound trump,
    Greekish girls tripping sing
    'Great Hector's sister Achilles win;
    great Ajax bravely beat him.'
    Farewell, lord. lover speak.
    fool slides o'er ice break.          Exit
  PATROCLUS. effect, Achilles, mov'd you.
    woman impudent mannish grown
    loath'd effeminate man
    time action. stand condemn'd this;
    stomach war
    great love restrains thus.
    Sweet, rouse yourself; weak wanton Cupid
    neck unloose amorous fold,  
    And, dew-drop lion's mane,
    shook airy air.
  ACHILLES. Ajax fight Hector?
  PATROCLUS. Ay, receive honour him.
  ACHILLES. reputation stake;
    fame shrewdly gor'd.
  PATROCLUS. O, then, beware:
    wounds heal ill men give themselves;
    Omission necessary
    Seals commission blank danger;
    danger, ague, subtly taints
    sit idly sun.
  ACHILLES. call Thersites hither, sweet Patroclus.
    send fool Ajax, desire him
    T' invite Troyan lords, combat,
    unarm'd. woman's longing,
    appetite sick withal,
    great Hector weeds peace;
    talk him, behold visage,
    full view.  

                     Enter THERSITES

    labour sav'd!
  THERSITES. wonder!
  ACHILLES. What?
  THERSITES. Ajax field himself.
  ACHILLES. so?
  THERSITES. fight singly to-morrow Hector, so
    prophetically proud heroical cudgelling raves in
    nothing.
  ACHILLES. be?
  THERSITES. Why, 'a stalks peacock-a stride a
    stand; ruminaies hostess hath arithmetic her
    brain set reckoning, bites lip politic
    regard, 'There wit head, an
    'twould out'; is; lies coldly as
    fire flint, show knocking. man's
    undone ever; Hector break neck i' th' combat,
    break't vainglory. me. 'Good  
    morrow, Ajax'; replies 'Thanks, Agamemnon.' you
    man takes general? grown land
    fish, languageless, monster. plague opinion! man may
    wear sides, leather jerkin.
  ACHILLES. Thou ambassador him, Thersites.
  THERSITES. Who, I? Why, answer nobody; professes not
    answering. Speaking beggars: wears tongue in's
    arms. put presence. Patroclus make demands
    me, pageant Ajax.
  ACHILLES. him, Patroclus. humbly desire valiant
    Ajax invite valorous Hector unarm'd my
    tent; procure safe conduct person the
    magnanimous illustrious six-or-seven-times-honour'd
    Captain General Grecian army, cetera, Agamemnon. Do
    this.
  PATROCLUS. Jove bless great Ajax!
  THERSITES. Hum!
  PATROCLUS. worthy Achilles-
  THERSITES. Ha!
  PATROCLUS. humbly desires invite Hector  
    tent-
  THERSITES. Hum!
  PATROCLUS. procure safe conduct Agamemnon.
  THERSITES. Agamemnon!
  PATROCLUS. Ay, lord.
  THERSITES. Ha!
  PATROCLUS. to't?
  THERSITES. God buy you, heart.
  PATROCLUS. answer, sir.
  THERSITES. to-morrow fair day, eleven clock it
    other. Howsoever, pay ere he
    me.
  PATROCLUS. answer, sir.
  THERSITES. Fare ye well, heart.
  ACHILLES. Why, tune, he?
  THERSITES. No, tune thus. music him
    Hector knock'd brains not; but, sure,
    none; fiddler Apollo sinews make catlings
    on.
  ACHILLES. Come, thou shalt bear letter straight.  
  THERSITES. carry horse; more
    capable creature.
  ACHILLES. mind troubled, fountain stirr'd;
    bottom it.
                                        Exeunt ACHILLES PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. fountain mind clear again, I
    water ass it. tick sheep than
    valiant ignorance.                                    Exit

ACT IV. SCENE 1.
Troy. street

Enter, side, AENEAS, servant torch; another,
PARIS, DEIPHOBUS, ANTENOR, DIOMEDES Grecian, others, torches

  PARIS. See, ho! there?
  DEIPHOBUS. Lord Aeneas.
  AENEAS. Prince person?
    good occasion lie long
    you, Prince Paris, heavenly business
    rob bed-mate company.
  DIOMEDES. mind too. Good morrow, Lord Aeneas.
  PARIS. valiant Greek, Aeneas -take hand:
    Witness process speech, wherein
    told Diomed, week days,
    haunt field.
  AENEAS. Health you, valiant sir,
    question gentle truce;
    meet arm'd, black defiance
    heart courage execute.  
  DIOMEDES. Diomed embraces.
    bloods calm; long health!
    contention occasion meet,
    Jove, play hunter thy life
    force, pursuit, policy.
  AENEAS. thou shalt hunt lion, fly
    face backward. humane gentleness,
    Troy! now, Anchises' life,
    indeed! Venus' hand swear
    man alive love sort
    thing means kill, excellently.
  DIOMEDES. sympathise. Jove Aeneas live,
    sword fate glory,
    thousand complete courses sun!
    mine emulous honour die
    joint wound, to-morrow!
  AENEAS. well.
  DIOMEDES.We do; long worse.
  PARIS. despiteful'st gentle greeting
    noblest hateful love, e'er heard of.  
    business, lord, early?
  AENEAS. King; why, not.
  PARIS. purpose meets you: 'twas bring Greek
    Calchas' house, render him,
    enfreed Antenor, fair Cressid.
    company; or, please,
    Haste us. constantly believe-
    call thought knowledge-
    brother Troilus lodges to-night.
    Rouse give note approach,
    quality wherefore; fear
    unwelcome.
  AENEAS. assure you:
    Troilus Troy borne Greece
    Cressid borne Troy.
  PARIS. help;
    bitter disposition time
    so. On, lord; follow you.
  AENEAS. Good morrow, all.                         Exit servant
  PARIS. me, noble Diomed-faith, true,  
    soul sound good-fellowship-
    thoughts deserves fair Helen best,
    Menelaus?
  DIOMEDES. alike:
    merits doth seek her,
    making scruple soilure,
    hell pain world charge;
    defend her,
    palating taste dishonour,
    costly loss wealth friends.
    puling cuckold drink up
    lees dregs flat tamed piece;
    You, lecher, whorish loins
    pleas'd breed inheritors.
    merits pois'd, weighs more;
    he, heavier whore.
  PARIS. bitter country-woman.
  DIOMEDES. bitter country. Hear me, Paris:
    false drop bawdy veins
    Grecian's life hath sunk; scruple  
    contaminated carrion weight
    Troyan hath slain; speak,
    hath good words breath
    Greeks Troyans suff'red death.
  PARIS. Fair Diomed, chapmen do,
    Dispraise thing desire buy;
    silence hold virtue well:
    commend intend sell.
    lies way.                                         Exeunt




ACT IV. SCENE 2.
Troy. court PANDARUS' house

Enter TROILUS CRESSIDA

  TROILUS. Dear, trouble yourself; morn cold.
  CRESSIDA. Then, sweet lord, call mine uncle down;
    unbolt gates.
  TROILUS. Trouble not;
    bed, bed! Sleep kill pretty eyes,
    give soft attachment thy senses
    infants' empty thought!
  CRESSIDA. Good morrow, then.
  TROILUS. prithee now, bed.
  CRESSIDA. aweary me?
  TROILUS. O Cressida! busy day,
    Wak'd lark, hath rous'd ribald crows,
    dreaming night hide joys longer,
    thee.
  CRESSIDA. Night hath brief.
  TROILUS. Beshrew witch! venomous wights stays
    tediously hell, flies grasps love  
    wings momentary-swift thought.
    catch cold, curse me.
  CRESSIDA. Prithee tarry.
    men tarry.
    O foolish Cressid! held off,
    tarried. Hark! up.
  PANDARUS. [Within] doors open here?
  TROILUS. uncle.

                     Enter PANDARUS

  CRESSIDA. pestilence him! mocking.
    life!
  PANDARUS. now, now! maidenheads?
    Here, maid! cousin Cressid?
  CRESSIDA. hang yourself, naughty mocking uncle.
    bring do, flout too.
  PANDARUS. what? what? what.
    brought do?
  CRESSIDA. Come, come, beshrew heart! ne'er good,  
    suffer others.
  PANDARUS. Ha, ha! Alas, poor wretch! poor capocchia! hast not
    slept to-night? not, naughty man, sleep? A
    bugbear him!
  CRESSIDA. you? knock'd i' th' head!
                                                         [One knocks]
    door? Good uncle, see.
    lord, chamber.
    smile mock me, meant naughtily.
  TROILUS. Ha! ha!
  CRESSIDA. Come, deceiv'd, thing.
   [Knock]
    earnestly knock! Pray in:
    half Troy here.
                                          Exeunt TROILUS CRESSIDA
  PANDARUS. there? matter? beat the
    door? now? matter?

                          Enter AENEAS  
  AENEAS. Good morrow, lord, good morrow.
  PANDARUS. there? lord Aeneas? troth,
    knew not. news early?
  AENEAS. Prince Troilus here?
  PANDARUS. Here! here?
  AENEAS. Come, here, lord; deny him.
    doth import speak me.
  PANDARUS. here, you? know, be
    sworn. part, late. here?
  AENEAS. Who!-nay, then. Come, come, wrong ere are
    ware; true false him. you
    him, fetch hither; go.

                       Re-enter TROILUS

  TROILUS. now! matter?
  AENEAS. lord, scarce leisure salute you,
    matter rash. hand
    Paris brother, Deiphobus,
    Grecian Diomed, Antenor  
    Deliver'd us; forthwith,
    Ere sacrifice, hour,
    give Diomedes' hand
    Lady Cressida.
  TROILUS. concluded?
  AENEAS. Priam, general state Troy.
    hand ready effect it.
  TROILUS. achievements mock me!
    meet them; and, lord Aeneas,
    met chance; find here.
  AENEAS. Good, good, lord, secrets neighbour Pandar
    gift taciturnity.
                                            Exeunt TROILUS AENEAS
  PANDARUS. Is't possible? sooner lost? devil take
    Antenor! young prince mad. plague Antenor! I
    broke's neck.

                     Re-enter CRESSIDA

  CRESSIDA. now! matter? here?  
  PANDARUS. Ah, ah!
  CRESSIDA. sigh profoundly? lord? Gone? Tell
    me, sweet uncle, matter?
  PANDARUS. deep earth above!
  CRESSIDA. O gods! matter?
  PANDARUS. Pray thee, thee in. thou hadst ne'er born!
    knew thou wouldst death! O, poor gentleman! plague
    Antenor!
  CRESSIDA. Good uncle, beseech you, knees beseech you,
    matter?
  PANDARUS. Thou gone, wench, thou gone; thou art
    chang'd Antenor; thou thy father, from
    Troilus. 'Twill death; 'twill bane; bear
    it.
  CRESSIDA. O immortal gods! go.
  PANDARUS. Thou must.
  CRESSIDA. not, uncle. forgot father;
    touch consanguinity,
    kin, love, blood, soul me
    sweet Troilus. O gods divine,  
    Make Cressid's crown falsehood,
    leave Troilus! Time, force, death,
    body extremes can,
    strong base building love
    centre earth,
    Drawing things it. weep-
  PANDARUS. Do, do.
  CRESSIDA. Tear bright hair, scratch praised cheeks,
    Crack clear voice sobs break heart,
    sounding 'Troilus.' Troy.
    Exeunt




ACT IV. SCENE 3.
Troy. street PANDARUS' house

Enter PARIS, TROILUS, AENEAS, DEIPHOBUS, ANTENOR, DIOMEDES

  PARIS. great morning; hour prefix'd
    delivery valiant Greek
    fast upon. Good brother Troilus,
    lady do
    haste purpose.
  TROILUS. Walk house.
    bring Grecian presently;
    hand deliver her,
    altar, thy brother Troilus
    priest, off'ring heart.                Exit
  PARIS. 'tis love,
    would, pity, help!
    walk in, lords.                              Exeunt




ACT IV. SCENE 4.
Troy. PANDARUS' house

Enter PANDARUS CRESSIDA

  PANDARUS. moderate, moderate.
  CRESSIDA. moderation?
    grief fine, full, perfect, taste,
    violenteth sense strong
    causeth it. moderate it?
    temporize affections
    brew weak colder palate,
    allayment give grief.
    love admits qualifying dross;
    grief, precious loss.

                    Enter TROILUS

  PANDARUS. Here, here, comes. Ah, sweet ducks!
  CRESSIDA. O Troilus! Troilus! [Embracing him]
  PANDARUS. pair spectacles here! embrace too. 'O
    heart,' goodly is,  
          O heart, heavy heart,
       sigh'st thou breaking?
    answers again
       thou canst ease thy smart
       friendship speaking.
    truer rhyme. cast nothing, we
    live verse. it, it. How
    now, lambs!
  TROILUS. Cressid, love thee strain'd purity
    bless'd gods, angry fancy,
    bright zeal devotion which
    Cold lips blow deities, thee me.
  CRESSIDA. gods envy?
  PANDARUS. Ay, ay, ay; 'tis plain case.
  CRESSIDA. true Troy?
  TROILUS. hateful truth.
  CRESSIDA. What, Troilus too?
  TROILUS. Troy Troilus.
  CRESSIDA. Is't possible?
  TROILUS. suddenly; injury chance  
    Puts back leave-taking, justles roughly by
    time pause, rudely beguiles lips
    rejoindure, forcibly prevents
    lock'd embrasures, strangles dear vows
    birth labouring breath.
    two, thousand sighs
    buy other, poorly sell ourselves
    rude brevity discharge one.
    Injurious time robber's haste
    Crams rich thievery up, how.
    farewells stars heaven,
    distinct breath consign'd kisses them,
    fumbles loose adieu,
    scants single famish'd kiss,
    Distasted salt broken tears.
  AENEAS. [Within] lord, lady ready?
  TROILUS. Hark! call'd. Genius so
    Cries 'Come' instantly die.
    Bid patience; anon.
  PANDARUS. tears? Rain, lay wind, heart  
    blown th' root?                                Exit
  CRESSIDA. Grecians?
  TROILUS. remedy.
  CRESSIDA. woeful Cressid 'mongst merry Greeks!
    again?
  TROILUS. Hear me, love. thou true heart-
  CRESSIDA. true! now! wicked deem this?
  TROILUS. Nay, expostulation kindly,
    parting us.
    speak 'Be thou true' fearing thee,
    throw glove Death himself
    maculation thy heart;
    'Be thou true' fashion in
    sequent protestation: thou true,
    thee.
  CRESSIDA. O, expos'd, lord, dangers
    infinite imminent! true.
  TROILUS. grow friend danger. Wear sleeve.
  CRESSIDA. glove. you?
  TROILUS. corrupt Grecian sentinels  
    give thee nightly visitation.
    true.
  CRESSIDA. O heavens! 'Be true' again!
  TROILUS. Hear speak it, love.
    Grecian youths full quality;
    loving, compos'd gifts nature,
    flowing o'er arts exercise.
    novelties move, parts person,
    Alas, kind godly jealousy,
    beseech call virtuous sin,
    Makes afeard.
  CRESSIDA. O heavens! love not.
  TROILUS. Die villain, then!
    call faith question
    merit. sing,
    heel high lavolt, sweeten talk,
    play subtle games-fair virtues all,
    Grecians prompt pregnant;
    grace these
    lurks dumb-discoursive devil  
    tempts cunningly. tempted.
  CRESSIDA. will?
  TROILUS. No.
    not;
    devils ourselves,
    tempt frailty powers,
    Presuming changeful potency.
  AENEAS. [Within] Nay, good lord!
  TROILUS. Come, kiss; part.
  PARIS. [Within] Brother Troilus!
  TROILUS. Good brother, hither;
    bring Aeneas Grecian you.
  CRESSIDA. lord, true?
  TROILUS. Who, I? Alas, vice, fault!
    Whiles fish craft great opinion,
    great truth catch mere simplicity;
    Whilst cunning gild copper crowns,
    truth plainness wear mine bare.

      Enter AENEAS, PARIS, ANTENOR, DEIPHOBUS, DIOMEDES  

    Fear truth: moral wit
    'plain true'; reach it.
    Welcome, Sir Diomed! lady
    Antenor deliver you;
    port, lord, give thy hand,
    possess thee is.
    Entreat fair; and, soul, fair Greek,
    e'er thou stand mercy sword,
    Cressid, thy life safe
    Priam Ilion.
  DIOMEDES. Fair Lady Cressid,
    you, save prince expects.
    lustre eye, heaven cheek,
    Pleads fair usage; Diomed
    mistress, command wholly.
  TROILUS. Grecian, thou dost courteously
    shame zeal petition the
    praising her. thee, lord Greece,
    high-soaring o'er thy praises  
    thou unworthy call'd servant.
    charge thee well, charge;
    For, dreadful Pluto, thou dost not,
    great bulk Achilles thy guard,
    cut thy throat.
  DIOMEDES. O, mov'd, Prince Troilus.
    privileg'd place message
    speaker free: hence
    answer lust. you, lord,
    charge: worth
    priz'd. 'Be't so,'
    speak spirit honour, 'No.'
  TROILUS. Come, port. thee, Diomed,
    brave oft make thee hide thy head.
    Lady, give hand; and, walk,
    bend needful talk.
                               Exeunt TROILUS, CRESSIDA, DIOMEDES
                                                      [Sound trumpet]
  PARIS. Hark! Hector's trumpet.
  AENEAS. spent morning!  
    Prince tardy remiss,
    swore ride field.
  PARIS. 'Tis Troilus' fault. Come, field him.
  DEIPHOBUS. make ready straight.
  AENEAS. Yea, bridegroom's fresh alacrity
    address tend Hector's heels.
    glory Troy doth day lie
    fair worth single chivalry.                     Exeunt




ACT IV. SCENE 5.
The Grecian camp. Lists set out

Enter AJAX, armed; AGAMEMNON, ACHILLES, PATROCLUS, MENELAUS, ULYSSES,
NESTOR, others

  AGAMEMNON. art thou appointment fresh fair,
    Anticipating time starting courage.
    Give thy trumpet loud note Troy,
    Thou dreadful Ajax, appalled air
    pierce head great combatant,
    hale hither.
  AJAX. Thou, trumpet, purse.
    crack thy lungs split thy brazen pipe;
    Blow, villain, till thy sphered bias cheek
    Out-swell colic puff Aquilon'd.
    Come, stretch thy chest, thy eyes spout blood:
    Thou blowest Hector.                         [Trumpet sounds]
  ULYSSES. trumpet answers.
  ACHILLES. 'Tis early days.

                Enter DIOMEDES, CRESSIDA  

  AGAMEMNON. yond Diomed, Calchas' daughter?
  ULYSSES. 'Tis he, ken manner gait:
    rises toe. spirit his
    aspiration lifts earth.
  AGAMEMNON. lady Cressid?
  DIOMEDES. she.
  AGAMEMNON. dearly Greeks, sweet lady.
  NESTOR. general doth salute kiss.
  ULYSSES. kindness particular;
    'Twere kiss'd general.
  NESTOR. courtly counsel: begin.
    Nestor.
  ACHILLES. winter lips, fair lady.
    Achilles bids welcome.
  MENELAUS. good argument kissing once.
  PATROCLUS. argument kissing now;
    popp'd Paris hardiment,
    parted argument.
  ULYSSES. O deadly gall, theme scorns!  
    lose heads gild horns.
  PATROCLUS. Menelaus' kiss; this, mine-
                                                   [Kisses again]
    Patroclus kisses you.
  MENELAUS. O, trim!
  PATROCLUS. Paris kiss evermore him.
  MENELAUS. kiss, sir. Lady, leave.
  CRESSIDA. kissing, render receive?
  PATROCLUS. give.
  CRESSIDA. make match live,
    kiss give;
    kiss.
  MENELAUS. give boot; give one.
  CRESSIDA. odd man; give give none.
  MENELAUS. odd man, lady? man odd.
  CRESSIDA. No, Paris not; 'tis true
    odd, you.
  MENELAUS. fillip o' th' head.
  CRESSIDA. No, sworn.
  ULYSSES. match, nail horn.  
    I, sweet lady, beg kiss you?
  CRESSIDA. may.
  ULYSSES. desire it.
  CRESSIDA. Why, beg then.
  ULYSSES. then, Venus' sake give kiss
    Helen maid again, his.
  CRESSIDA. debtor; claim 'tis due.
  ULYSSES. Never's day, kiss you.
  DIOMEDES. Lady, word. bring father.
                                                   Exit CRESSIDA
  NESTOR. woman quick sense.
  ULYSSES. Fie, fie her!
    language eye, cheek, lip,
    Nay, foot speaks; wanton spirits out
    joint motive body.
    O encounters glib tongue
    give coasting ere comes,
    wide unclasp tables thoughts
    ticklish reader! Set down
    sluttish spoils opportunity,  
    daughters game.                       [Trumpet within]
  ALL. Troyans' trumpet.

        Enter HECTOR, armed; AENEAS, TROILUS, PARIS, HELENUS,
                 Trojans, attendants

  AGAMEMNON. Yonder troop.
  AENEAS. Hail, state Greece! done
    victory commands? purpose
    victor known? knights
    edge extremity
    Pursue other, divided
    voice order field?
    Hector bade ask.
  AGAMEMNON. Hector it?
  AENEAS. cares not; obey conditions.
  ACHILLES. 'Tis Hector; securely done,
    proudly, great deal misprizing
    knight oppos'd.
  AENEAS. Achilles, sir,  
    name?
  ACHILLES. Achilles, nothing.
  AENEAS. Achilles. whate'er, this:
    extremity great little
    Valour pride excel Hector;
    infinite all,
    blank nothing. Weigh well,
    pride courtesy.
    Ajax half made Hector's blood;
    love whereof half Hector stays home;
    Half heart, half hand, half Hector seek
    blended knight, half Troyan half Greek.
  ACHILLES. maiden battle then? O, perceive you!

                   Re-enter DIOMEDES

  AGAMEMNON. Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,
    Stand Ajax. Lord ]Eneas
    Consent order fight,
    it; uttermost,  
    breath. combatants kin
    Half stints strife strokes begin.
                                    [AJAX HECTOR enter lists]
  ULYSSES. oppos'd already.
  AGAMEMNON. Troyan heavy?
  ULYSSES. youngest son Priam, true knight;
    mature, matchless; firm word;
    Speaking deeds deedless tongue;
    provok'd, provok'd calm'd;
    heart hand open free;
    gives, thinks shows,
    till judgment guide bounty,
    dignifies impair thought breath;
    Manly Hector, dangerous;
    Hector blaze wrath subscribes
    tender objects, heat action
    vindicative jealous love.
    call Troilus, erect
    hope fairly built Hector.
    Aeneas, youth  
    inches, and, private soul,
    great Ilion translate me.
                                      [Alarum. HECTOR AJAX fight]
  AGAMEMNON. action.
  NESTOR. Now, Ajax, hold thine own!
  TROILUS. Hector, thou sleep'st;
    Awake thee.
  AGAMEMNON. blows dispos'd. There, Ajax!
                                                     [Trumpets cease]
  DIOMEDES. more.
  AENEAS. Princes, enough, you.
  AJAX. warm yet; fight again.
  DIOMEDES. Hector pleases.
  HECTOR. Why, more.
    Thou art, great lord, father's sister's son,
    cousin-german great Priam's seed;
    obligation blood forbids
    gory emulation 'twixt twain:
    thy commixtion Greek Troyan so
    thou could'st 'This hand Grecian all,  
    Troyan; sinews leg
    Greek, Troy; mother's blood
    Runs dexter cheek, sinister
    Bounds father's'; Jove multipotent,
    Thou shouldst bear Greekish member
    sword impressure made
    rank feud; gods gainsay
    drop thou borrow'dst thy mother,
    sacred aunt, mortal sword
    drained! embrace thee, Ajax.
    thunders, thou hast lusty arms;
    Hector fall thus.
    Cousin, honour thee!
  AJAX. thee, Hector.
    Thou art gentle free man.
    kill thee, cousin, bear hence
    great addition earned thy death.
  HECTOR. Neoptolemus mirable,
    bright crest Fame loud'st Oyes
    Cries 'This he' promise  
    thought added honour torn Hector.
  AENEAS. expectance sides
    do.
  HECTOR. answer it:
    issue embracement. Ajax, farewell.
  AJAX. entreaties find success,
    seld chance, desire
    famous cousin Grecian tents.
  DIOMEDES. 'Tis Agamemnon's wish; great Achilles
    Doth long unarm'd valiant Hector.
  HECTOR. Aeneas, call brother Troilus me,
    signify loving interview
    expecters Troyan part;
    Desire home. Give thy hand, cousin;
    eat thee, knights.

        AGAMEMNON rest Greeks forward

  AJAX. Great Agamemnon meet here.
  HECTOR. worthiest name;  
    Achilles, searching eyes
    find large portly size.
  AGAMEMNON.Worthy arms! one
    rid enemy.
    welcome. Understand clear,
    past strew'd husks
    formless ruin oblivion;
    extant moment, faith troth,
    Strain'd purely hollow bias-drawing,
    Bids thee divine integrity,
    heart heart, great Hector, welcome.
  HECTOR. thee, imperious Agamemnon.
  AGAMEMNON. [To Troilus] well-fam'd lord Troy, you.
  MENELAUS. confirm princely brother's greeting.
    brace warlike brothers, hither.
  HECTOR. answer?
  AENEAS. noble Menelaus.
  HECTOR. O you, lord? Mars gauntlet, thanks!
    Mock affect untraded oath;
    quondam wife swears Venus' glove.  
    well, bade commend you.
  MENELAUS. now, sir; deadly theme.
  HECTOR. O, pardon; offend.
  NESTOR. have, thou gallant Troyan, thee oft,
    Labouring destiny, make cruel way
    ranks Greekish youth; thee,
    hot Perseus, spur thy Phrygian steed,
    Despising forfeits subduements,
    thou hast hung thy advanced sword i' th' air,
    letting decline declined;
    standers-by
    'Lo, Jupiter yonder, dealing life!'
    thee pause thy breath,
    ring Greeks hemm'd thee in,
    Olympian wrestling. seen;
    thy countenance, lock'd steel,
    till now. knew thy grandsire,
    fought him. soldier good,
    But, great Mars, captain all,
    thee. O, man embrace thee;  
    And, worthy warrior, tents.
  AENEAS. 'Tis Nestor.
  HECTOR. embrace thee, good chronicle,
    hast long walk'd hand hand time.
    reverend Nestor, glad clasp thee.
  NESTOR. arms match thee contention
    contend thee courtesy.
  HECTOR. could.
  NESTOR. Ha!
    white beard, fight thee to-morrow.
    Well, welcome, welcome! time.
  ULYSSES. yonder city stands,
    base pillar us.
  HECTOR. favour, Lord Ulysses, well.
    Ah, sir, Greek Troyan dead,
    Diomed
    Ilion Greekish embassy.
  ULYSSES. Sir, foretold ensue.
    prophecy half journey yet;
    yonder walls, pertly front town,  
    Yond towers, wanton tops buss clouds,
    kiss feet.
  HECTOR. you.
    stand yet; modestly think
    fall Phrygian stone cost
    drop Grecian blood. end crowns all;
    common arbitrator, Time,
    day end it.
  ULYSSES. leave it.
    gentle valiant Hector, welcome.
    General, beseech next
    feast tent.
  ACHILLES. forestall thee, Lord Ulysses, thou!
    Now, Hector, fed mine eyes thee;
    exact view perus'd thee, Hector,
    quoted joint joint.
  HECTOR. Achilles?
  ACHILLES. Achilles.
  HECTOR. Stand fair, pray thee; thee.
  ACHILLES. Behold thy fill.  
  HECTOR. Nay, already.
  ACHILLES. Thou art brief. time,
    buy thee, view thee limb limb.
  HECTOR. O, book sport thou'lt read o'er;
    thou understand'st.
    dost thou oppress thine eye?
  ACHILLES. me, heavens, part body
    destroy him? there, there, there?
    give local wound name,
    make distinct breach whereout
    Hector's great spirit flew. Answer me, heavens.
  HECTOR. discredit blest gods, proud man,
    answer question. Stand again.
    Think'st thou catch life pleasantly
    prenominate nice conjecture
    thou wilt hit dead?
  ACHILLES. thee yea.
  HECTOR. Wert thou oracle so,
    thee. Henceforth guard thee well;
    kill thee there, there, there;  
    But, forge stithied Mars helm,
    kill thee everywhere, yea, o'er o'er.
    wisest Grecians, pardon brag.
    insolence draws folly lips;
    endeavour deeds match words,
    never-
  AJAX. chafe thee, cousin;
    you, Achilles, threats alone
    Till accident purpose bring to't.
    day Hector,
    stomach. general state, fear,
    scarce entreat odd him.
  HECTOR. pray field;
    pelting wars refus'd
    Grecians' cause.
  ACHILLES. Dost thou entreat me, Hector?
    To-morrow meet thee, fell death;
    To-night friends.
  HECTOR. Thy hand match.
  AGAMEMNON. First, peers Greece, tent;  
    full convive we; afterwards,
    Hector's leisure bounties shall
    Concur together, severally entreat him.
    Beat loud tambourines, trumpets blow,
    great soldier know.
                                   Exeunt TROILUS ULYSSES
  TROILUS. Lord Ulysses, me, beseech you,
    place field doth Calchas keep?
  ULYSSES. Menelaus' tent, princely Troilus.
    Diomed doth feast to-night,
    heaven earth,
    gaze bent amorous view
    fair Cressid.
  TROILUS. I, sweet lord, bound much,
    part Agamemnon's tent,
    bring thither?
  ULYSSES. command me, sir.
    gentle honour was
    Cressida Troy? lover there
    wails absence?  
  TROILUS. O, sir, boasting show scars
    mock due. walk on, lord?
    belov'd, lov'd; is, doth;
    sweet love food fortune's tooth.          Exeunt

ACT V. SCENE 1.
The Grecian camp. tent ACHILLES

Enter ACHILLES PATROCLUS

  ACHILLES. heat blood Greekish wine to-night,
    scimitar cool to-morrow.
    Patroclus, feast height.
  PATROCLUS. Thersites.

                   Enter THERSITES

  ACHILLES. now, thou core envy!
    Thou crusty batch nature, news?
  THERSITES. Why, thou picture thou seemest, idol of
    idiot worshippers, letter thee.
  ACHILLES. whence, fragment?
  THERSITES. Why, thou full dish fool, Troy.
  PATROCLUS. tent now?
  THERSITES. surgeon's box patient's wound.
  PATROCLUS. said, Adversity! tricks?
  THERSITES. Prithee, silent, boy; profit thy talk; thou  
    art Achilles' male varlet.
  PATROCLUS. Male varlet, rogue! that?
  THERSITES. Why, masculine whore. Now, rotten diseases of
    south, guts-griping ruptures, catarrhs, loads o' gravel
    back, lethargies, cold palsies, raw eyes, dirt-rotten
    livers, wheezing lungs, bladders full imposthume, sciaticas,
    limekilns i' th' palm, incurable bone-ache, rivelled fee-
    simple tetter, preposterous
    discoveries!
  PATROCLUS. Why, thou damnable box envy, thou, meanest thou
    curse thus?
  THERSITES. curse thee?
  PATROCLUS. Why, no, ruinous butt; whoreson
    indistinguishable cur, no.
  THERSITES. No! art thou, then, exasperate, thou idle immaterial
    skein sleid silk, thou green sarcenet flap sore eye,
    thou tassel prodigal's purse, thou? Ah, poor world is
    pest'red water-flies-diminutives nature!
  PATROCLUS. Out, gall!
  THERSITES. Finch egg!  
  ACHILLES. sweet Patroclus, thwarted quite
    great purpose to-morrow's battle.
    letter Queen Hecuba,
    token daughter, fair love,
    taxing gaging keep
    oath sworn. break it.
    Fall Greeks; fail fame; honour stay;
    major vow lies here, obey.
    Come, come, Thersites, trim tent;
    night banqueting spent.
    Away, Patroclus!                              Exit PATROCLUS
  THERSITES. blood brain may
    run mad; but, brain blood do,
    curer madmen. Agamemnon, honest fellow
    enough, loves quails, brain
    ear-wax; goodly transformation Jupiter there, his
    brother, bull, primitive statue oblique memorial of
    cuckolds, thrifty shoeing-horn chain, hanging his
    brother's leg-to form is, wit larded with
    malice, malice forced wit, turn to? ass,  
    nothing: ass ox. ox, nothing: both
    ox ass. dog, mule, cat, fitchew, toad, a
    lizard, owl, put-tock, herring roe, would
    care; Menelaus, conspire destiny.
    be, Thersites; care
    louse lazar, Menelaus. Hey-day!
    sprites fires!

         Enter HECTOR, TROILUS, AJAX, AGAMEMNON, ULYSSES,
            NESTOR, MENELAUS, DIOMEDES, lights

  AGAMEMNON. wrong, wrong.
  AJAX. No, yonder 'tis;
    There, lights.
  HECTOR. trouble you.
  AJAX. No, whit.

                    Re-enter ACHILLES

  ULYSSES. guide you.  
  ACHILLES. Welcome, brave Hector; welcome, Princes all.
  AGAMEMNON. now, fair Prince Troy, bid good night;
    Ajax commands guard tend you.
  HECTOR. Thanks, good night Greeks' general.
  MENELAUS. Good night, lord.
  HECTOR. Good night, sweet Lord Menelaus.
  THERSITES. Sweet draught! 'Sweet' quoth 'a?
    Sweet sink, sweet sewer!
  ACHILLES. Good night welcome, once, those
    tarry.
  AGAMEMNON. Good night.
                                        Exeunt AGAMEMNON MENELAUS
  ACHILLES. Nestor tarries; too, Diomed,
    Hector company hour two.
  DIOMEDES. cannot, lord; important business,
    tide whereof now. Good night, great Hector.
  HECTOR. Give hand.
  ULYSSES. [Aside TROILUS] Follow torch; to
    Calchas' tent; company.
  TROILUS. Sweet sir, honour me.  
  HECTOR. so, good night.
                         Exit DIOMEDES; ULYSSES TROILUS following
  ACHILLES. Come, come, enter tent.
                                             Exeunt THERSITES
  THERSITES. Diomed's false-hearted rogue, unjust
    knave; trust leers a
    serpent hisses. spend mouth promise, like
    Brabbler hound; performs, astronomers foretell
    it: prodigious, change; sun
    borrows moon Diomed word. rather
    leave Hector dog him. a
    Troyan drab, traitor Calchas' tent. after.
    lechery! incontinent varlets!                Exit




ACT V. SCENE 2.
The Grecian camp. CALCHAS' tent

Enter DIOMEDES

  DIOMEDES. What, here, ho? Speak.
  CALCHAS. [Within] calls?
  DIOMEDES. Diomed. Calchas, think. daughter?
  CALCHAS. [Within] you.

      Enter TROILUS ULYSSES, distance; them
                        THERSITES

  ULYSSES. Stand torch discover us.

                     Enter CRESSIDA

  TROILUS. Cressid him.
  DIOMEDES. now, charge!
  CRESSIDA. Now, sweet guardian! Hark, word you.
[Whispers]
  TROILUS. Yea, familiar!  
  ULYSSES. sing man sight.
  THERSITES. man sing her, cliff;
    noted.
  DIOMEDES. remember?
  CRESSIDA. Remember? Yes.
  DIOMEDES. Nay, do, then;
    mind coupled words.
  TROILUS. remember?
  ULYSSES. List!
  CRESSIDA. Sweet honey Greek, tempt folly.
  THERSITES. Roguery!
  DIOMEDES. Nay, then-
  CRESSIDA. what-
  DIOMEDES. Fo, fo! come, pin; forsworn-
  CRESSIDA. faith, cannot. do?
  THERSITES. juggling trick, secretly open.
  DIOMEDES. swear bestow me?
  CRESSIDA. prithee, hold mine oath;
    Bid that, sweet Greek.
  DIOMEDES. Good night.  
  TROILUS. Hold, patience!
  ULYSSES. now, Troyan!
  CRESSIDA. Diomed!
  DIOMEDES. No, no, good night; fool more.
  TROILUS. Thy must.
  CRESSIDA. Hark! word ear.
  TROILUS. O plague madness!
  ULYSSES. moved, Prince; depart, pray,
    displeasure enlarge itself
    wrathful terms. place dangerous;
    time deadly; beseech you, go.
  TROILUS. Behold, pray you.
  ULYSSES. Nay, good lord, off;
    flow great distraction; come, lord.
  TROILUS. prithee stay.
  ULYSSES. patience; come.
  TROILUS. pray you, stay; hell hell's torments,
    speak word.
  DIOMEDES. so, good night.
  CRESSIDA. Nay, part anger.  
  TROILUS. Doth grieve thee? O withered truth!
  ULYSSES. now, lord?
  TROILUS. Jove, patient.
  CRESSIDA. Guardian! Why, Greek!
  DIOMEDES. Fo, fo! adieu! palter.
  CRESSIDA. faith, not. again.
  ULYSSES. shake, lord, something; go?
    break out.
  TROILUS. strokes cheek.
  ULYSSES. Come, come.
  TROILUS. Nay, stay; Jove, speak word:
    offences
    guard patience. Stay while.
  THERSITES. devil luxury, fat rump potato
    finger, tickles together! Fry, lechery, fry!
  DIOMEDES. you, then?
  CRESSIDA. faith, will, lo; trust else.
  DIOMEDES. Give token surety it.
  CRESSIDA. fetch one.                                  Exit
  ULYSSES. sworn patience.  
  TROILUS. Fear not, lord;
    myself, cognition
    feel. patience.

                    Re-enter CRESSIDA

  THERSITES. pledge; now, now, now!
  CRESSIDA. Here, Diomed, sleeve.
  TROILUS. O beauty! thy faith?
  ULYSSES. lord!
  TROILUS. patient; outwardly will.
  CRESSIDA. sleeve; behold well.
    lov'd me-O false wench!-Give't again.
  DIOMEDES. was't?
  CRESSIDA. matter, ha't again.
    meet to-morrow night.
    prithee, Diomed, visit more.
  THERSITES. sharpens. said, whetstone.
  DIOMEDES. it.
  CRESSIDA. What, this?  
  DIOMEDES. Ay, that.
  CRESSIDA. O gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!
    Thy master lies thinking bed
    thee me, sighs, takes glove,
    memorial dainty kisses it,
    kiss thee. Nay, snatch me;
    takes doth heart withal.
  DIOMEDES. heart before; it.
  TROILUS. swear patience.
  CRESSIDA. it, Diomed; faith, not;
    give else.
  DIOMEDES. this. it?
  CRESSIDA. matter.
  DIOMEDES. Come, was.
  CRESSIDA. 'Twas one's lov'd will.
    But, it, it.
  DIOMEDES. it?
  CRESSIDA. Diana's waiting women yond,
    herself, whose.
  DIOMEDES. To-morrow wear helm,  
    grieve spirit dares challenge it.
  TROILUS. Wert thou devil wor'st thy horn,
    challeng'd.
  CRESSIDA. Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past; not;
    word.
  DIOMEDES. Why, farewell;
    Thou shalt mock Diomed again.
  CRESSIDA. go. speak word
    straight starts you.
  DIOMEDES. fooling.
  THERSITES. I, Pluto; likes you
    Pleases best.
  DIOMEDES. What, come? hour-
  CRESSIDA. Ay, come-O Jove! come. plagu'd.
  DIOMEDES. Farewell till then.
  CRESSIDA. Good night. prithee come.                 Exit DIOMEDES
    Troilus, farewell! eye thee;
    heart eye doth see.
    Ah, poor sex! fault find,
    error eye directs mind.  
    error leads err; O, conclude,
    Minds sway'd eyes full turpitude.                  Exit
  THERSITES. proof strength publish more,
    'My mind turn'd whore.'
  ULYSSES. All's done, lord.
  TROILUS. is.
  ULYSSES. stay we, then?
  TROILUS. make recordation soul
    syllable spoke.
    coact,
    lie publishing truth?
    Sith credence heart,
    esperance obstinately strong,
    doth invert th' attest eyes ears;
    organs deceptious functions
    Created calumniate.
    Cressid here?
  ULYSSES. conjure, Troyan.
  TROILUS. not, sure.
  ULYSSES. was.  
  TROILUS. Why, negation hath taste madness.
  ULYSSES. mine, lord. Cressid now.
  TROILUS. believ'd womanhood.
    Think, mothers; give advantage
    stubborn critics, apt, theme,
    depravation, square general sex
    Cressid's rule. Cressid.
  ULYSSES. hath done, Prince, soil mothers?
  TROILUS. all, she.
  THERSITES. 'a swagger on's eyes?
  TROILUS. she? No; Diomed's Cressida.
    beauty soul, she;
    souls guide vows, vows sanctimonies,
    sanctimony god's delight,
    rule unity itself,
    she. O madness discourse,
    sets itself!
    Bifold authority! reason revolt
    perdition, loss assume reason
    revolt: is, not, Cressid.  
    soul doth conduce fight
    strange nature, thing inseparate
    Divides wider sky earth;
    spacious breadth division
    Admits orifex point subtle
    Ariachne's broken woof enter.
    Instance, O instance! strong Pluto's gates:
    Cressid mine, tied bonds heaven.
    Instance, O instance! strong heaven itself:
    bonds heaven slipp'd, dissolv'd, loos'd;
    knot, five-finger-tied,
    fractions faith, orts love,
    fragments, scraps, bits, greasy relics
    o'er-eaten faith, bound Diomed.
  ULYSSES. worthy Troilus half-attach'd
    passion doth express?
  TROILUS. Ay, Greek; divulged well
    characters red Mars heart
    Inflam'd Venus. young man fancy
    eternal fix'd soul.  
    Hark, Greek: Cressid love,
    weight hate Diomed.
    sleeve mine bear helm;
    casque compos'd Vulcan's skill
    sword bite it. dreadful spout
    shipmen hurricano call,
    Constring'd mass almighty sun,
    dizzy clamour Neptune's ear
    descent prompted sword
    Falling Diomed.
  THERSITES. tickle concupy.
  TROILUS. O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!
    untruths stand thy stained name,
    glorious.
  ULYSSES. O, yourself;
    passion draws ears hither.

                       Enter AENEAS

  AENEAS. seeking hour, lord.  
    Hector, this, arming Troy;
    Ajax, guard, stays conduct home.
  TROILUS. you, Prince. courteous lord, adieu.
    Fairwell, revolted fair!-and, Diomed,
    Stand fast wear castle thy head.
  ULYSSES. bring gates.
  TROILUS. Accept distracted thanks.

            Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS. ULYSSES

  THERSITES. meet rogue Diomed! croak like
    raven; bode, bode. Patroclus give me
    intelligence whore; parrot not
    almond commodious drab. Lechery,
    lechery! wars lechery! holds fashion. A
    burning devil them!                                     Exit




ACT V. SCENE 3.
Troy. PRIAM'S palace

Enter HECTOR ANDROMACHE

  ANDROMACHE. lord ungently temper'd
    stop ears admonishment?
    Unarm, unarm, fight to-day.
  HECTOR. train offend you; in.
    everlasting gods, go.
  ANDROMACHE. dreams will, sure, prove ominous day.
  HECTOR. more, say.

                    Enter CASSANDRA

  CASSANDRA. brother Hector?
  ANDROMACHE. Here, sister, arm'd, bloody intent.
    Consort loud dear petition,
    Pursue knees; dreamt
    bloody turbulence, night
    Hath shapes forms slaughter.
  CASSANDRA. O, 'tis true!  
  HECTOR. Ho! bid trumpet sound.
  CASSANDRA. notes sally, heavens, sweet brother!
  HECTOR. gone, say. gods heard swear.
  CASSANDRA. gods deaf hot peevish vows;
    polluted off'rings, abhorr'd
    spotted livers sacrifice.
  ANDROMACHE. O, persuaded! count holy
    hurt just. lawful,
    give much, violent thefts
    rob behalf charity.
  CASSANDRA. purpose makes strong vow;
    vows purpose hold.
    Unarm, sweet Hector.
  HECTOR. Hold still, say.
    Mine honour weather fate.
    Life man holds dear; dear man
    Holds honour precious dear life.

                      Enter TROILUS
  
    now, young man! Mean'st thou fight to-day?
  ANDROMACHE. Cassandra, call father persuade.
                                                       Exit CASSANDRA
  HECTOR. No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;
    to-day i' th' vein chivalry.
    grow thy sinews till knots strong,
    tempt brushes war.
    Unarm thee, go; doubt thou not, brave boy,
    stand to-day thee Troy.
  TROILUS. Brother, vice mercy you
    fits lion man.
  HECTOR. vice that, good Troilus?
    Chide it.
  TROILUS. times captive Grecian falls,
    fan wind fair sword,
    bid rise live.
  HECTOR. O, 'tis fair play!
  TROILUS. Fool's play, heaven, Hector.
  HECTOR. now! now!
  TROILUS. th' love gods,  
    leave hermit Pity mother;
    armours buckled on,
    venom'd vengeance ride swords,
    Spur ruthful work, rein ruth!
  HECTOR. Fie, savage, fie!
  TROILUS. Hector, 'tis wars.
  HECTOR. Troilus, fight to-day.
  TROILUS. withhold me?
    fate, obedience, hand Mars
    Beck'ning fiery truncheon retire;
    Priamus Hecuba knees,
    eyes o'ergalled recourse tears;
    you, brother, true sword drawn,
    Oppos'd hinder me, stop way,
    ruin.

              Re-enter CASSANDRA, PRIAM

  CASSANDRA. Lay hold him, Priam, hold fast;
    thy crutch; thou lose thy stay,  
    Thou leaning, Troy thee,
    Fall together.
  PRIAM. Come, Hector, come, back.
    Thy wife hath dreamt; thy mother hath visions;
    Cassandra doth foresee; myself
    prophet suddenly enrapt
    thee day ominous.
    Therefore, back.
  HECTOR. Aeneas a-field;
    stand engag'd Greeks,
    faith valour, appear
    morning them.
  PRIAM. Ay, thou shalt go.
  HECTOR. break faith.
    dutiful; therefore, dear sir,
    shame respect; give leave
    consent voice
    forbid me, royal Priam.
  CASSANDRA. O Priam, yield him!
  ANDROMACHE. not, dear father.  
  HECTOR. Andromache, offended you.
    love bear me, in.
                                                      Exit ANDROMACHE
  TROILUS. foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl
    Makes bodements.
  CASSANDRA. O, farewell, dear Hector!
    thou diest. thy eye turns pale.
    thy wounds bleed vents.
    Hark Troy roars; Hecuba cries out;
    poor Andromache shrills dolours forth;
    Behold distraction, frenzy, amazement,
    witless antics, meet,
    cry, Hector! Hector's dead! O Hector!
  TROILUS. Away, away!
  CASSANDRA. Farewell!-yet, soft! Hector, leave.
    Thou dost thyself Troy deceive.                  Exit
  HECTOR. amaz'd, liege, exclaim.
    in, cheer town; forth, fight,
    deeds worth praise night.
  PRIAM. Farewell. gods safety stand thee!  
                           Exeunt severally PRIAM HECTOR. Alarums
  TROILUS. it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,
    lose arm win sleeve.

                     Enter PANDARUS

  PANDARUS. hear, lord? hear?
  TROILUS. now?
  PANDARUS. letter yond poor girl.
  TROILUS. read.
  PANDARUS. whoreson tisick, whoreson rascally tisick troubles
    me, foolish fortune girl, thing,
    another, leave o' th's days; have
    rheum mine eyes too, ache bones that
    man curs'd on't. What
    there?
  TROILUS. Words, words, mere words, matter heart;
    Th' effect doth operate way.
                                                 [Tearing letter]
    Go, wind, wind, turn change together.  
    love words errors feeds,
    edifies deeds.              Exeunt severally




ACT V. SCENE 4.
The plain Troy Grecian camp

Enter THERSITES. Excursions

  THERSITES. clapper-clawing another; look
    on. dissembling abominable varlet, Diomed, same
    scurvy doting foolish young knave's sleeve Troy his
    helm. fain meet, young Troyan ass
    loves whore send Greekish whoremasterly
    villain sleeve back dissembling luxurious drab of
    sleeve-less errand. th' t'other side, policy those
    crafty swearing rascals-that stale mouse-eaten dry cheese,
    Nestor, dog-fox, Ulysses -is prov'd worth a
    blackberry. set up, policy, mongrel cur, Ajax,
    dog bad kind, Achilles; cur,
    Ajax prouder cur Achilles, arm to-day;
    Grecians begin proclaim barbarism, policy
    grows ill opinion.

             Enter DIOMEDES, TROILUS following
  
    Soft! sleeve, t'other.
  TROILUS. Fly not; shouldst thou river Styx
    swim after.
  DIOMEDES. Thou dost miscall retire.
    fly; advantageous care
    Withdrew odds multitude.
    thee.
  THERSITES. Hold thy whore, Grecian; thy whore,
    Troyan-now sleeve, sleeve!
                                 Exeunt TROILUS DIOMEDES fighting

                        Enter HECTOR

  HECTOR. art thou, Greek? Art thou Hector's match?
    Art thou blood honour?
  THERSITES. No, no-I rascal; scurvy railing knave; very
    filthy rogue.
  HECTOR. thee. Live.                               Exit
  THERSITES. God-a-mercy, thou wilt me; plague
    break thy neck frighting me! wenching  
    rogues? swallowed another. laugh at
    miracle. Yet, sort, lechery eats itself. seek
    them.                                                        Exit




ACT V. SCENE 5.
Another part plain

Enter DIOMEDES SERVANT

  DIOMEDES. Go, go, servant, thou Troilus' horse;
    Present fair steed lady Cressid.
    Fellow, commend service beauty;
    chastis'd amorous Troyan,
    knight proof.
  SERVANT. go, lord.                                        Exit

                       Enter AGAMEMNON

  AGAMEMNON. Renew, renew! fierce Polydamus
    Hath beat enon; bastard Margarelon
    Hath Doreus prisoner,
    stands colossus-wise, waving beam,
    pashed corses kings
    Epistrophus Cedius. Polixenes slain;
    Amphimacus Thoas deadly hurt;
    Patroclus ta'en, slain; Palamedes  
    Sore hurt bruis'd. dreadful Sagittary
    Appals numbers. Haste we, Diomed,
    reinforcement, perish all.

                        Enter NESTOR

  NESTOR. Go, bear Patroclus' body Achilles,
    bid snail-pac'd Ajax arm shame.
    thousand Hectors field;
    fights Galathe horse,
    lacks work; anon afoot,
    fly die, scaled sculls
    belching whale; yonder,
    strawy Greeks, ripe edge,
    Fall mower's swath.
    Here, there, everywhere, leaves takes;
    Dexterity obeying appetite
    does, much
    proof call'd impossibility.
  
                       Enter ULYSSES

  ULYSSES. O, courage, courage, courage, Princes! Great
    Achilles arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance.
    Patroclus' wounds rous'd drowsy blood,
    mangled Myrmidons,
    noseless, handless, hack'd chipp'd, to
    him, Crying Hector. Ajax hath lost friend
    foams mouth, arm'd it,
    Roaring Troilus; hath to-day
    Mad fantastic execution,
    Engaging redeeming himself
    careless force forceless care
    luck, spite cunning,
    Bade win all.

                        Enter AJAX

  AJAX. Troilus! thou coward Troilus!                            Exit
  DIOMEDES. Ay, there, there.  
  NESTOR. So, so, draw together.                              Exit
                      Enter ACHILLES

  ACHILLES. Hector?
    Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;
    meet Achilles angry.
    Hector! Hector? Hector.            Exeunt




ACT V. SCENE 6.
Another part plain

Enter AJAX

  AJAX. Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head.

                     Enter DIOMEDES

  DIOMEDES. Troilus, say! Troilus?
  AJAX. wouldst thou?
  DIOMEDES. correct him.
  AJAX. general, thou shouldst office
    Ere correction. Troilus, say! What, Troilus!

                      Enter TROILUS

  TROILUS. O traitor Diomed! Turn thy false face, thou traitor,
    pay thy life thou owest horse.
  DIOMEDES. Ha! art thou there?
  AJAX. fight alone. Stand, Diomed.
  DIOMEDES. prize. upon.  
  TROILUS. Come, both, cogging Greeks; you
                                                      Exeunt fighting

                      Enter HECTOR

  HECTOR. Yea, Troilus? O, fought, youngest brother!

                     Enter ACHILLES

  ACHILLES. thee, ha! thee, Hector!
  HECTOR. Pause, thou wilt.
  ACHILLES. disdain thy courtesy, proud Troyan.
    happy arms use;
    rest negligence befriends thee now,
    thou anon shalt hear again;
    Till when, seek thy fortune.                              Exit
  HECTOR. Fare thee well.
    fresher man,
    expected thee.
  
                     Re-enter TROILUS

    now, brother!
  TROILUS. Ajax hath ta'en Aeneas. be?
    No, flame yonder glorious heaven,
    carry him; ta'en too,
    bring off. Fate, hear say:
    reck thou end life to-day.                   Exit

                    Enter armour

  HECTOR. Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art goodly mark.
    No? wilt thou not? thy armour well;
    frush unlock rivets all
    master it. Wilt thou not, beast, abide?
    then, fly on; hunt thee thy hide.             Exeunt




ACT V. SCENE 7.
Another part plain

Enter ACHILLES, Myrmidons

  ACHILLES. me, Myrmidons;
    Mark say. Attend wheel;
    Strike stroke, breath;
    bloody Hector found,
    Empale weapons round about;
    fellest manner execute arms.
    Follow me, sirs, proceedings eye.
    decreed Hector great die.                   Exeunt

      Enter MENELAUS PARIS, fighting; THERSITES

  THERSITES. cuckold cuckold-maker it. Now, bull!
    now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! double-horn'd Spartan! 'loo,
    Paris, 'loo! bull game. Ware horns, ho!
                                            Exeunt PARIS MENELAUS

                      Enter MARGARELON  

  MARGARELON. Turn, slave, fight.
  THERSITES. art thou?
  MARGARELON. bastard son Priam's.
  THERSITES. bastard too; love bastards. bastard
    begot, bastard instructed, bastard mind, bastard valour, in
    illegitimate. bear bite another, and
    wherefore bastard? heed, quarrel's most
    ominous us: son whore fight whore, tempts
    judgment. Farewell, bastard.
      Exit
  MARGARELON. devil thee, coward!                       Exit




ACT V. SCENE 8.
Another part plain

Enter HECTOR

  HECTOR. putrified core fair without,
    Thy goodly armour hath cost thy life.
    day's work done; good breath:
    Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill blood death!
 [Disarms]

              Enter ACHILLES Myrmidons

  ACHILLES. Look, Hector, sun begins set;
    ugly night breathing heels;
    vail dark'ning sun,
    close day up, Hector's life done.
  HECTOR. unarm'd; forego vantage, Greek.
  ACHILLES. Strike, fellows, strike; man seek.
                                                       [HECTOR falls]
    So, Ilion, fall thou next! Come, Troy, sink down;
    lies thy heart, thy sinews, thy bone.  
    On, Myrmidons, cry amain
    'Achilles hath mighty Hector slain.'
                                                  [A retreat sounded]
    Hark! retire Grecian part.
  MYRMIDON. Troyan trumpets sound like, lord.
  ACHILLES. dragon wing night o'erspreads earth
    And, stickler-like, armies separates.
    half-supp'd sword, frankly fed,
    Pleas'd dainty bait, bed.
                                                 [Sheathes sword]
    Come, tie body horse's tail;
    field Troyan trail.                   Exeunt




ACT V. SCENE 9.
Another part plain

Sound retreat. Shout. Enter AGAMEMNON, AJAX, MENELAUS, NESTOR, DIOMEDES,
and rest, marching

  AGAMEMNON. Hark! hark! shout this?
  NESTOR. Peace, drums!
  SOLDIERS. [Within] Achilles! Achilles! Hector's slain. Achilles!
  DIOMEDES. bruit Hector's slain, Achilles.
  AJAX. so, bragless be;
    Great Hector good man he.
  AGAMEMNON. March patiently along. sent
    pray Achilles tent.
    death gods befriended;
    Great Troy ours, sharp wars ended.
    Exeunt




ACT V. SCENE 10.
Another part plain

Enter AENEAS, PARIS, ANTENOR, DEIPHOBUS

  AENEAS. Stand, ho! masters field.
    home; starve night.

                         Enter TROILUS

  TROILUS. Hector slain.
  ALL. Hector! gods forbid!
  TROILUS. dead, murderer's horse's tail,
    beastly sort, dragg'd shameful field.
    Frown on, heavens, effect rage speed.
    Sit, gods, thrones, smile Troy.
    plagues mercy,
    linger destructions on.
  AENEAS. lord, discomfort host.
  TROILUS. understand so.
    speak flight, fear death,
    dare imminence gods men  
    Address dangers in. Hector gone.
    Priam so, Hecuba?
    screech-owl aye call'd
    Troy, 'Hector's dead.'
    word Priam turn stone;
    Make wells Niobes maids wives,
    Cold statues youth; and, word,
    Scare Troy itself. But, march away;
    Hector dead; say.
    Stay yet. vile abominable tents,
    proudly pight Phrygian plains,
    Titan rise early dare,
    you. And, thou great-siz'd coward,
    space earth sunder hates;
    haunt thee wicked conscience still,
    mouldeth goblins swift frenzy's thoughts.
    Strike free march Troy. comfort go;
    Hope revenge hide woe.

                        Enter PANDARUS  

  PANDARUS. hear you, hear you!
  TROILUS. Hence, broker-lackey. Ignominy shame
    Pursue thy life live aye thy name!
                                              Exeunt PANDARUS
  PANDARUS. goodly medicine aching bones! world! world! thus
    poor agent despis'd! traitors bawds, earnestly are
    set work, ill requited! endeavour be
    lov'd, performance loathed? verse it? What
    instance it? see-

          Full merrily humble-bee doth sing
          Till hath lost honey sting;
          subdu'd armed trail,
          Sweet honey sweet notes fail.

    Good traders flesh, set painted
    cloths. pander's hall,
    eyes, half out, weep Pandar's fall;
    Or, weep, give groans,  
    me, aching bones.
    Brethren sisters hold-door trade,
    months made.
    now, fear this,
    galled goose Winchester hiss.
    Till sweat seek eases,
    time bequeath diseases.                   Exit

THE END
